original: @306b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @306b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ba santa ti la k'a t'i k'a n'a ma /
analyzed: ba santa ti la k'a t'i k'a n'a ma /
translated: Vasantilaka-kathikanāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Commentary on the Spring Essence

original: dpal dpyid kyi thig le la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal dpyid kyi thig le la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Spring Essence.

original: sum cu rtsa drug so so yi //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa drug so so yi //
translated: The nature of each of the thirty-six

original: rang bzhin kun rig he ru ka //
analyzed: rang bzhin kun rig he ru ka //
translated: is the all-knowing Heruka.

original: khyab bdag phyag byas dpyid thig ni //
analyzed: khyab bdag phyag byas dpyid thig ni //
translated: Having paid homage to the all-pervading lord,

original: rim gyis rnam par dbye bar bya //
analyzed: rim gyis rnam par dbye bar bya //
translated: I will gradually analyze the Spring Essence.

original: slob dpon chen po dpal nag po zhabs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po dpal nag po zhabs zhes bya ba /
translated: The great master Śrīpāda,

original: bzhi pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub brnyes pa /
analyzed: bzhi pa phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub brnyes pa /
translated: who attained the siddhi of mahāmudrā,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa la rtul phod pa /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa la rtul phod pa /
translated: was courageous in accomplishing the welfare of self and others,

original: dpal he ru ka mngon sum du gzigs shing gnyis pa lta bu /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon sum du gzigs shing gnyis pa lta bu /
translated: directly beheld Śrī Heruka, and was like a second Buddha.🔽He taught the Tantra of the Auspicious and Marvelous Yoginī,

original: gdul byas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rtogs par byed pa //🔽rnam par bkra shis rmad du byung ba'i rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud ston zhing /
analyzed: gdul byas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rtogs par byed pa // rnam par bkra shis rmad du byung ba'i rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud ston zhing /
translated: which causes disciples to realize the mundane and supramundane,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i spyod pa mthong ba la bskul ba /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i spyod pa mthong ba la bskul ba /
translated: and which especially encourages seeing the exalted conduct.

original: rang gi shes rab la snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i nye bar bstan pa dang / snang bzhin pa'i man ngag gi khyad par de'i don gyi slad du rab tu gsal ba'i @307a * //
analyzed: rang gi shes rab la snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i nye bar bstan pa dang / snang bzhin pa'i man ngag gi khyad par de'i don gyi slad du rab tu gsal ba'i @307a * //
translated: The various aspects that appear to one's wisdom, the special instructions that appear, and for the sake of the meaning of that,

original: dgongs pas brtson par mdzad do //
analyzed: dgongs pas brtson par mdzad do //
translated: he strives with the intention of complete clarity.

original: rang nyid kyis dran pa'i ched du nang gi bdag nyid kyi rim pas bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le 'di mngon par brjod par bzhed pas /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis dran pa'i ched du nang gi bdag nyid kyi rim pas bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le 'di mngon par brjod par bzhed pas /
translated: For the sake of his own memory, he wishes to express this Spring Essence, the ritual method of the glorious Heruka, the Bhagavān, through the stages of his own nature.

original: de nyid rang gi gzugs dang 'tsham pa'i rang 'dra dang bcas pha la phyag byas te /
analyzed: de nyid rang gi gzugs dang 'tsham pa'i rang 'dra dang bcas pha la phyag byas te /
translated: Having bowed to his father, along with his own reflection that is suitable for his form,

original: mnyam dang mi mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga'i gnas la brtson par mdzad do //
analyzed: mnyam dang mi mnyam zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga'i gnas la brtson par mdzad do //
translated: he strives in the place of the ritual method with equal and unequal and so forth.

original: de la dang por re zhig rjod par byed pa la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig rjod par byed pa la sogs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: There, first of all, the author and so forth should be explained.

original: rjod par byed pa ni dpyid kyi thig le'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ni dpyid kyi thig le'o //
translated: The author is the Spring Essence.

original: brjod par bya pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //🔽brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o // brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa ste /
translated: The subject matter is the completion stage.🔽The relationship is the characteristic of the subject matter and the means of expression,

original: sgra dang don dag gi thun mong gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang don dag gi thun mong gi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the common characteristic of words and meanings is the relationship.

original: bde blag tu rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //🔽yang dag pa'i ye shes sngon ma can phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sngon du 'gro ba /
analyzed: bde blag tu rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o // yang dag pa'i ye shes sngon ma can phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sngon du 'gro ba /
translated: Easy understanding is the purpose.🔽The purpose of that is the complete fulfillment of the aims of all migrating beings, preceded by the power of authentic pristine awareness, preceded by the spiritual power of the great seal.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa ni de'i dgos pa'i zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don phun sum tshogs pa ni de'i dgos pa'i zhes pa ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the concise meaning.🔽Having paid homage to that glorious Heruka, the spring drop should be explained.

original: dpal he ru kar mngon par brjod pa de la phyag byas nas dpyid kyi thig le bshad par bya'o zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: dpal he ru kar mngon par brjod pa de la phyag byas nas dpyid kyi thig le bshad par bya'o zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mnyam dang mi mnyam zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam dang mi mnyam zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said to be equal and unequal, and so forth.

original: mnyam pa ni thabs kyi rang bzhin rnams dang / mi mnyam pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin rnams te /
analyzed: mnyam pa ni thabs kyi rang bzhin rnams dang / mi mnyam pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin rnams te /
translated: Equal is the nature of means, and unequal is the nature of wisdom.

original: bde pa chen po de dang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun po lam lngas bsdus pa gang yin pa 'di rnams te /
analyzed: bde pa chen po de dang gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun po lam lngas bsdus pa gang yin pa 'di rnams te /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, which are of the nature of non-dual with that great bliss, are included in the five paths.🔽The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are the nature of the four close mindfulnesses, the four correct abandonings, the four bases of supernatural powers, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the eight branches of the noble path.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar thug pa gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar thug pa gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: The nature of those is the nature of the abiding of the four close mindfulnesses, beginning with the close mindfulness of the body, up to the final correct meditative stabilization.

original: de la chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis po rnams ni mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos nyi shu rtsa gnyis po rnams ni mnyam pa ste /
translated: Among those, the twenty-two factors are equal,

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the mundane path.

original: chos bco lnga po rnams ni mi mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: chos bco lnga po rnams ni mi mnyam pa ste /
translated: The fifteen factors are unequal,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the supramundane path.

original: yang na mnyam pa ni g-yas kyi rtsa las rab tu byung bar yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / mi mnyam pa ni g-yon gyi rtsa las rab tu byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: yang na mnyam pa ni g-yas kyi rtsa las rab tu byung bar yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / mi mnyam pa ni g-yon gyi rtsa las rab tu byung ba rnams te /
translated: Again, the equal are the correct knowledges that arise from the right channel, and the unequal are those that arise from the left channel.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams so sor dga' pa la sogs pa bzhir phye bas dga' ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang / 'khor lo bzhi @307b po la 'jug pa la sogs pa 'jug gnas ldang gsum gyi rim pas dga' ba la sogs pa gsum du phye ba las dga' pa bcu gnyis rnams dang /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams so sor dga' pa la sogs pa bzhir phye bas dga' ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang / 'khor lo bzhi @307b po la 'jug pa la sogs pa 'jug gnas ldang gsum gyi rim pas dga' ba la sogs pa gsum du phye ba las dga' pa bcu gnyis rnams dang /
translated: The six consciousnesses of the eye and so forth are divided into the twenty-four joys, such as joy, and so forth, by the division into four, such as joy, and so forth. The twelve joys are divided into three, such as joy, and so forth, by the process of entering, abiding, and rising in the four wheels.

original: yan lag thams cad tshim pa las ni gcig go //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad tshim pa las ni gcig go //
translated: From the satisfaction of all the limbs, there is one.

original: de ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni lhan cig skyes pa gcig pu'i sku'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das ni lhan cig skyes pa gcig pu'i sku'o //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān, who is the nature of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, is the sole body of the connate.

original: phyi rol du yang de snyed kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang de snyed kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Externally, he is endowed with that many ḍākinīs.

original: de nyid 'khor lo'i dbang phyug nyid du rtogs par bya pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'khor lo'i dbang phyug nyid du rtogs par bya pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand that he is the lord of the wheel,

original: rang lus rtsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang lus rtsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “one’s body is the nāḍīs,” and so on.

original: rang lus rnams su ste rang gi lus kyi sgo brgyad po rnams su rtsa gang yin pa 'di rnams mthong ba dang thos pa dang sgom pa dang myang ba dang reg pa'i tha snyad de /
analyzed: rang lus rnams su ste rang gi lus kyi sgo brgyad po rnams su rtsa gang yin pa 'di rnams mthong ba dang thos pa dang sgom pa dang myang ba dang reg pa'i tha snyad de /
translated: These channels are seen in one's own body, that is, in the eight doors of one's own body, and are called seen, heard, contemplated, tasted, and touched.

original: phyi rol tu khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: phyi rol tu khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams so //
translated: Externally, they are the forms of Khakharā, and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'khor lo bzhi ni sprul pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor lo bzhi ni sprul pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: Similarly, the four wheels are emanation, and so on.

original: lte ba dang / snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi bo'i gnas rnams go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: lte ba dang / snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi bo'i gnas rnams go rims bzhin du /
translated: The wheels of the navel, heart, throat, and head are, respectively,

original: sprul pa dang / chos dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i rang bzhin rnams te /
analyzed: sprul pa dang / chos dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i rang bzhin rnams te /
translated: the nature of the emanation, dharma, enjoyment, and essential body.

original: ye shes dang / sems dang / ngag dang / lus kyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can de rnams su gtso bo ste /
analyzed: ye shes dang / sems dang / ngag dang / lus kyi 'khor lo'i bdag nyid can de rnams su gtso bo ste /
translated: They are the nature of the wheels of gnosis, mind, speech, and body.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin snying po'i gzugs nyid kyis rje bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin snying po'i gzugs nyid kyis rje bor gyur pa'o //
translated: The form of the essence, the nature of awakening, which is the inseparability of the relative and the ultimate, is the lord in those.

original: sngags kyi sku nyid kyis kyang de'i rang bzhin gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngags kyi sku nyid kyis kyang de'i rang bzhin gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of the mantra body is also taught.

original: dbyangs lnga dang bcas phyi mo bcu gnyis gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhis brgyan /
analyzed: dbyangs lnga dang bcas phyi mo bcu gnyis gsal byed sum cu rtsa bzhis brgyan /
translated: The five vowels and the twelve consonants, adorned with the thirty-four

original: dbyangs lnga'i tshig gis gcig lhag pa'i bcu po khong du chud par byas te /
analyzed: dbyangs lnga'i tshig gis gcig lhag pa'i bcu po khong du chud par byas te /
translated: vowels, are to be understood by means of the five vowels, with one added🔽to each.🔽In the center and on the four petals in the directions of the dharmacakra,

original: de la chos kyi 'khor lo'i dbus dang phyogs kyi 'dab ma bzhi la go rims bzhin du h'um aam a'a: hrim kham zhes ba'i dbyangs lngas nye bar mtshon pa /
analyzed: de la chos kyi 'khor lo'i dbus dang phyogs kyi 'dab ma bzhi la go rims bzhin du h'um aam a'a: hrim kham zhes ba'i dbyangs lngas nye bar mtshon pa /
translated: the five vowels hūṃ, aṃ, aḥ, hrīḥ, and khaṃ are arranged, respectively,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sa bon bkod pa las phung po rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sa bon bkod pa las phung po rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: as the seed syllables of the tathāgatas, purifying the aggregates.🔽In the sambhogacakra, the five seed syllables oṃ, aḥ, ā, i, and ī are

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lor yang aom a'a: a'i a'u ae ste sa bon lnga rnams bkod pa las khams lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lor yang aom a'a: a'i a'u ae ste sa bon lnga rnams bkod pa las khams lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: arranged, purifying the five elements.

original: de bzhin du ma ning bzhi po spangs pa'i phyi mo bcu gnyis po g-yon dang 'og tu gdong dang / de nyid g-yas su steng du gdong ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis ni ka yig la sogs steng dang 'og gi gdong rnams ma yig gi rang bzhin gyi @308a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma ning bzhi po spangs pa'i phyi mo bcu gnyis po g-yon dang 'og tu gdong dang / de nyid g-yas su steng du gdong ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis ni ka yig la sogs steng dang 'og gi gdong rnams ma yig gi rang bzhin gyi @308a * //
translated: Likewise, the twenty-four, excluding the four neuters, are the twelve vowels, with their faces below and to the left, and the same, with their faces above and to the right.

original: rjes sung ro dang bcas pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: rjes sung ro dang bcas pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The vowels a, ā, i, ī, u, ū, ṛ, ṝ, ḷ, ḹ, e, ai, o, au, aṃ, aḥ, are completely surrounded by the consonants ka, etc., which have the nature of the vowels.

original: de bzhin du de rnams nyid ma ning dang bcas pa'i bcu drug po nyis 'gyur du gyur pa ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de rnams nyid ma ning dang bcas pa'i bcu drug po nyis 'gyur du gyur pa ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la ste /
translated: Likewise, those same sixteen, together with the neuters, doubled, are on the wheel of great bliss.

original: steng dang 'og gi yi ge gnyis spangs pa ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po nyis 'gyur du gyur pa ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: steng dang 'og gi yi ge gnyis spangs pa ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po nyis 'gyur du gyur pa ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo la'o //
translated: Excluding the two upper and lower letters, the thirty-two, ka, etc., doubled, are on the emanation wheel.

original: rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi dgod pa'i phyogs la ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i mtshams su ya ra la wa rnams so //
analyzed: rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi dgod pa'i phyogs la ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i mtshams su ya ra la wa rnams so //
translated: In the case of arranging the twenty-four channels, ya, ra, la, and va are at the juncture of the dharma wheel.

original: dro ba rnams ni de'i phyi rol du snod du gyur pas gnas so //
analyzed: dro ba rnams ni de'i phyi rol du snod du gyur pas gnas so //
translated: The warm ones are located outside of that, having become the vessel.

original: 'khor lo bzhi po yang dbus su dbyangs kyi dang po dang sprin gyi sgra dang tshangs pa dang mi 'jigs ba'i yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi po yang dbus su dbyangs kyi dang po dang sprin gyi sgra dang tshangs pa dang mi 'jigs ba'i yi ge rnams so //
translated: The four wheels are in the center the first vowel, the sound of clouds, Brahmā, and the syllable of fearlessness.

original: dzva landha ra la ra yig dang / 'og sgo'i rtse mor ksha yig go //
analyzed: dzva landha ra la ra yig dang / 'og sgo'i rtse mor ksha yig go //
translated: In Jvālānala is the syllable ra, and at the tip of the lower door is the syllable kṣa.

original: 'di rnams kyis brgyan pa ni a'a li'i rang bzhin gyi sngags so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis brgyan pa ni a'a li'i rang bzhin gyi sngags so //
translated: Adorned with these, the mantra is of the nature of the vowels.

original: 'dis sa bcu'i dbang phyug nyid du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dis sa bcu'i dbang phyug nyid du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in order to understand the state of being the lord of the ten stages.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye bas gnas pa'i gnas la sogs pa bcu rnams kyi dbang phyug ces pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dbye bas gnas pa'i gnas la sogs pa bcu rnams kyi dbang phyug ces pa'o //
translated: The lord of the ten abodes, and so on, by the divisions of body, speech, and mind.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar bur phyag byas nas dpyid kyi thig le 'chad ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar bur phyag byas nas dpyid kyi thig le 'chad ce na /
translated: Moreover, after bowing in what way will the Spring Discourse be explained?

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po gang yin pa 'di rnams gnas la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po gang yin pa 'di rnams gnas la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: These ten bodhisattva stages, which are of the nature of the Joyful and so on, are the abodes, and so on.

original: sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams su lugs las bzlog pa'i dbye bas spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa'i gnas la de rnams dbang phyug ste khyab bdag go //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams su lugs las bzlog pa'i dbye bas spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa'i gnas la de rnams dbang phyug ste khyab bdag go //
translated: In the cakras of body and so on, the places of the head and so on are the places of the channels that are the nature of Acala and so on, in the reverse order from the system.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu ste /
translated: These are the ten bodhisattva stages,

original: gang rnams su byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rab tu bsreg pa nyid las bden pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang rnams su byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rab tu bsreg pa nyid las bden pa mthong ba ste /
translated: on which the bodhisattva burns away the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, and sees the truth.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings mngon sum du mdzad pa las bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis 'thob par bya ba'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings mngon sum du mdzad pa las bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis 'thob par bya ba'i byang chub tu 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: From directly perceiving the nonconceptual realm, enlightenment is attained in three incalculable aeons.

original: sems bskyed pa ni sa rnams la //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni sa rnams la //
translated: The generation of the enlightenment mind is on the stages.🔽It is asserted that the stages are

original: mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
analyzed: mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
translated: interest, pure superior intention,

original: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: and likewise the elimination of obstructions.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras.

original: 'dir ni pull'i ra la sogs pa'i brdar byas pa'i sa bcu'i kun du spyod pas bsgrub par bya ba thim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku gsum po gtso bor rtogs pa rang rig pa dpal bde ba chen po rnam grangs gzhan yang @308b dag par rdzogs
analyzed: 'dir ni pull'i ra la sogs pa'i brdar byas pa'i sa bcu'i kun du spyod pas bsgrub par bya ba thim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi sku gsum po gtso bor rtogs pa rang rig pa dpal bde ba chen po rnam grangs gzhan yang @308b dag par rdzogs
translated: Here, the glorious great bliss, which is the self-knowing awareness that primarily realizes the three bodies, whose nature is the dissolution and so forth, which are to be accomplished by the conduct on the ten stages symbolized by Pullīramalaya and so forth, is the glorious Heruka, whose nature is perfect complete enlightenment.

original: pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin dpal he ru ka nyid shin tu myur bar mngon sum du byed cing skye ba 'di nyid la rdzogs par byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par bstan pa las khyad par ro //🔽'di las na lhan cig skyes pa kho na chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas la sogs pa'i sa /🔽rnams kyi bdag po nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub kyi rang bzhin dpal he ru ka nyid shin tu myur bar mngon sum du byed cing skye ba 'di nyid la rdzogs par byed pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par bstan pa las khyad par ro // 'di las na lhan cig skyes pa kho na chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas la sogs pa'i sa / rnams kyi bdag po nyid kyi phyir /
translated: This is the difference from the teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das sa bcu'i dbang phyug nyid du rtogs par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sa bcu'i dbang phyug nyid du rtogs par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān is realized to be the lord of the stages, such as the stage of the natural state, which has the nature of the dharmakāya and so forth, because of being the innate nature itself.

original: gnas la sogs pa rnams dang sa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni gzhi mthun pa nyid las phyi nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa rnams dang sa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni gzhi mthun pa nyid las phyi nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The definitions of the stages and so forth and the levels will be explained later, based on their commonalities.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhen /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhen /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?

original: kun 'gro ste /
analyzed: kun 'gro ste /
translated: It is all-pervading.

original: kun ni phung po la sogs pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: kun ni phung po la sogs pa rnams yin la /
translated: All refers to the aggregates and so forth.

original: de la chos nyid kyis gnas pa nyid kyi phyir kun 'gro ste /
analyzed: de la chos nyid kyis gnas pa nyid kyi phyir kun 'gro ste /
translated: It is all-pervading because it abides in all of those by nature.

original: chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: It is the basic space of phenomena.

original: sems can kun gyi rang snying dbus son zhes pa la /
analyzed: sems can kun gyi rang snying dbus son zhes pa la /
translated: It is present in the center of the heart of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun ni phyugs dang bya dang sprul dang mi la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems can kun ni phyugs dang bya dang sprul dang mi la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All sentient beings are cattle, birds, reptiles, humans, and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi rang gi snying gi dbus son te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi snying gi dbus son te /
translated: It is present in the center of their individual hearts.

original: snying ga'i padma kha sbyor du zhugs pa ze'u 'bru'i nang du gnas pa'i sa la sogs pa'i khams bzhi'i rang bzhin steng dang 'og tu nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su son pa /
analyzed: snying ga'i padma kha sbyor du zhugs pa ze'u 'bru'i nang du gnas pa'i sa la sogs pa'i khams bzhi'i rang bzhin steng dang 'og tu nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su son pa /
translated: It is present in the center of the mandalas of the sun and moon above and below, abiding in the center of the filaments of the joined lotus of the heart, which is the nature of the four elements of earth and so forth.

original: skra rtse brgya stong gi tshad phra zhing shin tu phra ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin 'khor lor thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma dang dpa' bo dbyer med pa'i gzugs kyis thig le'i rang bzhin du gnas pa ste /🔽rtag tu snying la gnas pa yi //
analyzed: skra rtse brgya stong gi tshad phra zhing shin tu phra ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin 'khor lor thams cad kyi mkha' 'gro ma dang dpa' bo dbyer med pa'i gzugs kyis thig le'i rang bzhin du gnas pa ste / rtag tu snying la gnas pa yi //
translated: The nature of the extremely subtle element of attributes, the size of the tip of one hundred thousandth of a hair, exists as the nature of a drop in the form of the indivisible dakinis and heroes of all chakras.

original: thig le gcig pu yi ge med //
analyzed: thig le gcig pu yi ge med //
translated: The single drop, which always abides in the heart, is without syllables.

original: de sgom byed pa'i skye bo la //
analyzed: de sgom byed pa'i skye bo la //
translated: For the person who meditates on that,

original: mchog gi ye shes skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog gi ye shes skye bar 'gyur //
translated: supreme exalted wisdom will arise.🔽And:

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / kha spyor kha sbyor sgom pa na //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / kha spyor kha sbyor sgom pa na //
translated: Meditating on the union of the two,

original: thig le gcig pu snang ba ste //
analyzed: thig le gcig pu snang ba ste //
translated: the single drop appears.

original: kha sbyor ma yin sbyar gyur na //
analyzed: kha sbyor ma yin sbyar gyur na //
translated: If the two are not united,

original: thig le thig le min nyid 'gro //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thig le thig le min nyid 'gro // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the drop becomes neither a drop.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: nam mkha'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rnam pa ste /
translated: It is the aspect of space,

original: chos kyi sku nyid kyi phyir ram nam mkha' lnga'i rnam pa'i sum skor ba la sogs pa'i rtsa rnams su reg cing rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku nyid kyi phyir ram nam mkha' lnga'i rnam pa'i sum skor ba la sogs pa'i rtsa rnams su reg cing rtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the dharmakaya itself or because it is realized and touched in the channels, such as the three coils and so on, which have the aspect of the five spaces.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: bha ga'i dbus su nam mkha' gang //
analyzed: bha ga'i dbus su nam mkha' gang //
translated: The space in the middle of the bhaga

original: nam mkha' lnga rnams kyis brgyan pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' lnga rnams kyis brgyan pa //
translated: is adorned with the five spaces.

original: lte ba dang ni ge sar bcas //
analyzed: lte ba dang ni ge sar bcas //
translated: It has a navel and a pericarp,

original: 'dab ma brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad kyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: and is adorned with eight petals.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: mchog tu zhi zhes bya ba ni //🔽don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mchog go //🔽spros pa @309a * //
analyzed: mchog tu zhi zhes bya ba ni // don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir mchog go // spros pa @309a * //
translated: Supreme peace means:

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: it is supreme because of being the ultimate mind of enlightenment, and it is peace because of being free from elaborations.🔽In the same way, the passage beginning with

original: de bzhin du dpal he ru ka zhes pa la sogs bas don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid du yang dag par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal he ru ka zhes pa la sogs bas don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid du yang dag par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the glorious Heruka is stated in order to realize the nature of the ultimate and relative mind of enlightenment.

original: dpal he ru ka ni /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka ni /
translated: The glorious Heruka

original: rgyud du gsungs pa'i rnam par thar ba bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rgyud du gsungs pa'i rnam par thar ba bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: is the nature of the four modes of liberation taught in the tantra.

original: lhan cig skyes pa gcig pu chos kyi sku de'i rang bzhin dang de'i ngo bo nyid de ni mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa gcig pu chos kyi sku de'i rang bzhin dang de'i ngo bo nyid de ni mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: That is the nature and the very essence of the sole innate, the dharmakāya, which is the reality of supreme nirvāṇa.

original: de bzhin du bzhengs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzhengs pa ni /
translated: Likewise, the arising is

original: sprul pas bzhengs pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pas bzhengs pa'o //
translated: the arising of the emanation.🔽The one who is united with Heruka in the practice of the arising of the flowers of clairvoyance, etc.,

original: gang 'di phag mo'i rnam pas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dpyid kyis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i me tog 'byung ba'i sbyor bas he ru ka dang yang dag par sbyor bzhin pa ni thig le lta bu ste thig ler snang ba'i rang bzhin can gyi ye shes
analyzed: gang 'di phag mo'i rnam pas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dpyid kyis mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i me tog 'byung ba'i sbyor bas he ru ka dang yang dag par sbyor bzhin pa ni thig le lta bu ste thig ler snang ba'i rang bzhin can gyi ye shes
translated: in the form of a sow, is the drop-like,

original: kyi me 'bar ba /
analyzed: kyi me 'bar ba /
translated: the wisdom fire that blazes,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi bud shing sreg par byed pa de'i gang yin pa 'di rnams ni spro ba te /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi bud shing sreg par byed pa de'i gang yin pa 'di rnams ni spro ba te /
translated: the one who burns the fuel of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: dbu ma'i lam gyi steng du 'khor lo gsum la 'jug ste /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gyi steng du 'khor lo gsum la 'jug ste /
translated: Those who are the emanations enter into the three wheels on the path of the central channel.

original: des na 'bar ba ste de'i 'od dang 'od gang gis yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bar ba ste de'i 'od dang 'od gang gis yin pa de yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the blazing, the light of that, and the one who is that light.

original: de bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid de rigs gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ra sa n'a la sogs pa'i rtsa gsum po gang yin pa 'di ni rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid de rigs gsum gyi rang bzhin gyi ra sa n'a la sogs pa'i rtsa gsum po gang yin pa 'di ni rgyas pa ste /
translated: Likewise, this is the expansion of the three nāḍīs, which are the nature of the three families, namely, the rasanā, and so on, of the body, speech, and mind.

original: pull'i ra la sogs pa'i gnas rnams dang / sprul pa la sogs pa rnams su rgyas pa de'o //
analyzed: pull'i ra la sogs pa'i gnas rnams dang / sprul pa la sogs pa rnams su rgyas pa de'o //
translated: This is the expansion in the places, such as Pulliramalaya, and so on, and in the emanations, and so on.🔽This is the accumulation of the twenty-four, the one hundred twenty, the twenty-one thousand, and the seventy-two thousand nāḍīs.

original: bsags pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang nyi shu lhag pa'i brgya dang / stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs can gyi rtsa'i 'khor lo gang yin pa 'di rnam ni mtha' yas pa'i dpa' mo'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bsags pa gang yin pa 'di ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang nyi shu lhag pa'i brgya dang / stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs can gyi rtsa'i 'khor lo gang yin pa 'di rnam ni mtha' yas pa'i dpa' mo'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The wheel is the nature of the infinite heroines.

original: kun rdzob byang chub sems kyi rnam pas der mgon po ste khyab bdag go //
analyzed: kun rdzob byang chub sems kyi rnam pas der mgon po ste khyab bdag go //
translated: The lord, the all-pervading lord, is there in the aspect of relative bodhicitta.

original: yang smras pa /🔽rkang pa gsang ba bshang lam lte snying mgo bo la //
analyzed: yang smras pa / rkang pa gsang ba bshang lam lte snying mgo bo la //
translated: Again, it is said:🔽The feet, the secret, the anus, the navel, the heart, and the head

original: khams kyi dkyil 'khor du son ri rab rgyab tu 'gro //
analyzed: khams kyi dkyil 'khor du son ri rab rgyab tu 'gro //
translated: are the mandala of the elements, the back of Meru.

original: rtsa rnams dam tshig rdo rje'i padmar son pa yi //
analyzed: rtsa rnams dam tshig rdo rje'i padmar son pa yi //
translated: The channels are the lotus of the pledge-vajra,

original: gnyi ga'i sems ni he ru ka ste khyod la 'dud //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i sems ni he ru ka ste khyod la 'dud //
translated: the mind of both is Heruka: homage to you!

original: gsang ba'i ko ka'i chu yi ze'u 'bru'i nang du ni //
analyzed: gsang ba'i ko ka'i chu yi ze'u 'bru'i nang du ni //
translated: In the secret water-lily of the kokila,

original: mkha' ste nam mkha' chen po lnga po gnas pa yin //
analyzed: mkha' ste nam mkha' chen po lnga po gnas pa yin //
translated: the five great spaces, the sky, are present.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi thig le gnyis min gnyis su med //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi thig le gnyis min gnyis su med //
translated: The bindu of the dharmadhatu is neither two nor non-two,

original: lhan skyes bdag nyid he ru ka ste khyod la 'dud //
analyzed: lhan skyes bdag nyid he ru ka ste khyod la 'dud //
translated: the innate nature is Heruka: homage to you!

original: sprin nag brtsegs pa'i nang du 'gyu ba'i glog @309b las ni //
analyzed: sprin nag brtsegs pa'i nang du 'gyu ba'i glog @309b las ni //
translated: From the lightning that moves within the mass of black clouds,

original: lhag pa'i 'od de mchog tu brtsegs pas sems can dang // snod du bcas pa rab tu sreg par byed pa yi //
analyzed: lhag pa'i 'od de mchog tu brtsegs pas sems can dang // snod du bcas pa rab tu sreg par byed pa yi //
translated: the light that is superior, by its supreme mass, burns🔽the world and the vessel,

original: 'gro ba'i ma ste he ru ka ma khyod la 'dud //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ma ste he ru ka ma khyod la 'dud //
translated: the mother of beings, Herukama: homage to you!🔽The mass of water in the hole of the navel chakra,

original: lte ba'i 'khor lo'i bug pa'i chu yi phung po dang // rdo rje dang ni chu skyes 'dus ba las byung ba //
analyzed: lte ba'i 'khor lo'i bug pa'i chu yi phung po dang // rdo rje dang ni chu skyes 'dus ba las byung ba //
translated: the union of the vajra and the lotus,🔽is the drink of the taste of nectar,

original: bdud rtsi'i ro yi btung ba la ni cher srid pa'i //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i ro yi btung ba la ni cher srid pa'i //
translated: the great existence,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the supreme bliss of the mind,🔽the

original: rta gdong gi ni me 'od khyod la phyag bgyi'o //
analyzed: rta gdong gi ni me 'od khyod la phyag bgyi'o //
translated: I pay homage to you, the firelight of Hayagrīva.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so forth.

original: chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyis phyag byas nas //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyis phyag byas nas //
translated: Having paid homage with the nature of the dharmakāya,

original: de las gzhan gyis kyang phyag byas pa //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyis kyang phyag byas pa //
translated: he pays homage with something else.

original: 'gro ba'i rang gzhan don gyi bde ba zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang gzhan don gyi bde ba zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: He says, “The bliss of self and other for migrating beings.”

original: 'gro ba'i ni khams gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ni khams gsum gyi'o //
translated: Migrating beings are those of the three realms.

original: rang rig pa'i bde ba ni rang bde ba ste /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bde ba ni rang bde ba ste /
translated: Self-bliss is the bliss of one’s own continuum.

original: rdo rje'i kha las ma 'phos pa'i gnas skabs su longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin dang / de las gzhan du gzhan don gyi bde ba ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo rje'i kha las ma 'phos pa'i gnas skabs su longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin dang / de las gzhan du gzhan don gyi bde ba ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the saṃbhogakāya is the state of not moving from the vajra. The bliss of others is the nature of the nirmāṇakāya.

original: gang 'dir 'gro ba skyed pa de kho na de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'dir 'gro ba skyed pa de kho na de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa ste /
translated: Here, the creation of migrating beings is the creation of the tathāgatas.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: Because of being their nature, they are migrating beings.

original: de kha sbyor thig ler yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kha sbyor thig ler yang gsungs pa /
translated: It also says in the Drop of the Secret Moon:

original: khrag ni mkha' 'gro kun rang bzhin //
analyzed: khrag ni mkha' 'gro kun rang bzhin //
translated: Blood is the nature of all dakinis.

original: padmar snang ba sbyor ba las //
analyzed: padmar snang ba sbyor ba las //
translated: From the appearance of the lotus,

original: padma gar dbang du ni brjod //
analyzed: padma gar dbang du ni brjod //
translated: Is said to be Padmanarteshvara.

original: steng du spro zhing 'od gsal ba //🔽rdo rje nyi ma mchog tu bshad //
analyzed: steng du spro zhing 'od gsal ba // rdo rje nyi ma mchog tu bshad //
translated: Radiating above, luminous,🔽Is the supreme Vajrasūrya.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gror yang //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gror yang //
translated: In the glorious Vajradaka,

original: snang zhing 'bar ba gang yin de //
analyzed: snang zhing 'bar ba gang yin de //
translated: Whatever is luminous and blazing,

original: thub chen rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: thub chen rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: That is the great sage Vairochana.

original: dga' bral mtha' de rta mchog 'di //
analyzed: dga' bral mtha' de rta mchog 'di //
translated: The end of the separation of joy is this supreme horse,

original: rlung rnams sna tshogs 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung rnams sna tshogs 'byung phyir ro //
translated: Because the winds arise in various ways.

original: zhes so // 'di nyid las sngon du gsungs pa'i tshul kho nas phag mos yang dag par 'khyud pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: zhes so // 'di nyid las sngon du gsungs pa'i tshul kho nas phag mos yang dag par 'khyud pa'i sku'o //
translated: The body is embraced by Vārāhī in the manner previously described in this [tantra].

original: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa la ming med kyang kun rdzob kyis shr'i he ru ka zhes pa'i mngon par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka mngon par brjod pa la ming med kyang kun rdzob kyis shr'i he ru ka zhes pa'i mngon par brjod pa las bcom ldan 'das su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the Shri Heruka Tantra, although there is no name, it should be understood that the Bhagavān is referred to as the Heruka of the relative, who is Shar.

original: h'um yig brag ca lta bu'i sgras dga' zhing yid 'phrog pa gang las dpyid kyi thig le gang yin pa de nyid n'a da ste /
analyzed: h'um yig brag ca lta bu'i sgras dga' zhing yid 'phrog pa gang las dpyid kyi thig le gang yin pa de nyid n'a da ste /
translated: The nada that is the spring drop is from the sound of the syllable hūṃ, which is like an echo, and delights and captivates the mind.

original: des sgra byed cing sgrogs pa ni thig le ste bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: des sgra byed cing sgrogs pa ni thig le ste bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The one who makes and proclaims sound is the bindu, the Bhagavān.

original: 'di rnams nyid las /
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid las /
translated: From these very [channels],

original: n'a da dang thig le sgrogs pa kho na de dag gis snyoms par snyoms pa snye /
analyzed: n'a da dang thig le sgrogs pa kho na de dag gis snyoms par snyoms pa snye /
translated: the nāda and the proclamation of the bindu are the union of those two.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Since it transcends the stage of generation, it is the nature of the stage of completion.

original: phyag byas nas zhes pa ni snga ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: phyag byas nas zhes pa ni snga ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: Having bowed to that, the connection with the previous [verse] is as follows.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽rnal 'byor gnas las phyung ba yi //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / rnal 'byor gnas las phyung ba yi //
translated: How?🔽The spring bindu

original: dpyid kyi thig @310a * //🔽le brjod par bya //
analyzed: dpyid kyi thig @310a * // le brjod par bya //
translated: is extracted from the abode of yoga.

original: rnal 'byor gyi gnas bzhi po bdag dang gzhan dang sngags dang de kho na nyid du brjod pa go rims bzhin du lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang spyi bo rnams las phyung ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi gnas bzhi po bdag dang gzhan dang sngags dang de kho na nyid du brjod pa go rims bzhin du lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa dang spyi bo rnams las phyung ba ste /
translated: The four abodes of yoga, which are described as self, other, mantra, and reality, are extracted from the navel, heart, throat, and head, respectively.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i sbyor bas rab tu 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i sbyor bas rab tu 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: They are engaged by the practice of coming and going.

original: de rjod par byed pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga la yang dpyid kyi thig le la zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga la yang dpyid kyi thig le la zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The ritual of the means of achievement that expresses that should also be called the Spring Drop.

original: rol rnyed ma 'phrogs pa'i snyan dngags bzhin no //
analyzed: rol rnyed ma 'phrogs pa'i snyan dngags bzhin no //
translated: Like the poetry of Harinī, which is not stolen.

original: 'di gang las 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang las 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: From what is this [Tantra] derived?🔽It is said:

original: bshad pa / dpal 'khor lo sdom pa zhes bya pa'i rgyud las te /
analyzed: bshad pa / dpal 'khor lo sdom pa zhes bya pa'i rgyud las te /
translated: From the Tantra called Śrī-Cakraśamvara.

original: der gang zhig phyi rol dang nang gi mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin du skyes pa dang ma skyes par brjod pa'i rim pa'i lam de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis bshad par bya'o zhes snga ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: der gang zhig phyi rol dang nang gi mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin du skyes pa dang ma skyes par brjod pa'i rim pa'i lam de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis bshad par bya'o zhes snga ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: There, the path that is described as having the characteristics of external and internal [reality], and likewise as arisen and unarisen, should be explained by the nature of reality.

original: de ltar na bskyed pa'i rim pa la sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la ni de'i grangs kyi bde pa chen po'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bskyed pa'i rim pa la sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la ni de'i grangs kyi bde pa chen po'o //
translated: Thus, in the creation stage, [the path] is the wheel of the mandala with thirty-seven parts, and in the completion stage, it is the great bliss with that number of parts.

original: gzhan du rtsa'i 'khor lo nyid du yang rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan du rtsa'i 'khor lo nyid du yang rtogs par byed do //
translated: [The path] is also understood as the wheel of the channels elsewhere.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: The glorious Vajraḍāka

original: zhes pa la sogs pas dgos pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas dgos pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, he declares the purpose.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma gang yin pa 'di ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma gang yin pa 'di ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The Blessed Lady is the Vajra dakini.

original: rdo rje ni gzhom du med cing 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni gzhom du med cing 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: Vajra means invincible and unchanging.

original: sgo'i gnas su gzhom du med pa'o //
analyzed: sgo'i gnas su gzhom du med pa'o //
translated: The invincible is the place of the door.

original: mkha' 'gro gdong la ro gcig tu yang dag par 'dzag ba'i bdud rtsi'o ma'i rgya mtsho dba' rlabs su phye ba la grol bar 'gro zhing 'gro'o zhes pa /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro gdong la ro gcig tu yang dag par 'dzag ba'i bdud rtsi'o ma'i rgya mtsho dba' rlabs su phye ba la grol bar 'gro zhing 'gro'o zhes pa /
translated: The dakini is the ocean of the milk of the nectar that flows in a single taste from the face of the corpse, divided into waves.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ste /
translated: She is the Vajra dakini, who goes and comes.

original: thig le'i zer ma stong phrag lta bur 'bar ba'i sku can gyi bcom ldan 'das ma ye shes kyi me'i 'od de phag mo'o //
analyzed: thig le'i zer ma stong phrag lta bur 'bar ba'i sku can gyi bcom ldan 'das ma ye shes kyi me'i 'od de phag mo'o //
translated: The Blessed Lady is the pig, whose body blazes with the light of the thousand rays of the bindu, the light of the fire of wisdom.

original: de'i 'od dngos grub ni chos nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid las /
analyzed: de'i 'od dngos grub ni chos nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid las /
translated: Her light is the siddhi, which is the perfection of the nature itself of reality.

original: rang bzhin kho na rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin kho na rdzogs pa ste /
translated: It is the nature itself that is perfected,

original: thams cad kho na rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kho na rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because everything is just awareness.

original: ci phyi rol du gnas pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci phyi rol du gnas pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it located outside?

original: ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: No, he says.

original: rang lus te /
analyzed: rang lus te /
translated: One’s own body.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi lus la rnam par gnas shing 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi lus la rnam par gnas shing 'dug pa'o //
translated: He is situated in the body, which is of the nature of the aggregates, etc.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i rim pa kho nas 'di nyid las dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i rim pa kho nas 'di nyid las dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is perceived in this very [Hevajra Tantra] by the very process stated earlier.

original: des na rgyud rgyas pa rtogs par bya mi nus pa'i gang zag 'dod pa shin tu chung ba rnams kyis gsal bar khong du chung cing /
analyzed: des na rgyud rgyas pa rtogs par bya mi nus pa'i gang zag 'dod pa shin tu chung ba rnams kyis gsal bar khong du chung cing /
translated: Therefore, those persons of little desire who are unable to understand the extensive tantra will clearly understand it,

original: de ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur @310b ba yin no //
analyzed: de ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur @310b ba yin no //
translated: and they will understand it as it is.

original: rgyu 'di las gzhung shin tu nyung ngur rdzogs pa'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu 'di las gzhung shin tu nyung ngur rdzogs pa'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this [Hevajra Tantra] should be stated in order to make the complete completion stage understood in a very brief text.

original: 'dir / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la 'dzegs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i dbang pos dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg dang bsgom pa dang bzlas pa rnams ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la 'dzegs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i dbang pos dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg dang bsgom pa dang bzlas pa rnams ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: Here, how should the powerful yogi who has ascended the completion stage perform the maṇḍala, homa, meditation, and recitation?

original: ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “No.”🔽[He] does not perform the generation stage,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'am /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'am /
translated: The stage of generation.🔽🔽

original: sku gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di rnams nyid ni thams cad du de btags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol gyi yo byad kyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bcos ma ste byas pa'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di rnams nyid ni thams cad du de btags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / phyi rol gyi yo byad kyis bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bcos ma ste byas pa'o //
translated: These very images and so forth are all imputed, and because they are to be accomplished by external means, they are fabricated, that is, made.

original: 'dus pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus pa ni /
translated: The assembly is

original: rnam par nyams pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa'i chos can te /
translated: a dharma of degeneration,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽des na brdzun zhing g-yo ba byed pa byas pa de rnams kyis sam /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no // des na brdzun zhing g-yo ba byed pa byas pa de rnams kyis sam /
translated: like a pot and so forth.

original: sgom pa rnams kyis ci bya zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: sgom pa rnams kyis ci bya zhes dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, what is the use of those fabricated, false, deceptive actions, or of the meditations?🔽Thus thinks the author.

original: gal te de ltar na de bcom ldan 'das kyis ci ltar bstan zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na de bcom ldan 'das kyis ci ltar bstan zhes dogs na /
translated: If that is so, how was it taught by the Transcendent Victor?

original: bcos ma'i bya ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcos ma'i bya ba zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He declares “fabricated actions” and so forth.

original: sngar bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bcos ma'i bya ba gang yin pa 'di rnams kyang yod pa na de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bcos ma'i bya ba gang yin pa 'di rnams kyang yod pa na de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: These fabricated actions, such as the previously explained maṇḍala and so forth, are existent, and their nature is

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams kyi dngos grub kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs shing khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams kyi dngos grub kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs shing khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: It is taught for the sake of realizing and comprehending the nature of the powers of the maṇḍala, etc.

original: de nyid 'bras bu'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that they themselves are the nature of the result.

original: 'di rnams nyid kyi rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos grub ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid kyi rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos grub ste /
translated: The nature or essence of those is the innate power.

original: 'chad bzhin pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni de'i rnal 'byor la brten nas thams cad du phyi rol gyi bcos ma kho na'o //
analyzed: 'chad bzhin pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni de'i rnal 'byor la brten nas thams cad du phyi rol gyi bcos ma kho na'o //
translated: The maṇḍala, etc., that are being explained are all external fabrications based on the yoga of that.🔽If it is certain that

original: nges na / dkyil 'khor lus la bsgom par bya ;
analyzed: nges na / dkyil 'khor lus la bsgom par bya ;
translated: the maṇḍala is meditated on in the body,

original: / zhes kyang dgongs so //
analyzed: / zhes kyang dgongs so //
translated: that is also the intention.

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la mos pa rnams rab tu gzhug pas re zhig de sgom par byed la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la mos pa rnams rab tu gzhug pas re zhig de sgom par byed la /
translated: Those who are devoted to the maṇḍala, etc., are introduced, and so they meditate on that for a while.

original: phyi nas de nyid kyi sgo nas rang bzhin gyi dngos grub sgrub pa de yod de /
analyzed: phyi nas de nyid kyi sgo nas rang bzhin gyi dngos grub sgrub pa de yod de /
translated: Later, by means of that, they accomplish the innate power.

original: de rnams kyi phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa dor nas nang gi bdag nyid rnams la 'jug par byed do zhes pa de bstan pa yang dgos pa dang bcas pa yin no //🔽ji ltar pha rol don gnyer rnams //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyi rol du mngon par zhen pa dor nas nang gi bdag nyid rnams la 'jug par byed do zhes pa de bstan pa yang dgos pa dang bcas pa yin no // ji ltar pha rol don gnyer rnams //
translated: Having abandoned attachment to those external things, one should enter into the internal ones. This is the purpose of the teaching.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe gsungs te /
translated: The example is stated beginning with “Just as those who seek the other shore . . .”

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnams kyi pha rol thob pa don du gnyer ba rnams gzings kyi bzhon pa dang skya ba la sogs pa'i 'bad @311a * //🔽pa la rten par byed la /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnams kyi pha rol thob pa don du gnyer ba rnams gzings kyi bzhon pa dang skya ba la sogs pa'i 'bad @311a * // pa la rten par byed la /
translated: Those who seek to reach the other shore of the ocean, etc., rely on the effort of a ship, oars, etc.

original: pha rol thob pa na rtsva lta bur 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: pha rol thob pa na rtsva lta bur 'dor bar byed do //
translated: When they reach the other shore, they abandon them as if they were straw.

original: de kho na bzhin du phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor thob nas nang gi bdag nyid can rang bzhin gyi dngos grub thob pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de thob pa na phyi rol 'dor bar byed do zhes pa'i don te //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor thob nas nang gi bdag nyid can rang bzhin gyi dngos grub thob pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de thob pa na phyi rol 'dor bar byed do zhes pa'i don te //
translated: In the same way, having reached the external maṇḍala, one who possesses the attainment of the natural accomplishments of the internal nature, when one attains that, one abandons the external. This is the meaning.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: thabs byung thob pas spang bya gang //
analyzed: thabs byung thob pas spang bya gang //
translated: “What is to be abandoned by the attainment of the means?

original: de ni thabs zhes bstan pa yin //
analyzed: de ni thabs zhes bstan pa yin //
translated: That is taught as the method.

original: zhes pa'i gsungs las /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsungs las /
translated: From that statement,🔽the precious person who has previously trained, by just a moment of that, in the contrived maṇḍala, and so on, should imagine the uncontrived maṇḍala and make it uncontrived.

original: rin po che'i gang zag sngon du goms pa de ni bcos pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa de rnams yud tsam kho nas ma bcos pa'i dkyil 'khor du lhag par mos par byed cing bcos ma ma yin par byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par
analyzed: rin po che'i gang zag sngon du goms pa de ni bcos pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa de rnams yud tsam kho nas ma bcos pa'i dkyil 'khor du lhag par mos par byed cing bcos ma ma yin par byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni khyad par
translated: That is the difference.

original: ro // de lta bu'i rigs can ni rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: ro // de lta bu'i rigs can ni rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: A person of that type is difficult to find.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la yid ches par dka' ba tsandan la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la yid ches par dka' ba tsandan la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: It is difficult to have confidence in the stage of completion.

original: mtshan ma'i khyad par rnams kyis de'i rigs can du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i khyad par rnams kyis de'i rigs can du shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that type by the special signs.

original: du ba las ni mer shes dang // chu skyar las ni chu yin te //
analyzed: du ba las ni mer shes dang // chu skyar las ni chu yin te //
translated: From smoke, one knows fire; from a curlew, water.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yi ni rigs //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yi ni rigs //
translated: The type of the bodhisattva

original: blo dang ldan pas mtshan mar shes //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas mtshan mar shes // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is known by the wise through signs.

original: 'dir re zhig rang bzhin yongs su shes pa kho na byang chub bo //
analyzed: 'dir re zhig rang bzhin yongs su shes pa kho na byang chub bo //
translated: Therefore, here, the knowledge of the nature is awakening.

original: bsgom par bya bzhin pa yod pa ma yin na yang gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa /
analyzed: bsgom par bya bzhin pa yod pa ma yin na yang gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa /
translated: Even though there is no meditation that is being done, it is clear.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal bas byang chub kyi rgyu dag tu 'gyur zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal bas byang chub kyi rgyu dag tu 'gyur zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa /
translated: Since it is clear, there is the doubt that it is a cause of awakening.

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reply is “the maṇḍala, etc.,” and so on.

original: bcos ma'i bsam pa can brtags pa'i rnal 'byor pa la dkyil 'khor la sogs pa can dang por gsungs te /
analyzed: bcos ma'i bsam pa can brtags pa'i rnal 'byor pa la dkyil 'khor la sogs pa can dang por gsungs te /
translated: The maṇḍala, etc., are first taught for the yogi/nī who is a fabricator with a fabricated mind.

original: bri ba'am yid la bya'o //🔽de thams cad legs sam /
analyzed: bri ba'am yid la bya'o // de thams cad legs sam /
translated: They are drawn or mentally created.

original: mi legs kyang rung ste de sgom par byed bzhin pa la re zhig gsal bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mi legs kyang rung ste de sgom par byed bzhin pa la re zhig gsal bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Whether all of that is good or not, it is clear for the one who is meditating.

original: de de kho na nyid ni ma yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
analyzed: de de kho na nyid ni ma yin par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
translated: However, it should be said that that is not reality.

original: ral pas brgyan zhing 'od dang ldan //🔽phrag par se ral dkar po dang // spyi blugs thogs shing thal ba yis //
analyzed: ral pas brgyan zhing 'od dang ldan // phrag par se ral dkar po dang // spyi blugs thogs shing thal ba yis //
translated: Adorned with matted hair, radiant,🔽with a white sacred thread over the shoulder,🔽holding a water pot, and smeared

original: ra ri can du spags pa yang //
analyzed: ra ri can du spags pa yang //
translated: with ashes,

original: 'dir ni gang gang yang dang yang //
analyzed: 'dir ni gang gang yang dang yang //
translated: here, whatever is repeatedly

original: rmongs chen rnams kyis sgom byed pa //
analyzed: rmongs chen rnams kyis sgom byed pa //
translated: The great fools who meditate

original: de de'i mdun du snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de de'i mdun du snang bar 'gyur //
translated: that will appear before them.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus he says.

original: las rab 'byams yang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ltar de kho na nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram @311b zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa las rab 'byams dang bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sna tshogs pas dub pa'i bsgrub bya la /
analyzed: las rab 'byams yang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ltar de kho na nyid ma yin par 'gyur ram @311b zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa las rab 'byams dang bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sna tshogs pas dub pa'i bsgrub bya la /
translated: If one doubts that the extensive rites are not reality, like the maṇḍala and so forth, he says “along with the extensive rites” and so forth.

original: las rab 'byams dang ldan pa'i rgyud bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: las rab 'byams dang ldan pa'i rgyud bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavān taught the tantra endowed with the extensive rites for the sake of the practitioner who is exhausted by diversity.

original: de de kho na nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de de kho na nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not reality.

original: dgongs pas kyang dngos po dam pa lhan cig skyes pa yang dag par rig cing myang bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dgongs pas kyang dngos po dam pa lhan cig skyes pa yang dag par rig cing myang bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is also the intention to realize and experience the ultimate thing, the connate [gnosis],

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: from where?

original: las rab 'byams sgrub pa'i don du de sgom pa la 'jug bzhin pa na /
analyzed: las rab 'byams sgrub pa'i don du de sgom pa la 'jug bzhin pa na /
translated: When one is engaged in meditating on that for the sake of accomplishing the extensive rites,

original: de'i sgo kho na nas de mngon par 'du byed pa 'jig par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i sgo kho na nas de mngon par 'du byed pa 'jig par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: it is because that very door destroys the conditioning of that.

original: rang bzhin gyi dngos grub chos kyi bdag nyid can /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dngos grub chos kyi bdag nyid can /
translated: The natural powers are characterized by the nature of reality.🔽The supreme space-like innate nature is entered into.

original: mchog gi nam mkha'i rnam pa can lhan cig skyes pa la 'jug par byed do zhes pa'i dgongs pa can te de lta bu'i rgyud bstan pa de ni don med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mchog gi nam mkha'i rnam pa can lhan cig skyes pa la 'jug par byed do zhes pa'i dgongs pa can te de lta bu'i rgyud bstan pa de ni don med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the intended meaning of the tantra that is taught, and it is not meaningless.

original: sgra shes phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra shes phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe gsungs te /
translated: The example is stated by “because of knowing sound,” and so on.

original: ji ltar phyi rol pa'i drang srong rnams kyis /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol pa'i drang srong rnams kyis /
translated: Just as the non-Buddhist sages

original: sgra tsam shes pa'i slad du de'i bstan bcos te sgra'i bstan bcos byed de /
analyzed: sgra tsam shes pa'i slad du de'i bstan bcos te sgra'i bstan bcos byed de /
translated: compose treatises on sound, that is, treatises on sound, for the sake of knowing mere sound,

original: de byed pa na 'ga' zhig gis de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de byed pa na 'ga' zhig gis de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: when they compose them, it is not that they will realize thatness.

original: de kho na bzhin du las kyi rjes su 'brangs nas te /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du las kyi rjes su 'brangs nas te /
translated: In the same way, following after karma,

original: de dang mthun pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs bgrang ba na /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs bgrang ba na /
translated: when counting the colors and shapes that accord with it,

original: rol mo dang glum khan la sogs pa bzhin du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rol mo dang glum khan la sogs pa bzhin du byed pa yin te /
translated: they act like musicians and dancers, and so on.

original: rigs dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang sngon gyi bsod nams bsags pa dang yang dag pa'i smon lam med pas /
analyzed: rigs dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang sngon gyi bsod nams bsags pa dang yang dag pa'i smon lam med pas /
translated: Because of the absence of the spiritual gene, the spiritual friend, the accumulation of merit in the past, and the absence of the right aspiration,

original: mi de rnams kyis spros pa med pa rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi de rnams kyis spros pa med pa rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: those people will not attain the unelaborated.

original: gang zhig rigs la sogs pa dang ldan pa de rnams kyis de mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rigs la sogs pa dang ldan pa de rnams kyis de mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: But those who have the spiritual gene and so on will certainly actualize it.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is said:🔽Hearing the extensive teaching,🔽relying on the good spiritual friend,

original: rgya che'i chos ni thos pa dang // bshes gnyen bzang po bsten pa dang // rigs las kyang ni 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: rgya che'i chos ni thos pa dang // bshes gnyen bzang po bsten pa dang // rigs las kyang ni 'jug pa ste //
translated: and engaging in the spiritual gene,

original: 'di las 'gyod med byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di las 'gyod med byed par 'gyur //
translated: one will not regret this.

original: zhes so // de kho na nyid rnyed par mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes so // de kho na nyid rnyed par mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: Not only will they not attain reality,

original: ji srid du lus nyon mongs pa'i sbyor ba las rang gi sems rnam par bskyod pa'i sgom pa byed bzhin pa ni bcos ma ste de yang thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes pas gnyi ga nyams pa'i phyir sgrub pa ni rmongs shing cher rmongs pa nyid thob par
analyzed: ji srid du lus nyon mongs pa'i sbyor ba las rang gi sems rnam par bskyod pa'i sgom pa byed bzhin pa ni bcos ma ste de yang thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes pas gnyi ga nyams pa'i phyir sgrub pa ni rmongs shing cher rmongs pa nyid thob par
translated: Because both are impaired, one will attain only delusion and great delusion.

original: 'gyur te / bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems ni ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'gyur te / bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems ni ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur la /
translated: Because it is said that a mind endowed with bliss becomes meditative stabilization,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems ni ji lta ba khong du chud pa'i shes rab tu @312a * //🔽'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems ni ji lta ba khong du chud pa'i shes rab tu @312a * // 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and a mind in equipoise becomes the wisdom that understands reality.

original: dpal gsung pa 'dus par yang //
analyzed: dpal gsung pa 'dus par yang //
translated: And in the glorious Guhyasamāja it is said:

original: sngags kyi sku yi rab sbyor gyis //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku yi rab sbyor gyis //
translated: By the application of the body of mantra,

original: byang chub med cing sgom pa med //
analyzed: byang chub med cing sgom pa med //
translated: there is no enlightenment and no meditation.

original: de ltar rnam dpyad mdor bsdus nas //
analyzed: de ltar rnam dpyad mdor bsdus nas //
translated: Thus, having briefly analyzed,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rnam par ni //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rnam par ni //
translated: the meditation on the form of body, speech, and mind,

original: bsgom bya byang chub sbyor ba na //
analyzed: bsgom bya byang chub sbyor ba na //
translated: the application to enlightenment,

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sngags su brtags //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sngags su brtags //
translated: is designated as mantra.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: don 'di nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: don 'di nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to explain this very point,

original: 'bad pas nyon mongs ldang ba ste //
analyzed: 'bad pas nyon mongs ldang ba ste //
translated: he says, “The arising of the afflictions through effort” and so on.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: kha cig gis smras pa //
analyzed: kha cig gis smras pa //
translated: Some say:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs pa na sangs rgyas nyid rtogs par 'gyur te //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs pa na sangs rgyas nyid rtogs par 'gyur te //
translated: When one realizes nonconceptual samādhi, one realizes buddhahood,

original: stong pa nyid sgom pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgom pa lta bu'o //
translated: like meditating on emptiness.

original: de gang gi phyir na de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byed pa'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyang de'i rang bzhin kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir na de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byed pa'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas nyid kyang de'i rang bzhin kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Because there is no conceptualization of affliction and purification in that, buddhahood also has that very nature.

original: brjod par bya ste /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa las sangs rgyas nyid do zhes pa dang / stong pa nyid ni de lta bu'o zhes pa ni snang brnyan gyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / rnam par mi rtog pa las sangs rgyas nyid do zhes pa dang / stong pa nyid ni de lta bu'o zhes pa ni snang brnyan gyi rang bzhin /
translated: We reply:

original: gzugs dang chad pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gzugs dang chad pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The statement “Buddhahood is from nonconceptuality” and “Emptiness is like that” are the position of form and the position of annihilation.

original: phyogs gnyi ga spangs pa ni sangs rgyas nyid do zhes pa dang 'gal pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga spangs pa ni sangs rgyas nyid do zhes pa dang 'gal pa'o //
translated: They contradict the statement “Buddhahood is the abandonment of both positions.”

original: yang zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim pa las skyes pa'i lha'i sku de bzhin gshegs par nga rgyal pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang zla ba dang rdo rje la sogs pa'i rim pa las skyes pa'i lha'i sku de bzhin gshegs par nga rgyal pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Again, it may be argued: “The special pride in the deity’s body produced by the stages of the moon, vajra, and so forth, which is associated with conceptual thought, will be the cause for attaining buddhahood.”

original: de sel ba'i slad du /
analyzed: de sel ba'i slad du /
translated: To dispel that, it is said:

original: rtog bcas kyis kyang 'gyur ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rtog bcas kyis kyang 'gyur ma yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: It will not be so even with conceptual thought.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i khyad par las kyang sangs rgyas nyid 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i khyad par las kyang sangs rgyas nyid 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, buddhahood does not arise from the special variety of aspects.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ngag ni bye brag med par 'khor lo'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ngag ni bye brag med par 'khor lo'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The conceptual thought of the special and the non-special is the cause of the wheel without distinction.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: dge'am mi dge na yang rung //
analyzed: dge'am mi dge na yang rung //
translated: Whether virtuous or non-virtuous,

original: rtog par bye brag ci zhig yod //
analyzed: rtog par bye brag ci zhig yod //
translated: what is the distinction in conceptual thought?

original: rten gyi dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis //
analyzed: rten gyi dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis //
translated: Due to the distinction of the basis,

original: mes sreg nyid du bye brag med //
analyzed: mes sreg nyid du bye brag med //
translated: there is no distinction in being burned by fire.

original: ces so // 'o na gang las der 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ces so // 'o na gang las der 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, from what is that?

original: shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “very pure,” etc.

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa las 'gyur ro /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa las 'gyur ro /
translated: It comes from the thorough knowledge of the nature of the aggregates, etc.

original: gang gi phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams rang bzhin kho na las bde ba chen po'i rnam grangs lhan cig @312b skyes pa rnams par dag pa rnams so //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams rang bzhin kho na las bde ba chen po'i rnam grangs lhan cig @312b skyes pa rnams par dag pa rnams so //
translated: Because these aggregates, etc., are synonyms of great bliss, coemergent, and pure, just by their nature.

original: de'i phyir bral ba'am sbyor ba'i chos 'ga' zhig gis ni 'di rnams byed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bral ba'am sbyor ba'i chos 'ga' zhig gis ni 'di rnams byed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they cannot be made by any dharma of separation or union.🔽The principal cause and maker of these is just the thorough knowledge of the nature of the aggregates, etc., which is like space.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa rnams nam mkha' lta bur rang bzhin yongs su shes pa kho na rgyu'i gtso bo dang / de byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa rnams nam mkha' lta bur rang bzhin yongs su shes pa kho na rgyu'i gtso bo dang / de byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained by the words, “It is not otherwise.”

original: de yang ston pa po bla ma la rtse gcig pa dang dam tshig la tshad mar byed pas yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ston pa po bla ma la rtse gcig pa dang dam tshig la tshad mar byed pas yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is by being one-pointed toward the teacher, the guru, and by taking the commitments as authoritative, and not otherwise.

original: 'o na yongs su shes pa yang yongs su shes par byed pa po dor nas 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
