analyzed: 'o na yongs su shes pa yang yongs su shes par byed pa po dor nas 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: But then, even though the thoroughly cognized is not the thoroughly cognizing,

original: gnyis yin na ji ltar de kho na nyid gnyis su med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis yin na ji ltar de kho na nyid gnyis su med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: if both exist, how could reality be nondual?

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po sel bar byed pa /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos po sel bar byed pa /
translated: The refutation of the entity of action and agent

original: bya ba rang bzhin las yong min //
analyzed: bya ba rang bzhin las yong min //
translated: Action does not arise from itself.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: dngos po rnams kyi 'od ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dang byed pa po rnams su rtogs par dbyer med pa'o zhes pa la phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi 'od ba dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba dang byed pa po rnams su rtogs par dbyer med pa'o zhes pa la phyogs gnyis so //
translated: The action of things, such as going and coming, and the agent are not different.

original: dang po byed pa po kho na yin na bya ba mi 'thob la /
analyzed: dang po byed pa po kho na yin na bya ba mi 'thob la /
translated: First, if it is only the agent, it does not obtain the action.

original: gnyis pa la byed pa po ci zhig yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa la byed pa po ci zhig yin te /
translated: Second, what is the agent,

original: bya ba dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different from the action?

original: de la de dag gi 'brel pa yod pa na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la de dag gi 'brel pa yod pa na yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is when their relation exists,

original: de'i bdag nyid yin na ni dbyer med pa'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i skyon no /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin na ni dbyer med pa'i phyir sngar bshad pa'i skyon no /
translated: if it is its very nature, then, because they are inseparable, there is the previously explained error.

original: de las byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de las byung ba yin na ni /
translated: If it arises from that,

original: bya ba skyes pa na byed pa zhig pa'i phyir gang gi bya ba yin /
analyzed: bya ba skyes pa na byed pa zhig pa'i phyir gang gi bya ba yin /
translated: Because the agent ceases when the action arises, whose action is it?

original: byed pa po dang bcas par yang ji ltar brjod de /
analyzed: byed pa po dang bcas par yang ji ltar brjod de /
translated: And how can it be said to be associated with an agent?

original: dngos po rnams ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir na su zhig gang la 'brel pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir na su zhig gang la 'brel pa yin /
translated: Because things are momentary, who is associated with what?

original: rgyun la gzhag pa'i 'brel pa yang brtags pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun la gzhag pa'i 'brel pa yang brtags pa ste /
translated: The association that is posited for a continuum is also imagined;

original: dngos po pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not real.

original: de'i 'das pa la sogs pa la yod pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de'i 'das pa la sogs pa la yod pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because it exists in the past, etc.

original: shes bya las sngar gal te shes //
analyzed: shes bya las sngar gal te shes //
translated: If consciousness exists prior to the object of consciousness,

original: de ni ci la dmigs nas byung //
analyzed: de ni ci la dmigs nas byung //
translated: with respect to what object does it arise?

original: shes las gal te shes bya snga //
analyzed: shes las gal te shes bya snga //
translated: If the object of consciousness exists prior to consciousness,

original: de ni ci la dmigs nas byung //
analyzed: de ni ci la dmigs nas byung //
translated: with respect to what object does it arise?

original: shes dang shes byas lhan cig na //
analyzed: shes dang shes byas lhan cig na //
translated: If consciousness and the object of consciousness exist simultaneously,

original: de ni ci la dmig snas byung //
analyzed: de ni ci la dmig snas byung //
translated: with respect to what object does it arise?

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said:

original: bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos por gzhag pa yang 'brel par brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa'i dngos por gzhag pa yang 'brel par brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: The positing of the entity of action and agent should also not be described as an association,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni phan tshun ltos pa nyid las ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni phan tshun ltos pa nyid las ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cause and effect are not established as mutually dependent.

original: de bas na byed pa po dang bya ba'i dngos las 'das pa 'di dag thams cad yin te /
analyzed: de bas na byed pa po dang bya ba'i dngos las 'das pa 'di dag thams cad yin te /
translated: Therefore, all of these are beyond the entities of agent and action.

original: shes pa po dang shes pa tha dad pa med pas gnyis su @313a * //
analyzed: shes pa po dang shes pa tha dad pa med pas gnyis su @313a * //
translated: Since there is no difference between the knower and the known,

original: med pa'i de kho na nyid 'grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: med pa'i de kho na nyid 'grub pa kho na'o //
translated: the nondual suchness is established.

original: de yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa yin te //
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob tu brjod pa yin te //
translated: Moreover, this is expressed conventionally,

original: rang bzhin gsal ba'i ye shes kyang de nyid du nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gsal ba'i ye shes kyang de nyid du nub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even the luminous pristine consciousness of the nature dissolves into that.

original: dper na mar khu dang thal bas dri ma med par byas pa'i me long la /
analyzed: dper na mar khu dang thal bas dri ma med par byas pa'i me long la /
translated: For example, when a mirror is cleansed of stains by melted butter and ashes,

original: dbugs thim pa dang bsreg par bya ba med pas /
analyzed: dbugs thim pa dang bsreg par bya ba med pas /
translated: since there is no exhalation or combustion,

original: me la 'bar ba'i tshogs thim pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: me la 'bar ba'i tshogs thim pa lta bu'o //
translated: the assembly of blazing fires dissolves into the fire.

original: byed pa po dang bya ba tha mi dad pa'i sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha mi dad pa de ni de'i bdag nyid de bu ram dang mngar ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang bya ba tha mi dad pa'i sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha mi dad pa de ni de'i bdag nyid de bu ram dang mngar ba lta bu'o //
translated: The application of the nondifferentiation of agent and action is that whatever is not differentiated from something is of the nature of that, like molasses and sweetness.

original: bya ba'ang byed pa po las tha mi dad pas logs su bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba'ang byed pa po las tha mi dad pas logs su bya ba med pa ste /
translated: Since the action is not differentiated from the agent, it is not separate.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural argument.

original: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa de ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa de ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which is different from something is not of the nature of that,

original: bum pa las snam bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: bum pa las snam bu lta bu'o //
translated: like a cloth from a pot.

original: bya ba'ang byed pa po las tha dad na //
analyzed: bya ba'ang byed pa po las tha dad na //
translated: If the action is different from the agent,

original: de ni bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bya ba ma yin te /
translated: then it is not an action,

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa 'am rgya 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa 'am rgya 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: because of the observation of an incompatible object, or because of the observation of an incompatible pervasion.

original: 'o na gal te de ltar yin na chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na gal te de ltar yin na chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin zhe na ;
translated: Well, if it is so, then what is the nature of all phenomena?

original: kun gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun gyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The nature of all is the nature of the mind,🔽and the nature of the mind is the nature of the vajra.

original: phung po la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni /
translated: The nature of all phenomena, such as the aggregates,

original: thog ma las ma skyes pa'i ngo bo yi ge aa sprul pa'i 'khor lo la gnas pa rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma las ma skyes pa'i ngo bo yi ge aa sprul pa'i 'khor lo la gnas pa rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste /
translated: is the nature of the letter A, which is the essence of non-arising from the beginning, abiding in the emanation wheel, and is naturally established,

original: chos kyi sku ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the dharmakāya is without beginning or end.

original: de'i dpe ni rin po che rnams kyi 'byung gnas rgya mtsho lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i dpe ni rin po che rnams kyi 'byung gnas rgya mtsho lta bu'o //
translated: An example of that is the ocean, which is the source of jewels.🔽In order to explain the conclusion,

original: grub mtha' bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: grub mtha' bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: it is said:

original: rtag tu 'jig rten tha snyad ni //
analyzed: rtag tu 'jig rten tha snyad ni //
translated: The conventional of the world is always

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said.🔽The world is one thing, and the supramundane is another.🔽The world is the example of the other.

original: re zhig 'jig rten ni gzhan gyi dpes bdag la sogs pa yod pa'i tha snyad dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rang gi sde ba ste /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten ni gzhan gyi dpes bdag la sogs pa yod pa'i tha snyad dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rang gi sde ba ste /
translated: The supramundane is one’s own school.

original: de ni 'gal ba ni /
analyzed: de ni 'gal ba ni /
translated: That is the contradiction.

original: bdag la sogs pa med pa'i tha snyad de /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa med pa'i tha snyad de /
translated: The convention of the nonexistence of self and so on.

original: phyogs 'dzin pa 'di dag gi 'khor ba'i rgyu kho na yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'dzin pa 'di dag gi 'khor ba'i rgyu kho na yin no //
translated: These are the causes of the saṃsāra of those who take sides.

original: 'o na grub pa'i mtha' ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na grub pa'i mtha' ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the philosophical position?

original: yod pa'am med pa nyid kyi yang //
analyzed: yod pa'am med pa nyid kyi yang //
translated: The existence or nonexistence of all things

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: bstan pa thams cad la grags pa'i yod pa dang / med pa lta ba dag tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa thams cad la grags pa'i yod pa dang / med pa lta ba dag tshad ma'i stobs kyis 'grub pa ste /
translated: The existence and nonexistence that are renowned in all the teachings are established by the power of valid knowledge.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ji ltar mi dmigs pa de ltar grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ji ltar mi dmigs pa de ltar grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: Their nature is just as it is not observed. That is the philosophical position.

original: de ci'i phyir tshad ma kho na ma grub pas de'i grub pa'i lta ba gang las 'byung /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir tshad ma kho na ma grub pas de'i grub pa'i lta ba gang las 'byung /
translated: Why is that? Since valid knowledge itself is not established, from where does the view that establishes it arise?

original: gzhal bya med pas de ma grub pa dang tshad ma gzhal bya dag phan tshun @313b ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya med pas de ma grub pa dang tshad ma gzhal bya dag phan tshun @313b ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object of valid cognition, it is not established, and because valid cognition and the object of valid cognition are mutually dependent.

original: de bas na phyogs gang la yang mi gnas pa grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de bas na phyogs gang la yang mi gnas pa grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, the conclusion is not to abide in any position.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to explain that,

original: rang bzhin nyid kyi sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyi sbyor ba ni //
translated: the natural union

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on are stated.

original: phyogs gnyis la ma zhe na pa yongs su shes pa 'dis sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis la ma zhe na pa yongs su shes pa 'dis sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By knowing both positions, one attains buddhahood.

original: de bas na rang bzhin yongs su shes pas lhan cig skyes ba rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin yongs su shes pas lhan cig skyes ba rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, by knowing the nature, the connate [union] is realized.

original: de nyid lam yin pas mthong pa dang sgom pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid lam yin pas mthong pa dang sgom pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since that is the path, it is not seeing, meditation, and so on.

original: de bas na rang bzhin gyi lam la brten nas thams cad byed pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin gyi lam la brten nas thams cad byed pa ni /
translated: Therefore, based on the path of the nature, everything is done.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la longs spyod pa'am /
translated: One enjoys the five sense objects

original: 'jig rten la 'gal ba'i bza' ba la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten la 'gal ba'i bza' ba la sogs pa'am /
translated: or one eats food that is contrary to the world,

original: spyod lam bzhi'am /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi'am /
translated: or one engages in the four types of conduct,🔽or one engages in the four types of behavior.

original: 'gro ba'i don du byed na grol ba ni lta ba thams cad kyi bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don du byed na grol ba ni lta ba thams cad kyi bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one acts for the sake of migrating beings, one is liberated, liberated from the bondage of all views.

original: dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The Extensive Explanation of the Spring Tantra

original: gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las /
analyzed: gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las /
translated: From the Lamp of the Great Secret

original: rgyas pa bstan pa dang po'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyas pa bstan pa dang po'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
translated: The Extensive Explanation of the First

original: // / de nas gang yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / de nas gang yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, whatever, and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang po 'das ma thag pa la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang po 'das ma thag pa la'o //
translated: Then means immediately after the first teaching.

original: gzugs can rnams ni rnam pa bzhi'i sems can gyi rigs gnas dgu'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor ba la gnas pa gang yin pa de'i lus kho na phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rgyud kyi nang nas ston pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams ni rnam pa bzhi'i sems can gyi rigs gnas dgu'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor ba la gnas pa gang yin pa de'i lus kho na phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rgyud kyi nang nas ston pa ste /
translated: The embodied ones are the four types of beings abiding in the nine abodes, the nature of samsara. Their bodies are taught in the tantra as the characteristics of the aggregates and so on.

original: de nyid lha'i mtshan nyid ni dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid lha'i mtshan nyid ni dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: That itself is the characteristic of the deity, which should be explained as the nature of the heroes and yoginis.

original: de gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa la gtogs pa'i lha ni don dam pa'i lha ma yin te bcos ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gang gi phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa la gtogs pa'i lha ni don dam pa'i lha ma yin te bcos ma'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the deity that belongs to the stage of creation is not the ultimate deity, because it is fabricated.

original: gang zhig rang bzhin du bde ba chen po'i ngo bo de kho na lha yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin du bde ba chen po'i ngo bo de kho na lha yin te /
translated: The one who is by nature the entity of great bliss is the deity.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan dang / ngag gi dbang phyug gi rang bzhin las 'byung zhing rol pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan dang / ngag gi dbang phyug gi rang bzhin las 'byung zhing rol pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he arises and plays from the nature of Ratnasaṃbhava and Vāgīśvara.

original: 'dir ni re zhig rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor ba dang / rnam par bral ba dang / bdag 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal dang rigs mi mthun pa'i yid byed pa rmongs pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi snang ba mtha' yas dang /
analyzed: 'dir ni re zhig rdo rje dang padma yang dag par sbyor ba dang / rnam par bral ba dang / bdag 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal dang rigs mi mthun pa'i yid byed pa rmongs pa dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi snang ba mtha' yas dang /
translated: Here, the union of the vajra and lotus, the delusion of the mind that is of a different type than the pride that thinks “I am this,” and the nature of the appearances that come and go are the nature of Amitābha,🔽Akṣobhya, Ratnasaṃbhava, Vairocana, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / don yong grub pa'i rang bzhin la rjes su zhugs pas lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba dang ldan @314a * //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / don yong grub pa'i rang bzhin la rjes su zhugs pas lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba dang ldan @314a * //
translated: Since one enters into that, one possesses connate bliss.

original: zhing / rdo rje 'chang chen po dang chos kyi dbang phyug ma'i rang bzhin gyi pha dang ma dag gi sprul pa bdag yin te /
analyzed: zhing / rdo rje 'chang chen po dang chos kyi dbang phyug ma'i rang bzhin gyi pha dang ma dag gi sprul pa bdag yin te /
translated: one is an emanation of the father and mother who are by nature Great Vajradhara and Dharmadhatviśvarī.

original: gang zhig bdag gi gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga de nyid rgyal ba rnams dang / gang zhig bdag gi mig la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams te /
analyzed: gang zhig bdag gi gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga de nyid rgyal ba rnams dang / gang zhig bdag gi mig la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa'i khams te /
translated: One’s five aggregates such as form are the victors, and one’s eyes and so forth and the elements such as earth

original: de dag gti mug la sogs pa'i 'khor los sgyur pa drug dang / ltung byed ma la sogs pa'i rigs kyi lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gti mug la sogs pa'i 'khor los sgyur pa drug dang / ltung byed ma la sogs pa'i rigs kyi lha mo rnams so //
translated: are the six wheel-turning ladies such as Moha and the goddesses of the family such as Pracanda.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las bcu'i rang bzhin gyi zla ba bcu pa'i bar du /
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs las bcu'i rang bzhin gyi zla ba bcu pa'i bar du /
translated: From the stage of kalala up to the tenth month, one is by nature the ten activities.

original: de dag gi padma dang rdo rje'i bum par ye shes chu yis bdag gi spyi bor dbang bskur ba dang / pa'i thig le lnga'i cod pan dang / de dag gi rgyal mtshan dang / mchog gi yan lag yang dag par sbyor bas rdo rje dang dril bu'i dbang bskur ba thob pa dang /
analyzed: de dag gi padma dang rdo rje'i bum par ye shes chu yis bdag gi spyi bor dbang bskur ba dang / pa'i thig le lnga'i cod pan dang / de dag gi rgyal mtshan dang / mchog gi yan lag yang dag par sbyor bas rdo rje dang dril bu'i dbang bskur ba thob pa dang /
translated: They obtain the empowerment of the water of timeless awareness on their heads in the vase of the lotus and vajra, the diadem of the five seed syllables in the heart, the empowerment of the vajra and bell through the union of the supreme branches,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi snying po la 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi snying po la 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: and the name of a tathāgata in order to go to the essence of suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ming thob pa dang / de'i rjes la mngal gyi chos gos gon pa'i phyir /🔽brtul zhugs thob pa dang / dbugs dbyung drug dang ldan pas lung bstan pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba thob pa dang / pha'i snyoms par zhugs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ming thob pa dang / de'i rjes la mngal gyi chos gos gon pa'i phyir / brtul zhugs thob pa dang / dbugs dbyung drug dang ldan pas lung bstan pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba thob pa dang / pha'i snyoms par zhugs pa bzhin du /
translated: After that, they obtain the vow in order to wear the Dharma robes of the womb,🔽the prophecy through the six kinds of inspiration, the attainment of inspiration,

original: de la bzhugs pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bzhugs pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: and the empowerment of irreversibility in order to not turn back from remaining in the father’s equipoise.🔽They obtain the empowerment of irreversibility, the food of bodhicitta,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang thob pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bza' ba dang / mtsho skyes kyi nang na gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang thob pa dang / byang chub kyi sems bza' ba dang / mtsho skyes kyi nang na gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: and the name of a buddha in order to remain in the lake-born one.

original: gsang ba dang shes rab kyi dbang thob pa dag yin te /🔽chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gsang ba dang shes rab kyi dbang thob pa dag yin te / chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: and have received the secret empowerment and the wisdom empowerment.🔽The nature of the realm of reality is the same as that of the Tathāgatas.

original: de pas na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de bzhin du bdag dang ji ltar khams gsum pa yang de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de pas na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de bzhin du bdag dang ji ltar khams gsum pa yang de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Just as all the Tathāgatas are of that nature, so too the three realms are of that nature.

original: phun sum tshogs pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the same in being perfect.

original: gang zhig phun sum tshogs pa la brten pa de ni rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid du dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig phun sum tshogs pa la brten pa de ni rang bzhin med pa'i ngo bo nyid du dag pa yin no //
translated: That which is based on perfection is pure in its nature of being without intrinsic reality.

original: de bas na chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa dang / bdag dang rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa dang / bdag dang rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are pure by nature, and the self is pure by nature.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i rim pa rnam par dpyad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i rim pa rnam par dpyad nas /
translated: Having thus analyzed the stage of natural establishment,🔽in order to demonstrate that this very body is of the nature of the Tathāgatas,

original: lus po 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus po 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: gzugs ni sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs ni sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Form is the Buddha Vairochana, and so forth.

original: gang zhig @314b gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: gang zhig @314b gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
translated: Form is the form aggregate.

original: de nyid rnam par mdzes pa'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par mdzes pa'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: Since that very [form] is beautiful, Vairochana is the nature of mirror-like wisdom,

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyi rol gyi sku dkar po can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyi rol gyi sku dkar po can ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the white external form with aspects.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo rang byung gi cha gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje nyi ma ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba ni bde ba la sogs pa dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo rang byung gi cha gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje nyi ma ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: Similarly, feeling is the nature of Ratnasambhava, the wisdom of equality, which is the vajra sun, the intrinsic aspect of self-arisen [wisdom] that is not different from pleasure and so forth.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sku ser po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i sku ser po ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the yellow external form with aspects.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes padma gar gyi dbang phyug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes padma gar gyi dbang phyug ces bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, perception is Padmanarteśvara,

original: padma'i nang na gar dbang 'dra ba'i byed pa'i de nyid du dbang byed pas na padma gar gyi dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: padma'i nang na gar dbang 'dra ba'i byed pa'i de nyid du dbang byed pas na padma gar gyi dbang phyug ste /
translated: Since he is the lord of the reality of the agent who is like the lord of dance in the lotus, he is Padmanarteshvara.

original: gang zhig dge ba la sogs pa 'di rnams 'du byed cing cha gnyis po bskul ba las skyes pa'i sems can gyi sprul pa sna tshogs pa de nyid rdo rje ste /
analyzed: gang zhig dge ba la sogs pa 'di rnams 'du byed cing cha gnyis po bskul ba las skyes pa'i sems can gyi sprul pa sna tshogs pa de nyid rdo rje ste /
translated: The vajra is that which forms these virtues and so forth, and is the various emanations of sentient beings born from the two parts that are activated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbus su gsal ba'i phyir rdo rje rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbus su gsal ba'i phyir rdo rje rgyal po'o //
translated: Since it is clear in the middle of the tathagatas, it is Vajraraja.

original: dga' bral gyi mthar rta mchog ste bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin gyi sngo bsangs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' bral gyi mthar rta mchog ste bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin gyi sngo bsangs ni ma yin no //
translated: At the end of the separation from joy, it is Hayagriva, the nature of the wisdom of accomplishing activities, but not the color blue.

original: gang rnam par shes pa'i dngos po 'di rnams yongs su gcod par byed pa de nyid rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i sems dpa' gang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa'i dngos po 'di rnams yongs su gcod par byed pa de nyid rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i sems dpa' gang yin pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: That which completely severs these things of consciousness is the vajra being who is indivisible. He is Vajrasattva.

original: snying stobs dang rdul gyi cha gnyis po ro mnyam par byed pa'i mtshan nyid mi bskyod pa dang thugs kyi rdo rje shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin gyi phyi rol gyi kha dog sngon po ni ma yin no🔽// de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i lnga po thams cad kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul gyi cha gnyis po ro mnyam par byed pa'i mtshan nyid mi bskyod pa dang thugs kyi rdo rje shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin gyi phyi rol gyi kha dog sngon po ni ma yin no // de bzhin du sngar gsungs pa'i lnga po thams cad kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: 'di'i yod pa'o zhes pas thams cad kyi gzugs can khyab pa byed pa po bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka gang yin pa ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /🔽chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub tu shes par bya'o zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //🔽dpal gsang ba 'dus par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di'i yod pa'o zhes pas thams cad kyi gzugs can khyab pa byed pa po bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka gang yin pa ni drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po ste / chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi byang chub tu shes par bya'o zhes pa ni lhag ma'o // dpal gsang ba 'dus par yang gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: mdor na phung po lnga rnams ni //🔽sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: mdor na phung po lnga rnams ni //🔽sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu bsgrags //
translated: The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivisibility of the three vajras.🔽The nature of the indivisible vajra is the indivis

original: zhes dang / dgongs pa lung bstan par yang //
analyzed: zhes dang / dgongs pa lung bstan par yang //
translated: And in the Tantra of the Prediction of Realization:

original: phung po kho na rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: phung po kho na rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: The aggregates themselves are the perfect Buddha.

original: byang chub don phyir rkyen du 'byung //
analyzed: byang chub don phyir rkyen du 'byung //
translated: They arise as conditions for the sake of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brjod de rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brjod de rnams //
translated: The expressions of the tathagatas

original: gnyis med de bzhin nyid du spyor //
analyzed: gnyis med de bzhin nyid du spyor //
translated: are engaged in nondual suchness.

original: zhes so // zla gsang thig ler yang /
analyzed: zhes so // zla gsang thig ler yang /
translated: And in the Drop of the Secret Moon:

original: 'gro ba 'di kun @315a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di kun @315a * //
translated: All these beings

original: sangs rgyas lnga bdag nyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga bdag nyid //
translated: are the nature of the five buddhas.

original: lha yi zlos gar mchog tu bkra ba ltos //
analyzed: lha yi zlos gar mchog tu bkra ba ltos //
translated: Look at the supreme, colorful dance of the gods.

original: gang du bde chen zhes bya gcig pu ste //
analyzed: gang du bde chen zhes bya gcig pu ste //
translated: Where the one called “great bliss”

original: gcig pu du ma'i nyams kyis gar mdzad do //
analyzed: gcig pu du ma'i nyams kyis gar mdzad do //
translated: dances with the experience of being one and many.

original: zhes so // mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du yang /
analyzed: zhes so // mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur du yang /
translated: And in the Vajra Tent of the dakinis:

original: mi bskyod nyid ni 'gro zhes bya //
analyzed: mi bskyod nyid ni 'gro zhes bya //
translated: Akshobhya is said to be the mover.

original: 'dod chags thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: All desire is abandoned.

original: rtag pa yi ni khrir gsungs te //
analyzed: rtag pa yi ni khrir gsungs te //
translated: It is said to be the throne of permanence.

original: rdor mtshan rdo rje can bye ba //
analyzed: rdor mtshan rdo rje can bye ba //
translated: The vajra sign is the ten million vajra holders.

original: dpag med tshe dpag med par bshad //
analyzed: dpag med tshe dpag med par bshad //
translated: It is explained to be immeasurable life.

original: nam mkha' ji srid bdun gyi rgyal //
analyzed: nam mkha' ji srid bdun gyi rgyal //
translated: It is the king for as long as space exists.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so forth.

original: de bzhin du kha sbyor du yang /🔽ma las skyes pa gsum dang ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha sbyor du yang / ma las skyes pa gsum dang ni //
translated: In the same way, the Union with Buddha says:🔽The three born from the mother

original: pha las skyes pa'i cha gsum nyid //
analyzed: pha las skyes pa'i cha gsum nyid //
translated: and the three parts born from the father

original: lus kyi cha drug 'di rnams ni //
analyzed: lus kyi cha drug 'di rnams ni //
translated: are the six parts of the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lus can drug / ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lus can drug / ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: These six are the six Tathagatas.

original: skye mched rnams dpa' bo rnams su sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye mched rnams dpa' bo rnams su sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to apply the sense-fields to the heroes,🔽it is said:

original: mig la gti mug rdo rjer bshad //
analyzed: mig la gti mug rdo rjer bshad //
translated: The eye is said to be Mohavajra,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽mig gnyis po gti mug rdo rje ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / mig gnyis po gti mug rdo rje ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: gzugs kyi yul la sred pa med pa nyid kyis de sdud pa'i phyir na yul gzhan la rab tu 'jug pa ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi yul la sred pa med pa nyid kyis de sdud pa'i phyir na yul gzhan la rab tu 'jug pa ni gti mug ste /
translated: The two eyes are Mohavajra, because of the gathering of that, i.e., the eye, by the absence of craving for the object of form.

original: 'od gsal ba'o //🔽rdo rje ni mi phyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'o // rdo rje ni mi phyed pa ste /
translated: The object is delusion, because of the clear light.

original: sku'i 'khor lo las stobs po cher bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i 'khor lo las stobs po cher bshad pa'o //
translated: Vajra is indivisible, explained as Mahabala from the body wheel.

original: rna ba'i dbang po ni zhe sdang rdo rje ste thugs kyi 'khor lo las khanda ka p'a la'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po ni zhe sdang rdo rje ste thugs kyi 'khor lo las khanda ka p'a la'o //
translated: The ear sense-faculty is Dvesavajra, Khandakapala from the mind wheel.

original: sgra 'dzin pa na ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir na rnam par rtog pa gzhan la sdang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra 'dzin pa na ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir na rnam par rtog pa gzhan la sdang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When apprehending sound, it is the same taste, because it is hostile to other conceptualizations.

original: sna'i dbang po ni phrag dog rdo rje ste gsung gi 'khor lo las mig mi bzang ngo //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po ni phrag dog rdo rje ste gsung gi 'khor lo las mig mi bzang ngo //
translated: The nose faculty is Mārajitā, and from the speech wheel, Virūpākṣa.

original: 'di nyid thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyis dri thams cad nye bar za ba po gzhan cung zad kyang med de khyab par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyis dri thams cad nye bar za ba po gzhan cung zad kyang med de khyab par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the nature of all of them, there is no other consumer of all smells, because it is the pervader.

original: kha la ni /
analyzed: kha la ni /
translated: In the mouth,

original: kha la gnas pa'i lce'i dbang po ni chags pa'i rdo rje ste /
analyzed: kha la gnas pa'i lce'i dbang po ni chags pa'i rdo rje ste /
translated: the tongue faculty that resides in the mouth is rāgarāja.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo las /
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo las /
translated: From the speech wheel,

original: dang po myu gu can no //
analyzed: dang po myu gu can no //
translated: the first is Aṅkura.

original: reg pa lus kyi dbang po ni ser sna rdo rje 'khor lo'i mtha' las rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: reg pa lus kyi dbang po ni ser sna rdo rje 'khor lo'i mtha' las rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The tactile faculty is mātsaryavajrī, and from the end of the wheel, Vajrasattva.

original: dbang po thams cad kyi khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir na phyag rgya ma thams cad kyi padma reg pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin kho na myong zhing gzhan du ma yin pas na ser sna'o //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad kyi khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir na phyag rgya ma thams cad kyi padma reg pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin kho na myong zhing gzhan du ma yin pas na ser sna'o //
translated: Since it pervades all faculties, it is miserly, since it experiences the nature of the bliss of contact with the lotus of all consorts, and not otherwise.

original: skye mched thams cad ni yid kyi dbang po he ru ka ste thugs kyi 'khor lo'i mtha' las rdo rje'i lus so //
analyzed: skye mched thams cad ni yid kyi dbang po he ru ka ste thugs kyi 'khor lo'i mtha' las rdo rje'i lus so //
translated: The mind faculty is Heruka, the body of vajra, beyond the limit of the mind wheel.

original: dbang po thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad la khyab par byed pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood to pervade all faculties.

original: @315b 'khor los sgyur ba drug pa'o zhes kha cig ste /
analyzed: @315b 'khor los sgyur ba drug pa'o zhes kha cig ste /
translated: Some say it is the sixth chakravartin.

original: yang na sa'i snying po dang phyag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang sgrib pa rnam par sel ba dang dpal ldan kun du bzang po ste 'di rnams mig la sogs pa'i 'du shes de rnams la'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: yang na sa'i snying po dang phyag na rdo rje dang nam mkha'i snying po dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang sgrib pa rnam par sel ba dang dpal ldan kun du bzang po ste 'di rnams mig la sogs pa'i 'du shes de rnams la'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro
translated: Or else, it is Kshitigarbha, Vajrapani, Akashagarbha, Lokeshvara, Sarvanivarana Viskambini, and glorious Samantabhadra, since it is said that these are the perceptions of eye and so on.

original: // gtso bos ni bde ba chen pos phug pa nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams ni dpa' bo'i zol gyis rnyed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: // gtso bos ni bde ba chen pos phug pa nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams ni dpa' bo'i zol gyis rnyed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The principal ones are obtained by the guise of heroes, because they are pierced by great bliss.

original: rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not obtained by holding the vajra and bell,

original: brtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dpal gsang ba 'dus par yang //
analyzed: brtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // dpal gsang ba 'dus par yang //
translated: because that is just a pretense.🔽And in the glorious Guhyasamaja

original: rdo rje'i skye mched nyid kyang ni //
analyzed: rdo rje'i skye mched nyid kyang ni //
translated: the vajra sense bases

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: are the supreme mandala of bodhisattvas.

original: ltung byed ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams kyi de kho na nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: ltung byed ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams kyi de kho na nyid gsungs te /
translated: The reality of the elements is stated by the one called “downfall,” and so on.

original: gang 'dir sa'i khams ni rus pa dang shal sogs pa'am /
analyzed: gang 'dir sa'i khams ni rus pa dang shal sogs pa'am /
translated: Here, the earth element is bone, flesh, and so on,

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'am /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'am /
translated: or the emanation chakra,

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su sra ba'i rig pa gang yin pa ste de ni ltung byed ma dang mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su sra ba'i rig pa gang yin pa ste de ni ltung byed ma dang mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: or the awareness of solidity at the time of union. That is the downfall dakini and the dakini.

original: der mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtogs pa bcom pa stong pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / byams pa dang / thabs kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: der mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtogs pa bcom pa stong pa nyid dang / dga' ba dang / byams pa dang / thabs kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the emptiness of the water element is the nature of the conceptualization that is destroyed by the attachment to it, and that it is the nature of joy, love, and means.

original: gang 'dir chu'i khams ni chu dang khrag la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: gang 'dir chu'i khams ni chu dang khrag la sogs pa'am /
translated: Here, the water element is the water and blood, etc.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo'am /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo'am /
translated: or the wheel of Dharma,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su gsher pa la reg pa ste de ni gsod byed ma dang l'a ma'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su gsher pa la reg pa ste de ni gsod byed ma dang l'a ma'o //
translated: or the wetness at the time of meditative concentration. It is the destroyer, and it is Lāma.

original: der mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa zad par byed pa mtshan ma med pa dang / mchog dga' dang / snying rje dang / smon lam gyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: der mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa zad par byed pa mtshan ma med pa dang / mchog dga' dang / snying rje dang / smon lam gyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the signlessness of the conceptualization that is destroyed by the attachment to it is the nature of supreme joy, compassion, and aspiration.

original: gang 'dir me'i khams ni lus rnams la dro ba'am /
analyzed: gang 'dir me'i khams ni lus rnams la dro ba'am /
translated: Here, the fire element is the heat in the bodies,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo 'am /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo 'am /
translated: or the wheel of enjoyment,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su me'i rig pa ste ye shes kyi me 'bar ba de ni 'gugs byed ma dang dum skyes ma'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su me'i rig pa ste ye shes kyi me 'bar ba de ni 'gugs byed ma dang dum skyes ma'o //
translated: or the fire of knowledge, the blazing of the fire of wisdom, at the time of meditative concentration. It is the attractor, and it is Khaṇḍarohā.

original: der mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'joms par byed pa smon pa med pa dang / dga' bral dang / dga' ba dang / stobs kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: der mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'joms par byed pa smon pa med pa dang / dga' bral dang / dga' ba dang / stobs kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the absence of expectancy, which conquers the conceptualization that is attached to that, is the nature of joy, the absence of joy, and strength.

original: de bzhin du gang 'dir rlung gi khams ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bskum pa dang brkyang ba'i mtshan nyid dam bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang 'dir rlung gi khams ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bskum pa dang brkyang ba'i mtshan nyid dam bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'am /
translated: Similarly, the wind element here is the characteristic of coming and going, bending and stretching, or the wheel of great bliss.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa na spro ba ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa na spro ba ste /
translated: It is the expansion in meditative equipoise,

original: gnas pa'am / rgyu ba dang 'dug pa dang / langs @316a * //
analyzed: gnas pa'am / rgyu ba dang 'dug pa dang / langs @316a * //
translated: the abiding, the moving, the sitting, the rising,

original: pa'am / nyin dang mtshan du nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dbugs rgyu ba'ang rung ste /
analyzed: pa'am / nyin dang mtshan du nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i dbugs rgyu ba'ang rung ste /
translated: the day and night, the twenty-one thousand six hundred movements of breath.

original: der ni gar gyi dbang phyug ma yan lag thams cad kyi gar gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i phrin las kyi dbang phyug ma gzugs can ma ste /
analyzed: der ni gar gyi dbang phyug ma yan lag thams cad kyi gar gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i phrin las kyi dbang phyug ma gzugs can ma ste /
translated: There, the goddess of dance is the goddess of activity, the accomplishment of dance in all limbs.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / ye shes kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / ye shes kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the nature of the four joys is the four great mudras: the great seal, the doctrine seal, the samaya seal, and the action seal.

original: 'di rnams nyid las dang / chos dang / dam tshig dang / phyag rgya chen po ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid las dang / chos dang / dam tshig dang / phyag rgya chen po ste /
translated: They are also the four joys of the great seal, the doctrine seal, the samaya seal, and the action seal.

original: de rnams ae bam ma y'a'i brdas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ae bam ma y'a'i brdas bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are indicated by the symbols of evam, ma, ya, and a.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: sa ni spyan mar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: sa ni spyan mar brjod pa ste /
translated: Earth is said to be Locana.

original: chu khams gsong byed ma ru dran //
analyzed: chu khams gsong byed ma ru dran //
translated: The water element is known as Mamaki.

original: me ni gos dkar mo yin te //
analyzed: me ni gos dkar mo yin te //
translated: Fire is called Pandara.

original: rlung ni sgrol mar rab tu grags //
analyzed: rlung ni sgrol mar rab tu grags //
translated: Wind is well known as Tara.

original: zhes pa dang / gsang ba'i de kho na nyid rab tu gsal bar yang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gsang ba'i de kho na nyid rab tu gsal bar yang /
translated: And the Illuminating Secret Essence says:

original: ae yig sar ni shes bya ste //
analyzed: ae yig sar ni shes bya ste //
translated: The syllable e is to be known as earth.

original: las kyi phyag rgya spyan ma'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya spyan ma'o //
translated: The karma mudra is Locana.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o // de bzhin du /
translated: And so forth.

original: kye'i rdo rje las /
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje las /
translated: And the Hevajra Tantra says:

original: bolla kakko la sbyor bas /
analyzed: bolla kakko la sbyor bas /
translated: By uniting the bola and kakkola,

original: sa ni de la skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa ni de la skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: earth is generated there.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha'i khams ni rtsa thams cad kyi bug pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha'i khams ni rtsa thams cad kyi bug pa'am /
translated: Likewise, the space element is the opening of all the channels,

original: dbang po'i sgo rnams kyi bug pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo rnams kyi bug pa'am /
translated: or the opening of the doors of the senses,

original: ba spu'i bu ga'i nam mkha' yang rung ste /
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga'i nam mkha' yang rung ste /
translated: or the space of the pores of the body.

original: de ni padma'i dra ba can ma zhes bya ba pham mo'o //
analyzed: de ni padma'i dra ba can ma zhes bya ba pham mo'o //
translated: It is called “Padminī” and is the “defeated” [consort].

original: padma'i rtsa 'dra ba'i rje mo ste /
analyzed: padma'i rtsa 'dra ba'i rje mo ste /
translated: It is the mistress who is like the root of a lotus.

original: de ni chags pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa /
analyzed: de ni chags pa'i 'dam gyis ma gos pa /
translated: It is not soiled by the mud of passion.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las grol ba /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las grol ba /
translated: It is free from the concepts of subject and object.

original: sngar bshad pa'i khams bzhi po la khyab pa mor rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i khams bzhi po la khyab pa mor rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the pervader of the four elements explained above.

original: yang gsungs pa /🔽nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs su gnas //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs su gnas //
translated: It is also said:🔽The form that abides in the space element

original: de nyid mkha' spyod ma ru dran //
analyzed: de nyid mkha' spyod ma ru dran //
translated: is known as Khecarī.

original: zhes so // rdo rje khur du yang /
analyzed: zhes so // rdo rje khur du yang /
translated: The Vajra Tent also says:

original: khams rnams kun gyi dbus su gnas //
analyzed: khams rnams kun gyi dbus su gnas //
translated: Abiding in the middle of all the elements,🔽it is said in the Tantra of Revealing the Intention:

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / nam mkha'i gcig pu'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / nam mkha'i gcig pu'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The nature of the unique space

original: thub pa chen po 'dir bzhugs so //🔽zhes dgongs pa lung ston pa las gsungs pa las so //
analyzed: thub pa chen po 'dir bzhugs so //🔽zhes dgongs pa lung ston pa las gsungs pa las so //
translated: is the abode of the Great Sage.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pas nye bar bsdu ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa la sogs pas nye bar bsdu ba gsungs te /
translated: The summary is stated by “Thus, etc.”

original: tshul 'dis khams gsum na gnas pa'i lus can thams cad kyi phung po la sogs pa'i lus ni lha'i bdag nyid can du rnam par shes par bya ba yin gyi phyi rol gyi zhal dang phyag la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul 'dis khams gsum na gnas pa'i lus can thams cad kyi phung po la sogs pa'i lus ni lha'i bdag nyid can du rnam par shes par bya ba yin gyi phyi rol gyi zhal dang phyag la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: By this method, the bodies of all embodied beings dwelling in the three realms are to be known as having the nature of deity, not as having external faces, arms, etc.

original: gang gi phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phung po'i za ma tog gi nang du son pa'i bde @316b ba dang sdug bsngal dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di rnams thams cad du de dang dbyer med pa'i phyir lha'i bdag nyid can kho na'o //
analyzed: phung po'i za ma tog gi nang du son pa'i bde @316b ba dang sdug bsngal dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa gang yin pa 'di rnams thams cad du de dang dbyer med pa'i phyir lha'i bdag nyid can kho na'o //
translated: Because all of these, happiness and suffering, afflictions, karma, birth, destruction, etc., which are contained within the treasure chest of the aggregates, are inseparable from that, they are only of the nature of deity.

original: 'khor ba gang yin pa 'di nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yang de kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba gang yin pa 'di nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yang de kho na yin te /
translated: And this very cyclic existence is nirvana.

original: de dag gi dbye ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las /
analyzed: de dag gi dbye ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las /
translated: This is the second chapter of the great commentary on the Spring Time of Generation, the Lamp of the Great Secret, the ritual method of the completion stage.

original: rgyas par bstan pa gnyis pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa gnyis pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
translated: The second extensive explanation.🔽The bodies of all embodied beings are, for the time being, the nature of the Tathāgata.🔽This is understood from the second chapter.

original: // / lus can thams cad kyi lus ni re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid can no zhes le'u gnyis pas rtogs par byas bde rnams kyi gang las 'jug pa dang 'byung bar gyur pa de rnams kyi tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog gi dbye bas sgo rnams rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bstan pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: // / lus can thams cad kyi lus ni re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid can no zhes le'u gnyis pas rtogs par byas bde rnams kyi gang las 'jug pa dang 'byung bar gyur pa de rnams kyi tha ma dang / 'bring dang / mchog gi dbye bas sgo rnams rtogs par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bstan pa la 'jug ste /
translated: The doors through which the bliss of those beings enters and arises are to be understood through the divisions of the lowest, medium, and best.

original: de'i don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of that is easy to understand.

original: ka ba gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ka ba gcig ces bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan pa gsungs te /
translated: The extensive explanation is stated with “one pillar,” and so on.

original: gang 'di rnams thams cad lha'i sku can te /
analyzed: gang 'di rnams thams cad lha'i sku can te /
translated: All of these are the bodies of the deity.

original: der ka ba gcig ni sgras tshigs kyi sgras brjod par bya ba rgyab kyi phyogs su /
analyzed: der ka ba gcig ni sgras tshigs kyi sgras brjod par bya ba rgyab kyi phyogs su /
translated: There, one pillar is described by the word “cavity,” which is in the rear direction.

original: bshang lam dang / ltag pa dag gi bar las brtsams te /
analyzed: bshang lam dang / ltag pa dag gi bar las brtsams te /
translated: It is begun from between the anus and the back of the neck.

original: de ji sid du aa rbu da'i mthil du khyab par gnas pa ka ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ji sid du aa rbu da'i mthil du khyab par gnas pa ka ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is as large as the palm of the hand, and it is a pillar that pervades the entire body.

original: gang gi g-yon dang g-yas kyi logs dag tu dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi lta bu dang / logs su gnas pa'i thigs pa dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: gang gi g-yon dang g-yas kyi logs dag tu dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi lta bu dang / logs su gnas pa'i thigs pa dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin /
translated: On its left and right sides are the twenty-four heroes, and on the sides are the drops that are the nature of the heroes and yoginīs.

original: 'khor lo gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum gyis bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be known to be included in the three cakras.

original: gang du de rnams kyi dbus su 'jug bzhin pa de'i rten gyi dbyug pas 'og dang / lha'i gnas su he ru ka'i rang bzhin gyi keng rus chen mo'i zol gyis phye ba de lta bu gang gi yin pa ni ka ba gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gang du de rnams kyi dbus su 'jug bzhin pa de'i rten gyi dbyug pas 'og dang / lha'i gnas su he ru ka'i rang bzhin gyi keng rus chen mo'i zol gyis phye ba de lta bu gang gi yin pa ni ka ba gcig pa'o //
translated: In the middle of those, there is a staff that is the support of the one who is entering there, and it is divided below into the abode of the gods in the guise of the great skeleton, which is the nature of Heruka.

original: kha sbyor du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: kha sbyor du yang gsungs pa /
translated: The Samputa also says:🔽The twelve ribs on the sides

original: logs kyi rtsib ma bcu gnyis dag //🔽nyis 'gyur du ni gyur pa las //
analyzed: logs kyi rtsib ma bcu gnyis dag //🔽nyis 'gyur du ni gyur pa las //
translated: are doubled.

original: dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma tshogs kyis //
analyzed: dpa' bo rnal 'byor ma tshogs kyis //
translated: He is surrounded by a troupe

original: kun nas yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: of heroes and yoginīs.

original: sbal tshigs dbyug pa'i rnam pa 'di //
analyzed: sbal tshigs dbyug pa'i rnam pa 'di //
translated: This pillar, in the form of a staff,

original: mchog gi he ru ka yi rten //🔽phung po khams sogs sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: mchog gi he ru ka yi rten // phung po khams sogs sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: is the support of the supreme Heruka.🔽The aggregates, constituents, and so forth are the pillars

original: ka bzhes ni mngon brjod bya //
analyzed: ka bzhes ni mngon brjod bya //
translated: of the buddhas, as is well known.

original: zhes pa dang / dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gror yang //🔽@317a * // ji ltar ka ba chen po yis //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gror yang // @317a * // ji ltar ka ba chen po yis //
translated: And in the Śrīvajraḍāka:🔽Just as a house of pleasure is supported

original: rol pa'i khyim ni gzung bya ba //
analyzed: rol pa'i khyim ni gzung bya ba //
translated: by great pillars,

original: de bzhin sgo dgu can gyi lus //
analyzed: de bzhin sgo dgu can gyi lus //
translated: so too the body, with its nine openings,

original: sgal tshigs nyid kyis gzung bar bya //
analyzed: sgal tshigs nyid kyis gzung bar bya //
translated: is supported by the spine.

original: zhes so // yang na ka ba gcig lta bu'i ka ba ste aa ba dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: zhes so // yang na ka ba gcig lta bu'i ka ba ste aa ba dh'u t'i'o //
translated: Or, like a single pillar, the pillar is the avadhūti.

original: rtsa thams cad kyi 'khor lo 'dzin pa la 'di rnams ni brjod pa kho na las rtsa rnams kyi dbus su ka ba gcig ste /
analyzed: rtsa thams cad kyi 'khor lo 'dzin pa la 'di rnams ni brjod pa kho na las rtsa rnams kyi dbus su ka ba gcig ste /
translated: Since it holds the wheels of all the channels, it is just mentioned among them.

original: lte ba'i dbus na 'khor lo che //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus na 'khor lo che //
translated: In the center of the navel is the great wheel,

original: skud pa bcu drug dang ldan pa //🔽kha sbyor byed pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: skud pa bcu drug dang ldan pa // kha sbyor byed pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: endowed with sixteen spokes.🔽Through the yoga of union,

original: yi ge aa dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: yi ge aa dang yang dag ldan //
translated: it is endowed with the syllable a.

original: thams cad bzhi yi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: thams cad bzhi yi ngo bo nyid //
translated: All are of the nature of four.

original: de yi dbus su gnas pa gang //
analyzed: de yi dbus su gnas pa gang //
translated: That which abides in their center

original: ka bar gyur pa rgyal mo che //
analyzed: ka bar gyur pa rgyal mo che //
translated: is the great pillar,

original: de ni aa ba dh'u t'ir bsgrags //
analyzed: de ni aa ba dh'u t'ir bsgrags //
translated: it is proclaimed as the avadhūtī.

original: zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: 'khor lo chen por ka ba bcu drug gis spras pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo chen por ka ba bcu drug gis spras pa'o //
translated: The great wheel is adorned with sixteen pillars.

original: aa yig dang yang dag par sbyor ba kha sbyor gyi sbyor ba las thams cad kyi rten gyi rang bzhin gyis der dbus su rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: aa yig dang yang dag par sbyor ba kha sbyor gyi sbyor ba las thams cad kyi rten gyi rang bzhin gyis der dbus su rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The union of the vowel A and the perfect union is the nature of the support of all. It abides there in the center.

original: ka bar gyur pa rnams kyi rgyal po chen mo de ni aa ba dh'u t'ir rab tu bsgrags so //
analyzed: ka bar gyur pa rnams kyi rgyal po chen mo de ni aa ba dh'u t'ir rab tu bsgrags so //
translated: That great queen of the pillars is proclaimed as the avadhūtī.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /🔽rgyun dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na / rgyun dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?🔽With “nine streams,” and so on,

original: sgo dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sgo dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdor bstan pa'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs te /
translated: the brief explanation of the “nine doors” and so on is stated.

original: rgyun dgu rnams ni mig gnyis dang / rna ba gnyis dang / sna gnyis dang / kha dang / gsang ba dang / bshad lam du brjod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun dgu rnams ni mig gnyis dang / rna ba gnyis dang / sna gnyis dang / kha dang / gsang ba dang / bshad lam du brjod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The nine channels are the two eyes, the two ears, the two nostrils, the mouth, the anus, and the urethra.

original: re re la yang sgo rnam pa dgur rab tu bsgrags te /
analyzed: re re la yang sgo rnam pa dgur rab tu bsgrags te /
translated: Each of them is proclaimed to have nine doors.

original: de ltar mig gi dbang po ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / gnyi ga'i sems las byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid la sa dgur rab tu dbye ste /
analyzed: de ltar mig gi dbang po ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / gnyi ga'i sems las byung ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid la sa dgur rab tu dbye ste /
translated: Thus, the eye sense-faculty is divided into nine, in terms of earth, water, fire, wind, space, consciousness, virtue, non-virtue, and the phenomena arisen from both.

original: de ltar gzhan la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in the same way for the others.

original: de rnams kyang sangs rgyas lnga dang rnal 'byor ma bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sangs rgyas lnga dang rnal 'byor ma bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
translated: They are also the nature of the five buddhas and the four yoginis.

original: de ltar na sgo dang sgo ni dgu'i bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor gsungs so zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sgo dang sgo ni dgu'i bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor gsungs so zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the mandala circle is said to have nine doors and nine doors.

original: yang de bzhin du sgo yang dgu phrag dgu'o zhes pas /
analyzed: yang de bzhin du sgo yang dgu phrag dgu'o zhes pas /
translated: In the same way, there are nine groups of nine doors.

original: lus la sgo brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lus la sgo brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should understand that there are eighty-one doors in the body.

original: de rnams las 'dzag pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams las 'dzag pa gang yin pa de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa nyid do zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the Tathagata is the very same thing that oozes from those doors.

original: de'i don ni /🔽lus can gyi ni tha ma'i sgo //
analyzed: de'i don ni / lus can gyi ni tha ma'i sgo //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.🔽The last door of embodied beings

original: rags pa'i ltar ru sprul pa @317b yin //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs te /
analyzed: rags pa'i ltar ru sprul pa @317b yin // zhes bya bas gsungs te /
translated: is the manifestation of the gross.

original: lus can gyi sgo gang yin pa de ni rnam pa dgu dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: lus can gyi sgo gang yin pa de ni rnam pa dgu dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The door of embodied beings is endowed with nine aspects.

original: de nyid ni tha ma ste snang bzhin pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir dang / phyi rol gyi gzugs su rab tu gsal ba'i phyir dang / shin tu 'dzag cing 'bab pa'i phyir na tha ma ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni tha ma ste snang bzhin pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir dang / phyi rol gyi gzugs su rab tu gsal ba'i phyir dang / shin tu 'dzag cing 'bab pa'i phyir na tha ma ste /
translated: That very [door] is the last, because it is the very form that appears, because it is clearly manifest as external form, and because it oozes and flows.

original: dman pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dman pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the last, not because it is inferior.

original: 'di rnams nyid las rags pa ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid las rags pa ste /
translated: Among these, it is the gross,

original: sgo gzhan la ltos nas gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgo gzhan la ltos nas gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: like form in relation to other doors.

original: sngar bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha mo dgu po'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir lha ru rnam par sprul pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha mo dgu po'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir lha ru rnam par sprul pa yin no //
translated: because of being the nature of the nine goddesses of the Tathagata explained above, they are emanations as goddesses.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ngag gi sgo mdor bstan pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas ngag gi sgo mdor bstan pa gsungs te /
translated: The other and so forth is a brief explanation of the door of speech.

original: lus dang sems dag gi bar du 'jug bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir 'bring po ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems dag gi bar du 'jug bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir 'bring po ste /
translated: The middle is because of being in the middle of body and mind.

original: ngag gi sgo ni rnam pa bzhir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag gi sgo ni rnam pa bzhir shes par bya'o //
translated: The door of speech should be known as fourfold.

original: me zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bshad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: me zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bshad pa gsungs te /
translated: The fire and so forth is an extensive explanation.

original: 'dir bzhi po ni /
analyzed: 'dir bzhi po ni /
translated: Here, the four are

original: me dang / rlung dang / dbang chen dang / chur bshad pa rnams te /
analyzed: me dang / rlung dang / dbang chen dang / chur bshad pa rnams te /
translated: explained as fire, wind, earth, and water.

original: go rims bzhin du mgrin pa dang / lte ba dang / gsang ba dang / snying gar gnas pa padma gar gyi dbang phyug dang / rta mchog dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin can dum skyes ma dang / gzugs can ma dang /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du mgrin pa dang / lte ba dang / gsang ba dang / snying gar gnas pa padma gar gyi dbang phyug dang / rta mchog dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin can dum skyes ma dang / gzugs can ma dang /
translated: In order, they are located in the throat, navel, secret place, and heart, and are the nature of Padmanarteshvara, Hayagriva, Ratnasambhava, and Akshobhya. They are the nature of Varahi, Rupini,

original: l'a ma dang / mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: l'a ma dang / mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the rasanā, lalanā, and avadhūti is the nature of the mother, daughter, and dakini.

original: g-yas dang / g-yon dang / gnyig dang / rengs shing dal bar rgyu ba can dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / ser po dang / dkar po'i kha dog can rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas dang / g-yon dang / gnyig dang / rengs shing dal bar rgyu ba can dmar po dang / ljang gu dang / ser po dang / dkar po'i kha dog can rnams so //
translated: They are red, green, yellow, and white, moving to the right, to the left, in both, and slowly and sluggishly.

original: gtso bo'i yon tan gyis phye pas phan tshun du grangs bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo'i yon tan gyis phye pas phan tshun du grangs bzhi pa ste /
translated: They are distinguished by the qualities of the principal one, and they are mutually fourfold.

original: nyin dang mtshan du nyi shu rtsa bzhir rgyu ba /
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du nyi shu rtsa bzhir rgyu ba /
translated: They move twenty-four hours a day.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis brgya phrag bcu drug lhag pa'i khri phrag gnyis kyi dbugs 'bab pa ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis brgya phrag bcu drug lhag pa'i khri phrag gnyis kyi dbugs 'bab pa ni /
translated: The winds move in sixteen thousand two hundred breaths, through the inhalations and so on.

original: lus thams cad kyi rtsa 'khor lo rnams su rang rig pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad kyi rtsa 'khor lo rnams su rang rig pas rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known by the self-knowing awareness in all the channel chakras of the body.

original: gang rnams su rlung 'bab par rnam par shes pa'i skad cig so so la rgyu zhing rab tu 'jug pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i rnal 'byor gyis myong bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang rnams su rlung 'bab par rnam par shes pa'i skad cig so so la rgyu zhing rab tu 'jug pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i rnal 'byor gyis myong bar bya'o //
translated: The moments of consciousness that move and enter in the places where the winds move should be experienced by the yoga of coming and going.

original: de rnams nyid ni ngag gi sgo ste /
analyzed: de rnams nyid ni ngag gi sgo ste /
translated: Those are the doors of the voice.

original: g-yon dang g-yas dang dbus kyi rtsa'i bug pa dang ldan pa de rnams nyid las bcom ldan 'das ma'i yi ge chen mo 'char bar byed do //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas dang dbus kyi rtsa'i bug pa dang ldan pa de rnams nyid las bcom ldan 'das ma'i yi ge chen mo 'char bar byed do //
translated: From those very ones, the great syllables of the Blessed Lady arise, through the openings of the left, right, and middle channels.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir de rnams nyid dag gi sgor bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad pa'i phyir de rnams nyid dag gi sgor bstan to //
translated: They are taught to be the doors of those very ones, because cause and effect are not different.

original: de gsal ba'i gnas ni kha @318a * //
analyzed: de gsal ba'i gnas ni kha @318a * //
translated: The place of their manifestation is the mouth.

original: yin no // de rnams kyang me la sogs pa rnams 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yin no // de rnams kyang me la sogs pa rnams 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: And those are fire, etc., in the processes of entering, etc.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: steng du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: steng du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “above, etc.”

original: go rims bzhin du me'i dkyil 'khor ni steng du rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du me'i dkyil 'khor ni steng du rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: In order, the fire maṇḍala enters above,

original: byin za gyen du 'bar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin za gyen du 'bar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fire moves upward.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni logs kyi sgo dag las 'bab ste /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni logs kyi sgo dag las 'bab ste /
translated: The wind maṇḍala moves from the side doors,

original: rlung dag ni 'khyog por 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung dag ni 'khyog por 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the winds move crookedly.

original: dbang chen ni drang por reg cing 'bab ste /
analyzed: dbang chen ni drang por reg cing 'bab ste /
translated: The great maṇḍala moves straight down,

original: de'i mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is even.

original: chu ni 'og tu 'bab ste /
analyzed: chu ni 'og tu 'bab ste /
translated: Water moves below,🔽because it is heavy.

original: chu rnams ni thur kho nar 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu rnams ni thur kho nar 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the waters flow only downward.

original: yang gsungs pa /🔽g-yas las byung ba'i 'od zer ni //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / g-yas las byung ba'i 'od zer ni //
translated: It is also said:🔽The light rays that arise from the right

original: de ni byin za'i dkyil 'khor te //
analyzed: de ni byin za'i dkyil 'khor te //
translated: are the mandala of fire.

original: 'di ni kha dog dmar por gsal //
analyzed: 'di ni kha dog dmar por gsal //
translated: This is clearly red in color.

original: 'di la padma mgon po lha //🔽dung dang kunda lta bur dkar //
analyzed: 'di la padma mgon po lha // dung dang kunda lta bur dkar //
translated: In this, the deity is Padmanatha.🔽White like a conch or jasmine flower,

original: rengs shing dal bar rgyu ba yang //
analyzed: rengs shing dal bar rgyu ba yang //
translated: slow and sluggish.

original: 'di ni chu yi dkyil 'khor te //
analyzed: 'di ni chu yi dkyil 'khor te //
translated: This is the mandala of water.

original: 'di la rdo rje mgon po lha //🔽zhes so // ji skad du /
analyzed: 'di la rdo rje mgon po lha // zhes so // ji skad du /
translated: In this, the deity is Vajranatha.

original: sgron ma bzhi par yang /
analyzed: sgron ma bzhi par yang /
translated: It is also said in the Four Lamps:

original: 'gro ba bzhi ni steng dang ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba bzhi ni steng dang ni //
translated: The four movements are above,

original: logs dang drang po 'og tu yang //
analyzed: logs dang drang po 'og tu yang //
translated: on the side, straight, and below.

original: zhes so // kha sbyor du yang /
analyzed: zhes so // kha sbyor du yang /
translated: It is also said in the Union with Buddha:🔽Fire and wind,

original: me dang nges par rlung dang ni //🔽de bzhin dbang chen dang ni chu //
analyzed: me dang nges par rlung dang ni // de bzhin dbang chen dang ni chu //
translated: earth and water,

original: 'khor lor sems kyi rgyu ba las //
analyzed: 'khor lor sems kyi rgyu ba las //
translated: from the movement of the mind in the cakras,

original: steng logs drang po 'og tu 'gro //
analyzed: steng logs drang po 'og tu 'gro //
translated: above, on the side, straight, and below.

original: zhes pa dang / dgongs pa lung ston las kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / dgongs pa lung ston las kyang /
translated: And in the Sandhivyākaraṇa:

original: me dang nges par rlung dang ni ;
analyzed: me dang nges par rlung dang ni ;
translated: Fire and wind,

original: / de bzhin dbang chen dang ni chu //
analyzed: / de bzhin dbang chen dang ni chu //
translated: Likewise, the great elements of earth and water,

original: 'khor lo sems kyi rgyu ba las //
analyzed: 'khor lo sems kyi rgyu ba las //
translated: the wheel, and the movement of the mind,

original: steng logs drang po 'og tu 'gro //
analyzed: steng logs drang po 'og tu 'gro //
translated: are above, straight, and below.

original: de rnams dbus su rang lha nyid //
analyzed: de rnams dbus su rang lha nyid //
translated: In the middle of those is one's own deity.

original: phan tshun du ni bzhi pa sbyor //
analyzed: phan tshun du ni bzhi pa sbyor //
translated: The fourth is the union of the two.

original: zhes so // thugs kyi sgo gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // thugs kyi sgo gsungs pa /
translated: The door of mind is stated:

original: gsum pa ni sku dang gsung gi sgo la ltos nas so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sku dang gsung gi sgo la ltos nas so //
translated: The third is in relation to the doors of body and speech.

original: yid kyi zhes pa ni yid tsam du rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi zhes pa ni yid tsam du rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The mind is to be realized as just the mind.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: zla ba nyi ma'i rab dbye las //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i rab dbye las // zhes pa ste /
translated: From the division of the moon and sun.

original: zla ba nyi ma ni g-yon dang g-yas kyi rtsa ste //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma ni g-yon dang g-yas kyi rtsa ste //
translated: The moon and sun are the left and right channels.

original: gnyis po'i dbye bas 'bab pa las dang / steng du rlung gi rim pas spog dang rtsol pa dang / 'og tu rdzas kyi rim pas khu ba dang khrag 'bab pa las so //
analyzed: gnyis po'i dbye bas 'bab pa las dang / steng du rlung gi rim pas spog dang rtsol pa dang / 'og tu rdzas kyi rim pas khu ba dang khrag 'bab pa las so //
translated: From the division of those two, the downward-moving wind, and from the upward movement of the wind, the exhalation and inhalation, and from the downward movement of the substances, semen and blood.

original: 'di las na phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyis rtogs par bya ba kho na yin pa'i phyir mchog gi sgo'o //
analyzed: 'di las na phra mo'i rnal 'byor gyis rtogs par bya ba kho na yin pa'i phyir mchog gi sgo'o //
translated: Since this is to be realized by the yoga of the subtle, it is the supreme door.

original: de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang /
translated: And also:

original: 'jug dang 'byung ba nyid las kyang //
analyzed: 'jug dang 'byung ba nyid las kyang //
translated: And from the entry and emergence.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
