analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: steng du srog dang rtsol ba dag gi dang / 'og tu rdzas dag gi 'jug pa dang 'byung pa dag las so //
analyzed: steng du srog dang rtsol ba dag gi dang / 'og tu rdzas dag gi 'jug pa dang 'byung pa dag las so //
translated: From the entry and emergence of the life-force and exertion above, and of the substances below.

original: yang na 'og gi @318b 'jug pa las dang / steng ni 'byung ba las so //
analyzed: yang na 'og gi @318b 'jug pa las dang / steng ni 'byung ba las so //
translated: Or else, the entry is from below, and the emergence is from above.

original: 'di mchog gi sgo yin na /
analyzed: 'di mchog gi sgo yin na /
translated: If this is the door of the supreme,

original: ci zhig gi sgo nas su zhig 'jug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gi sgo nas su zhig 'jug pa yin zhe na /
translated: through what door does someone enter?

original: 'og gi sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'og gi sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The entry is through the lower door, etc. is stated.

original: la la n'a'i lam ni 'og gi sgo'o //
analyzed: la la n'a'i lam ni 'og gi sgo'o //
translated: The path of lalana is the lower door.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The exalted consciousness is the consciousness.

original: bde ba chen por 'jug pa'i 'jug pa las snang ba gnyis po'i 'og tu 'jug pa na lhan cig skyes pa 'char ba'i phyir dpyid kyi dus su snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba chen por 'jug pa'i 'jug pa las snang ba gnyis po'i 'og tu 'jug pa na lhan cig skyes pa 'char ba'i phyir dpyid kyi dus su snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When entering into great bliss, the entry is below the two lights, and the innate arises, like the appearance in the spring season.

original: ra sa n'ar brjod pa ni steng gi sgo'o //
analyzed: ra sa n'ar brjod pa ni steng gi sgo'o //
translated: The expression rasana is the upper door.

original: khams rnams ni sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mig la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams su snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams rnams ni sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mig la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams su snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The elements appear as the impurities of the eyes, etc., which are of the nature of earth, etc.

original: rul pa'i dri la sogs pa dur khrod kyi gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rul pa'i dri la sogs pa dur khrod kyi gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the forms of the charnel ground appear as the smell of decay, etc.

original: yang na 'og gi sgo nas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po lus can rnams kyi lus la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na 'og gi sgo nas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po lus can rnams kyi lus la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the five aggregates of consciousness, etc., which are embodied in the body, appear from the lower door,

original: phung po lnga po ni nang gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lnga po ni nang gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the five aggregates are of the nature of the inner self.

original: steng gi sgo nas sa la sogs pa'i khams 'byung pa lnga po skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: steng gi sgo nas sa la sogs pa'i khams 'byung pa lnga po skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The five elements of earth, etc., arise from the upper door,

original: phyi rol gyi phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the external direction.🔽In the same way, the six collections of consciousness, beginning with the visual, are the nature of the Buddhas, Vairochana, etc., because they grasp the six objects, form, etc.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs gang yin pa 'di rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug po 'dzin pa'i slad du steng gi sgo nas g-yo ba
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs gang yin pa 'di rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul drug po 'dzin pa'i slad du steng gi sgo nas g-yo ba
translated: They move from the upper door,

original: rnams te / 'jug bzhin pa de rnams kyi yul lhar mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa rdzogs pa rnams gnas pa ni 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams te / 'jug bzhin pa de rnams kyi yul lhar mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa rdzogs pa rnams gnas pa ni 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: The ones who are entering, having perfected their desires through the door of manifest clinging to the object as a deity, abide. This is to be known as the entry.

original: nang du rab tu 'jug pa de rnams slar yang steng gi sgo nas gtong bar byed de rang gi lha la nye bar longs spyod pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: nang du rab tu 'jug pa de rnams slar yang steng gi sgo nas gtong bar byed de rang gi lha la nye bar longs spyod pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Those who are entering internally again emit through the upper door for the sake of enjoying their own deity.

original: yang na bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo las rnam par shes pa ste khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa 'og gi sgo nas la la n'a'i lam gyis padma'i nang du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo las rnam par shes pa ste khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa 'og gi sgo nas la la n'a'i lam gyis padma'i nang du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, consciousness, which is endowed with special knowledge, from the wheel of great bliss, through the path of lalana, attains the inside of the lotus through the lower door.

original: rnal 'byor gyi stobs las de nyid steng gi lam nas bkug pa ni khams te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi stobs las de nyid steng gi lam nas bkug pa ni khams te /
translated: Through the power of yoga, that very [consciousness] is drawn up through the upper path, which is the element.

original: khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi rgyas par byed cing gnas dang po bzhi rnams su skye bar byed do //
analyzed: khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi rgyas par byed cing gnas dang po bzhi rnams su skye bar byed do //
translated: It causes the twenty-four elements to expand and generates in the four abodes.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again it is said:

original: nyi ma rnam par rgyas pa'i 'od kyis mdzes ma ni //
analyzed: nyi ma rnam par rgyas pa'i 'od kyis mdzes ma ni //
translated: The beautiful one, with the light of the fully blossomed sun,

original: stobs chen sgra yi gos kyis mdzes pa'i ze'u 'bru las //🔽mgo po'i rtse mor sgeg cing legs par yongs gang ba'i //🔽'od kyis mtshan pa'i ri bong @319a * //
analyzed: stobs chen sgra yi gos kyis mdzes pa'i ze'u 'bru las // mgo po'i rtse mor sgeg cing legs par yongs gang ba'i // 'od kyis mtshan pa'i ri bong @319a * //
translated: The moon, with its beautiful whorl of powerful rays,🔽is rising in the east, its crest resplendent,

original: can ni sar pa 'char //🔽sna tshogs me tog ro yis myos pa'i rig pa yang //
analyzed: can ni sar pa 'char // sna tshogs me tog ro yis myos pa'i rig pa yang //
translated: its light fully filling the sky.

original: myur dang dal ba bar ma la ni klung gi sgra //
analyzed: myur dang dal ba bar ma la ni klung gi sgra //
translated: The river's sound is neither fast nor slow,🔽but moderate, as if intoxicated by the taste of the various flowers.

original: bung ba nyer lhags mtshan phyed dga' ston chen por ni //
analyzed: bung ba nyer lhags mtshan phyed dga' ston chen por ni //
translated: The bees are buzzing, and the moon, the great festival of midnight,

original: 'dzin par byed cing der son blo ni ngo mtshar ro //🔽'char ba'i nub pe nyer 'ongs mtshan mor byed pa slar //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed cing der son blo ni ngo mtshar ro // 'char ba'i nub pe nyer 'ongs mtshan mor byed pa slar //
translated: is held in the sky, and the mind, reaching there, is amazed.🔽The sun, having come to the west at dawn,

original: 'di las kyang ni g-yo med cod pan la ni 'char //
analyzed: 'di las kyang ni g-yo med cod pan la ni 'char //
translated: is rising again in the east, its crown unmoving.

original: mtha' gnyis pa yi cha zad skad cig la //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis pa yi cha zad skad cig la //
translated: In a single moment, the two ends of the sky

original: zla ba nyi ma snang bar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma snang bar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: are not illuminated by the sun and moon.

original: rgya mtsho'i chu yi dbus su nyi ma 'char ba ste //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i chu yi dbus su nyi ma 'char ba ste //
translated: The sun rises in the middle of the ocean's water,

original: rtse mo las kyang zla ba nub par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rtse mo las kyang zla ba nub par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: and the moon sets from the mountain peak.

original: song ba'i steng gi sgra gcan 'jig dus me 'dis ni //
analyzed: song ba'i steng gi sgra gcan 'jig dus me 'dis ni //
translated: The sound of the going above Rāhu, at the time of destruction, is this fire.

original: 'og gi bsil zer byed pa dag ni khyur mid byed //
analyzed: 'og gi bsil zer byed pa dag ni khyur mid byed //
translated: Below, the cool rays are swallowed.

original: padma can ni padma'i bzhin te spyan ma ru //
analyzed: padma can ni padma'i bzhin te spyan ma ru //
translated: Padminī is like a lotus, Tārā.

original: rab tu gsal te yul dang yul can 'dres pa yin //
analyzed: rab tu gsal te yul dang yul can 'dres pa yin //
translated: It is very clear, the object and subject are mixed.

original: dang por mi shes 'di ni de las gzhan du na //
analyzed: dang por mi shes 'di ni de las gzhan du na //
translated: First, this is unknown, other than that.

original: rdo rje chu skyes gnyis po 'dres pa 'di ru'o //
analyzed: rdo rje chu skyes gnyis po 'dres pa 'di ru'o //
translated: The two vajra lotuses are mixed here.

original: skad cig sgrub pa po ni sa bon nyed pa las //
analyzed: skad cig sgrub pa po ni sa bon nyed pa las //
translated: The instant the practitioner is seedless,

original: sdom pa gsum po thob par 'gyur te bzhi pa can //
analyzed: sdom pa gsum po thob par 'gyur te bzhi pa can //
translated: he obtains the three vows, having the fourth.

original: lhan skyes mi zad gnas kyi cha shas phreng ba ni //
analyzed: lhan skyes mi zad gnas kyi cha shas phreng ba ni //
translated: The garland of parts of the place of the innate imperishable

original: blangs pa'i dus su brjod pa dang bral lhag pa'o //
analyzed: blangs pa'i dus su brjod pa dang bral lhag pa'o //
translated: is taken at the time of expression, the remainder.🔽If the well-trained Vajra Lāsyā

original: gal te legs par bslab pa'i rdo rje sgeg mo dang // bla ma yi ni zhal nas rtogs shing thob 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gal te legs par bslab pa'i rdo rje sgeg mo dang // bla ma yi ni zhal nas rtogs shing thob 'gyur ba //
translated: realizes and obtains it from the guru’s mouth,

original: gang gi yin pa de tshe mchog 'bring sgrub pa ni //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa de tshe mchog 'bring sgrub pa ni //
translated: then at that time, the supreme and middling accomplishments

original: rnam par nges pa thob 'gyur de ni de nyid rig / ces so //
analyzed: rnam par nges pa thob 'gyur de ni de nyid rig / ces so //
translated: are attained with certainty, and he knows reality.

original: de nyid 'gro'o de zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid 'gro'o de zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: That itself goes, that itself comes, and so forth.

original: 'dis ni steng dang 'og gi sgo'i dbye bas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i tshul de gshegs su gsol ba dang / spyan drangs ba'i tshul gang dag yin pa de dag gi dus gsum pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad de 'khor lo gsum du gnas pa'i dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang /
analyzed: 'dis ni steng dang 'og gi sgo'i dbye bas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i tshul de gshegs su gsol ba dang / spyan drangs ba'i tshul gang dag yin pa de dag gi dus gsum pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad de 'khor lo gsum du gnas pa'i dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang /
translated: Here, the way of going and coming by the division of the upper and lower doors is the way of inviting and requesting the departure of all buddhas of the three times, that is, the twenty-four heroes abiding in the three wheels,

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga pa dpal he ru ka'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga pa dpal he ru ka'o //
translated: and the twenty-fifth, glorious Heruka.

original: de bzhin du mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni nyi shu rtsa brgyad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni nyi shu rtsa brgyad de /
translated: Similarly, the dakinis are twenty-eight.

original: ye shes dang / thugs dang / gsung dang / sku'i 'khor lor gnas pa mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i rtsa'i yi nang du'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang / thugs dang / gsung dang / sku'i 'khor lor gnas pa mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i rtsa'i yi nang du'o //
translated: They abide in the wheels of exalted wisdom, mind, speech, and body, and in the channels of the yoginis beginning with A-VAI.

original: sbyor ba'i ma ni grub pa'i dpa' bo dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams mig la sogs pa'i sgo nas rtsa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ma ni grub pa'i dpa' bo dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams mig la sogs pa'i sgo nas rtsa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The yoginis of union are the heroines of spiritual attainment, and the coemergent yoginis who abide by the nature of the channels through the doors of the eyes and so forth.

original: yang na lhan cig skyes grub de rang bzhin gyis grub pa kho na 'dir rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi brtags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na lhan cig skyes grub de rang bzhin gyis grub pa kho na 'dir rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi brtags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, the establishment of the connate is posited here as only natural establishment and not as imputed establishment.

original: @319b dbye ba ji lta bu yin pa ston par byed de /🔽'jug pa dang ldog pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang / ldang ba dang / 'jug pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / yon tan dang skyon dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
analyzed: @319b dbye ba ji lta bu yin pa ston par byed de / 'jug pa dang ldog pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dang / ldang ba dang / 'jug pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / yon tan dang skyon dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
translated: It shows what kind of division there is.🔽The connate is all that is engaged through the three doors, such as engagement and disengagement, arising and disintegrating, rising from meditative concentration and not rising from meditative concentration, meditative equipoise and not in meditative equipoise, qualities and faults, thoroughly afflicted and completely pure,

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang mi bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dus byas kyi bdag nyid can sgo gsum nas 'jug bzhin pa de thams cad ni lhan cig skyes grub ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang mi bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'dus byas kyi bdag nyid can sgo gsum nas 'jug bzhin pa de thams cad ni lhan cig skyes grub ste /
translated: happiness and suffering, happiness and unhappiness, and so on, which have the nature of conditioned phenomena.

original: dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'u rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las rgyas par bstan pa gsum pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'u rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las rgyas par bstan pa gsum pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the third chapter of the great commentary on the Spring Time of the Subduer, the Lamp of the Great Secret, which extensively teaches the ritual of the means of achievement of the completion stage.

original: // / sgo gsum po'i gnas lha'i 'khor lor rtogs par bya ba de'i gnas la sogs pa sa bcu'i rim pas gnas par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: // / sgo gsum po'i gnas lha'i 'khor lor rtogs par bya ba de'i gnas la sogs pa sa bcu'i rim pas gnas par bstan par bya'o //
translated: The place of the three doors, which is to be realized as the circle of deities, is to be taught as abiding by the stages of the ten grounds and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: sgo rgyas par bstan pa'i de ma thag tu gsungs pas na /
analyzed: sgo rgyas par bstan pa'i de ma thag tu gsungs pas na /
translated: Since it is taught immediately after the extensive teaching of the door,

original: de nas so //🔽gang yang rung zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas so // gang yang rung zhes pa ni /
translated: then.🔽Any means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang yang rung ba'i ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang yang rung ba'i ste /
translated: any tathagata.

original: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong ba yin gyi /
translated: It is common to all sentient beings,

original: bdag nyid kho na'i ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na'i ma yin pa'o //
translated: not just to oneself.🔽The place, etc.

original: gnas la sogs pa ni gnas te /
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa ni gnas te /
translated: is the place.

original: bstan par bya ste zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: bstan par bya ste zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
translated: It is to be taught.

original: rgyun dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pas de gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyun dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pas de gsungs te /
translated: He declares that with “nine currents,” and so on.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i sku'i sgo rnams gang yin pa ni rgyun dgu'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i sku'i sgo rnams gang yin pa ni rgyun dgu'o //
translated: The “nine currents” are the doors of the body that were mentioned above.

original: de rnams su gnas pa ni rtsa rnams gang yin pa ste thams cad kyi lha dgu'o //
analyzed: de rnams su gnas pa ni rtsa rnams gang yin pa ste thams cad kyi lha dgu'o //
translated: The “channels” are the ones that are located in those, all of which are the nine deities.

original: de bzhin du mgo bo nas brtsams te bha ga'i dbus su son pa'i aa ba dh'u t'i'i cha shas bcu po kho na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bcur brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mgo bo nas brtsams te bha ga'i dbus su son pa'i aa ba dh'u t'i'i cha shas bcu po kho na sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bcur brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, beginning with the head and ending in the center of the bhaga, the ten parts of the avadhūtī are to be called the ten buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: bden pa mthong ba las nang du de myong zhing mthong ba de'i tshe 'bad pa mang pos bsgrub par bya ba'i mthong ba'i lam la sogs pas ci zhig bya zhes bya bar dgongs so //🔽sa bshad nas /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba las nang du de myong zhing mthong ba de'i tshe 'bad pa mang pos bsgrub par bya ba'i mthong ba'i lam la sogs pas ci zhig bya zhes bya bar dgongs so // sa bshad nas /
translated: When one experiences and sees that internally through seeing the truth, what is the use of the path of seeing, and so on, which is to be accomplished with much effort?🔽Having explained the stages,

original: sa'i gnas gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: sa'i gnas gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: he declares the other stages of the stages:

original: dpral ba zhes pa la sogs te /
analyzed: dpral ba zhes pa la sogs te /
translated: “forehead,” and so on.

original: 'dir lus 'di las dpral pa'i gnas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir lus 'di las dpral pa'i gnas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, beginning with the place of the forehead, the great-bliss chakra,

original: rtsa'i 'khor lo'i nges pa ste gtan la phab pa @320a * //
analyzed: rtsa'i 'khor lo'i nges pa ste gtan la phab pa @320a * //
translated: The certainty of the cakras.🔽

original: shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya'o //
translated: The certainty of the cakras should be known.

original: de ltar na der son pa'i sum cu rtsa gnyis kho na longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa dag tu rab tu byung ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na der son pa'i sum cu rtsa gnyis kho na longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa dag tu rab tu byung ba ste /
translated: Thus, the thirty-two that are there are the ones who have gone forth into the enjoyment body, etc.

original: gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo lus kyi shing gi rtsa ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di kho na las 'og tu yal ga ste lus ni shing ngo //
analyzed: gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo lus kyi shing gi rtsa ba nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di kho na las 'og tu yal ga ste lus ni shing ngo //
translated: Since the cakra of the uṣṇīṣa is the root of the tree of the body, the branches are below it, and the body is the tree.

original: de la lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis te bzhi la kha 'og tu bltas pa'i rtsa nyi shu dang / phyogs gnyis dang rgya ba ste gsum po la rtsa gsum dang / snying ga dang rdo rje la rtsa drug dang / lu gu rgyud du bcings pa'i rtsa gsum 'khor lo bzhi'i mchod rten gyi'o //
analyzed: de la lag pa gnyis dang rkang pa gnyis te bzhi la kha 'og tu bltas pa'i rtsa nyi shu dang / phyogs gnyis dang rgya ba ste gsum po la rtsa gsum dang / snying ga dang rdo rje la rtsa drug dang / lu gu rgyud du bcings pa'i rtsa gsum 'khor lo bzhi'i mchod rten gyi'o //
translated: There, the four hands and feet have twenty downward-facing channels, the two sides and the back have three channels, the heart and the vajra have six channels, and the three channels bound in a chain are the stūpas of the four cakras.

original: de ltar dpral ba kho na las rtsa'i 'khor lo nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dpral ba kho na las rtsa'i 'khor lo nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the certainty of the cakras is on the forehead alone.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni sum cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni sum cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams te /
translated: The yoginīs are those thirty-two.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa ni de dang mtshungs par 'bab po //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa ni de dang mtshungs par 'bab po //
translated: That which is the Thought of Enlightenment is the one that flows in the same way.

original: de kho na khanda ka p'a la la sogs pa'i dpa' bo rnams so //
analyzed: de kho na khanda ka p'a la la sogs pa'i dpa' bo rnams so //
translated: Those who are the heroes, such as Khaṇḍakapāla, are the heroes.

original: rdo rje gtum po la sogs pa ni dpa' bo chen po ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gtum po la sogs pa ni dpa' bo chen po ste /
translated: Vajra-Caṇḍa, etc., are the great heroes.

original: rdo rje gtum po ni dpal he ru ka'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gtum po ni dpal he ru ka'o //
translated: Vajra-Caṇḍa is Śrī Heruka.

original: don de byang chub sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: don de byang chub sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: That meaning is stated by the one called Thought of Enlightenment, etc.

original: 'di rnams phyi rol du sku'i sgo la sogs pa rnams dang / rang gi dri la sogs pa'i rnam grangs rnams dang / gtum drag la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams phyi rol du sku'i sgo la sogs pa rnams dang / rang gi dri la sogs pa'i rnam grangs rnams dang / gtum drag la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: These are externally in the doors of the body, etc., and the synonyms of one’s smell, etc., and Caṇḍa, etc.

original: nang du ni spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi gnas pa rnams kyi yul gyi ming dz'a landha ra la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: nang du ni spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi gnas pa rnams kyi yul gyi ming dz'a landha ra la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: Internally, they are in the twenty-four places, such as the crown of the head, etc., in the names of the objects, such as Jālandhara, etc.

original: mkha' spyod ces bya ba la sogs pas de'i rnam par dbye ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mkha' spyod ces bya ba la sogs pas de'i rnam par dbye ba gsungs te /
translated: The classification of those is stated by the one called Khecarī, etc.

original: pull'i ra nas brtsam te m'a la wa'i bar gyi rtsa gang yin pa de rnams ni mkha' spyod ma'o //
analyzed: pull'i ra nas brtsam te m'a la wa'i bar gyi rtsa gang yin pa de rnams ni mkha' spyod ma'o //
translated: Those channels that begin with Pullīramalaya and end with Mālava are the Khecarīs.

original: k'a ma r'u pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: k'a ma r'u pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with Kāmarūpa,

original: he ma la ya'i bar ni sa spyod ma'o //
analyzed: he ma la ya'i bar ni sa spyod ma'o //
translated: up to Hemavat is the earth-dwelling.

original: pre ta pu ri nas brtsams te ku lu ta'i bar gyis 'og na gnas pa rnams te /
analyzed: pre ta pu ri nas brtsams te ku lu ta'i bar gyis 'og na gnas pa rnams te /
translated: Beginning with Pretapuri, up to Kuluta, are the lower-dwelling.

original: lus kyi steng dang bar dang tha ma'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: lus kyi steng dang bar dang tha ma'i dbye ba las so //
translated: This is because of the division of the upper, middle, and lower parts of the body.

original: mkha' spyod ma la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi po 'di rnams ni sa bcur rab tu gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' spyod ma la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi po 'di rnams ni sa bcur rab tu gnas pa rnams so //
translated: These twenty-four, beginning with Khecarī, are well-established in the ten stages.

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa rnams ni de'i cha shas sgo rnams su rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa rnams ni de'i cha shas sgo rnams su rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The channels of the nature of Kākavaktrā, etc., are located in the doors that are parts of that.

original: 'di nyid sku gsung thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid sku gsung thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: This is stated by “body, speech, mind,” etc.

original: gnas ni nang gi rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: gnas ni nang gi rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The location is the inner division.

original: spyi bo la sogs par phye ba de la brten nas gnas pa rnams so zhes pa ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: spyi bo la sogs par phye ba de la brten nas gnas pa rnams so zhes pa ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The location is based on the division of the crown, etc. This is the remainder of the sentence.

original: 'di @320b nyid ni gnas la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid brten pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa rnams ni mkha' 'gro ma ste /
analyzed: 'di @320b nyid ni gnas la sogs pa gang yin pa de nyid brten pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa rnams ni mkha' 'gro ma ste /
translated: The channels, which are the nature of the twenty-four places, and so on, are the dakinis.🔽In the same way, the ten channels that are the supports of those are the nature of the earth.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.

original: de bzhin du de'i rten du gyur pa'i rtsa bcu po de rnams ni sa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rten du gyur pa'i rtsa bcu po de rnams ni sa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ni gnas las ma 'das par ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa ste /🔽rnal 'byor pa gang dang gang gis gnas gang dang gang yin pa de dang der lhan cig skyes pa gnas pa yin gyi brtags pa ni ma yin no //🔽'di rnams nyid ni rab dga' sogs //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ni gnas las ma 'das par ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa ste / rnal 'byor pa gang dang gang gis gnas gang dang gang yin pa de dang der lhan cig skyes pa gnas pa yin gyi brtags pa ni ma yin no // 'di rnams nyid ni rab dga' sogs //
translated: The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.

original: sa rnams su ni yang dag bshad //🔽ces pa ni /
analyzed: sa rnams su ni yang dag bshad // ces pa ni /
translated: The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.

original: de la spyi bo dang / spyi gtsug dang / rna ba g-yas pa dang rgyab rnams ni gnas te byang chub kyi sems gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di nyid rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de la spyi bo dang / spyi gtsug dang / rna ba g-yas pa dang rgyab rnams ni gnas te byang chub kyi sems gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di nyid rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.🔽The nature of the places is the nature of the channels.

original: thim pa la sogs pa'i rim pas dga' ba gsum po skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thim pa la sogs pa'i rim pas dga' ba gsum po skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates the three joys through the stages of dissolution, etc.

original: rna ba g-yon dang / smin ma'i dbus dang / mig dang dbung pa'i rtsa ba ni nye ba'i gnas te gnas dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba g-yon dang / smin ma'i dbus dang / mig dang dbung pa'i rtsa ba ni nye ba'i gnas te gnas dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ear, the middle of the eyebrows, the eyes, and the base of the arms are the neighboring places, because they are near the places.

original: 'di nyid ni dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni dri ma med pa ste /
translated: This very [path] is the stainless,

original: ye shes kyi mes rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mes rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fire of intuition burns the stains of conceptualization.

original: mchan khung dang nu ma ni zhing ste /
analyzed: mchan khung dang nu ma ni zhing ste /
translated: The armpits and breasts are the fields,

original: rdul dang 'o ma'i zol gyis byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul dang 'o ma'i zol gyis byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the bodhicitta arises in the form of sweat and milk.

original: 'di nyid ni 'od byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni 'od byed pa ste /
translated: This very [path] is the illuminating,

original: de la kun du lta ba las yid kyi kun du dga' ba'i 'od bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la kun du lta ba las yid kyi kun du dga' ba'i 'od bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the light of mental joy is generated from looking at that.

original: lte ba dang sna rtse ni nye ba'i zhing ste /
analyzed: lte ba dang sna rtse ni nye ba'i zhing ste /
translated: The navel and the tip of the nose are the neighboring fields,

original: dri dang / snabs 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dri dang / snabs 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they hold odors and mucus.

original: 'di nyid ni 'od 'phro ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni 'od 'phro ba ste /
translated: This very [path] is the blazing,

original: ye shes kyi sems rab tu snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sems rab tu snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind of intuition shines forth.

original: kha dang mgrin pa ni 'dun pa ste rol nye bar longs spyod pas 'dod pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dang mgrin pa ni 'dun pa ste rol nye bar longs spyod pas 'dod pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mouth and throat are the “approacher,” because one turns away from desire by enjoying the taste.

original: 'di nyid ni rgyal bar dka' ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni rgyal bar dka' ba ste /
translated: This is the “difficult to conquer,”

original: ro las ldog par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ro las ldog par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to turn away from the taste.

original: snying ga dang chu so ni nye ba'i 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: snying ga dang chu so ni nye ba'i 'dun pa ste /
translated: The heart and the urinary duct are the “approacher of the approacher,”

original: don rtogs pa dag ni bza' bar bya ba smin pa la de rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs pa dag ni bza' bar bya ba smin pa la de rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because one turns away from the ripening of the food that is understood as the object.

original: 'di nyid ni mngon du gyur pa ste /🔽de'i mtshams su'am /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni mngon du gyur pa ste / de'i mtshams su'am /
translated: This is the “manifest,”🔽because it is manifest at the juncture of that,

original: smin pa na mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smin pa na mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or at the ripening.

original: gsang ba dang bshad lam dag ni 'du ba ste /
analyzed: gsang ba dang bshad lam dag ni 'du ba ste /
translated: The secret and the path of excretion are the “assembly,”

original: thabs dang shes rab dag snyoms par zhugs pa de la 'dres shing rtsa gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab dag snyoms par zhugs pa de la 'dres shing rtsa gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the method and wisdom enter into union, and are mixed and one taste there.

original: 'di nyid ni ring du song ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni ring du song ba ste /
translated: This is the “gone afar,”

original: de'i rtsa'i bug pa de ni ring ba nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽bral dang byin pa ni @321a * //
analyzed: de'i rtsa'i bug pa de ni ring ba nyid kyi phyir ro // bral dang byin pa ni @321a * //
translated: because that channel hole is far away.🔽The thighs and calves are the “approacher of the assembly,”

original: nye ba'i 'du ba ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i 'du ba ste /
translated: because they are the approacher of the assembly.

original: sngar gsungs pa dag las kyang 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa dag las kyang 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mixed up with the previously mentioned ones.

original: 'di nyid ni mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: This very one is the immovable,

original: de'i sbyor ba las ldog par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba las ldog par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to turn away from its practice.

original: sor mo dang rkang pa'i rgyab ni dur khrod de /
analyzed: sor mo dang rkang pa'i rgyab ni dur khrod de /
translated: The back of the fingers and toes is the charnel ground,

original: gnas thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir na rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir na rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of all the places, and because it causes the experience of the place of non-conceptuality.

original: 'di nyid ni legs pa'i blo gros te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni legs pa'i blo gros te /
translated: This very one is excellent wisdom,

original: bdag med pa nyid ni legs pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid ni legs pa yin la /
translated: because selflessness is excellent,

original: de der rig bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de der rig bzhin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and because it is known there.

original: mthe bong dang pus mo ni nye ba'i dur khrod de /
analyzed: mthe bong dang pus mo ni nye ba'i dur khrod de /
translated: The thumb and knee are the nearby charnel ground,

original: snga ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: snga ma lta bu'o //
translated: as before.

original: 'di nyid ni chos kyi sprin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni chos kyi sprin te /
translated: This very one is the cloud of the teaching,

original: spyi bo nas sprin gyi char bab pa bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kun du ru lhung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi bo nas sprin gyi char bab pa bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kun du ru lhung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the bodhisattva mind falls like a rain cloud from the head.

original: sa bcus yang dag par bsdus pa'i gnas la sogs pa de rnams nyid sa bcu po ste /
analyzed: sa bcus yang dag par bsdus pa'i gnas la sogs pa de rnams nyid sa bcu po ste /
translated: Those very places, etc. , which are included in the ten stages, are the ten stages.

original: de dag tu thim pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ye shes gong nas gong du rim gyis 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tu thim pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ye shes gong nas gong du rim gyis 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pristine consciousnesses increase in stages, in sequence, by their dissolving into those.

original: de rnams su'i sa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams su'i sa yin zhe na /
translated: Whose stages are they?

original: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The six faculties and so on are stated.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug po gang yin pa 'di nyid rang bzhin gyis byang chub sems dpa' ste /🔽de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po gang yin pa rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas rnams su sngar khong du chud par byas pa de rnams kyi sar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug po gang yin pa 'di nyid rang bzhin gyis byang chub sems dpa' ste / de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po gang yin pa rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas rnams su sngar khong du chud par byas pa de rnams kyi sar gyur pa yin te /
translated: These six faculties, such as the eyes, are naturally bodhisattvas.🔽Similarly, the aggregates, such as form, are naturally buddhas.

original: rang bzhin gyis bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'di rnams su'o zhes pas sa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'di rnams su'o zhes pas sa'o //
translated: The stages of those who have previously been understood are stages because the naturally existing buddhas and bodhisattvas are in those.

original: 'di nyid las na 'phags pa rnams kho nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di nyid las na 'phags pa rnams kho nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In this way, only the buddhas do not attain buddhahood.

original: ji tsam du so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phung po dang dbang po gang yin pa rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid yin pa las /
analyzed: ji tsam du so so'i skye bo rnams kyi phung po dang dbang po gang yin pa rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid yin pa las /
translated: Whatever the aggregates and faculties of ordinary beings are, they are the nature of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: From that, they will attain buddhahood,

original: de kho na nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa dang so so'i skye bo dag dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa dang so so'i skye bo dag dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because in reality, the tathāgatas and ordinary beings are inseparable.

original: 'o na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub 'thob pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub 'thob pa yin te /
translated: Well, if enlightenment is attained in three incalculable aeons,

original: de ji ltar na phung po la sogs pa sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du shes pa tsam gyis thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na phung po la sogs pa sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du shes pa tsam gyis thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is it that it is attained merely by knowing that the aggregates and so on are the nature of the buddhas and so on?

original: byang sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gang gi tshe rdo rje'i kha'am /
analyzed: byang sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gang gi tshe rdo rje'i kha'am /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Bodhisattva,” and so on.🔽When the bodhicitta that fills the vajra space

original: chu skyes kyi nang du byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa @321b gnyis kyis gang ba nyid myong bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: chu skyes kyi nang du byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa @321b gnyis kyis gang ba nyid myong bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: or the lotus is experienced,

original: de rnams sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become Buddhas themselves.

original: des na dus la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: des na dus la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not dependent on time.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pas bzhugs so zhes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pas bzhugs so zhes pa ma yin nam /
translated: But, aren’t the Buddhas present in the Buddha-fields of Abhirati and so forth in the form of the mandala of gnosis?

original: mi'i srid par 'khor bzhin pa bdag cag rnams gang las na byang chub tu nye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi'i srid par 'khor bzhin pa bdag cag rnams gang las na byang chub tu nye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the doubt of those who think, “We are still in the human life-cycle, so how can we be close to enlightenment?”

original: rang lus nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rang lus nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “In one’s own body,” and so on.

original: rang gi rang bzhin khong du chud pa las sad pa de'i srid pa ni sangs rgyas nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin khong du chud pa las sad pa de'i srid pa ni sangs rgyas nyid de /
translated: Awakening is the existence of one who is awakened from the realization of one’s own nature.

original: de ni rang gi lus nyid la gnas pa de rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang gi lus nyid la gnas pa de rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: That is present in one’s own body. That is the arrangement.

original: 'di nyid las na de nyid sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid las na de nyid sangs rgyas kyi zhing ste /
translated: And this very [body] is the Buddha-field.

original: 'di nyid du rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i lha cig skyes pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di nyid du rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i lha cig skyes pa'i sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the deity of natural existence, the coemergent buddha, resides here,

original: gzhan mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa rnams su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa rnams su ni ma yin no //
translated: not in other places such as Abhirati.

original: de'i phyir lus las gzhan du ni phyi rol gyi gnas rnams su'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus las gzhan du ni phyi rol gyi gnas rnams su'o //
translated: Therefore, in other places, external locations other than the body,

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni rang bzhin gyis te rang dgar byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni rang bzhin gyis te rang dgar byung ba rnams so //
translated: buddhahood is natural, that is, it occurs naturally.

original: rang bzhin te ji ltar skyes pa de nyid kyis gnas pa yin gyi khyad par du byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin te ji ltar skyes pa de nyid kyis gnas pa yin gyi khyad par du byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is natural, that is, it exists just as it is born, not as something distinguished.

original: 'dod pa ni gang de rnams la 'dod cing re ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gang de rnams la 'dod cing re ba'o //
translated: Desire is that which is desired and hoped for in those places.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs shing rig pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa rtogs shing rig pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: Those who understand and know the stage of completion

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa kho nas sangs rgyas nyid du 'dod par bya ste /🔽'gro ba 'di kun sangs rgyas mnga' bdag nyid //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa kho nas sangs rgyas nyid du 'dod par bya ste / 'gro ba 'di kun sangs rgyas mnga' bdag nyid //
translated: should desire buddhahood as natural existence alone.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “This entire world is the nature of the Buddha.”

original: de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa 'chi ba las na pha rol du yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa 'chi ba las na pha rol du yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because it is said, “The one who becomes a tathagata is beyond death.”

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: Also, neutral thoughts are abandoned.

original: dpal kye'i rdo rje las /🔽sangs rgyas ma yin sems can ni //
analyzed: dpal kye'i rdo rje las / sangs rgyas ma yin sems can ni //
translated: In the Shri Hevajra Tantra it says:🔽Not a single sentient being exists

original: gcig kyang yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gcig kyang yod pa ma yin te //
translated: That is not a buddha.

original: rang dang rang gi rtog pa las //
analyzed: rang dang rang gi rtog pa las //
translated: From one’s own and one’s own

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / slob dpon phyag na rdo rjes kyang //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang / slob dpon phyag na rdo rjes kyang //
translated: The master Vajrapani also says:

original: mi ni rdo rje 'dzin rnam pa //
analyzed: mi ni rdo rje 'dzin rnam pa //
translated: Men are the form of Vajrapani,

original: bud med rdo rje btsun mo'o //
analyzed: bud med rdo rje btsun mo'o //
translated: Women are the Vajra Queen.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdor yang /🔽sems can thams cad kyi lus dang ngag dang sems kyi tha snyad ni rigs gsum gyi gsang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdor yang / sems can thams cad kyi lus dang ngag dang sems kyi tha snyad ni rigs gsum gyi gsang ba'o //
translated: And in the Tantra of the Secret of the Tathagatas it says:

original: zhes pa dang / @322a * //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / @322a * //
translated: The conventions of the body, speech, and mind of all sentient beings are the secret of the three families.

original: ye shes zhabs kyis kyang /
analyzed: ye shes zhabs kyis kyang /
translated: And Jnanapada also says:

original: de ltar sems las byung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang yang rung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni phyag rgya dang sngags kyi rnam par sangs rgyas rnams kyis rtogs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnas dang nye ba'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar gsungs pa'i sa bcu po rnams kyi ming gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar sems las byung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gang yang rung ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni phyag rgya dang sngags kyi rnam par sangs rgyas rnams kyis rtogs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // gnas dang nye ba'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar gsungs pa'i sa bcu po rnams kyi ming gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the buddhas realize the various types of karma of body, speech, and mind, which are the forms of mudra and mantra, by means of the various mental factors.🔽The places and sub-places and so on refer to the names of the ten stages that were previously mentioned.

original: 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni sngon du bshad pa'o zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las rgyas par bstan pa bzhi pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni sngon du bshad pa'o zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las rgyas par bstan pa bzhi pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
translated: The etymologies of these were explained previously.

original: // / de nas gang yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa'i gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang spyi bo la sogs pa rnams gzhi mthun pa'i ming dang / der gnas pa'i rtsa rnams mkha' spyod ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: // / de nas gang yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar gsungs pa'i gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang spyi bo la sogs pa rnams gzhi mthun pa'i ming dang / der gnas pa'i rtsa rnams mkha' spyod ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Then, beginning with “Then, any one of the twenty-four sacred seats previously mentioned, the crown, and so forth, are the common locus of the names, and the channels located there are the nature of Khandaroha, and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa gsungs te /🔽de nas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa gsungs te / de nas zhes pa nas /
translated: The brief and extensive explanations of those are stated.

original: bshad par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni mdor bstan pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ni mdor bstan pa ste go sla'o //
translated: Then, up to “will be explained,” is the brief explanation, which is easy to understand.

original: spyi bo ma la ya yi yul //
analyzed: spyi bo ma la ya yi yul //
translated: The crown is the land of Malaya.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyas par bshad pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyas par bshad pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: And so forth is the third extensive explanation.

original: de la ma la ya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la ma la ya zhes pa ni /
translated: There, Malaya is

original: gang du bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin kun rdzob dang don dam pa mi phyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'dren par byed pa de ni ma la ya ste /
analyzed: gang du bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin kun rdzob dang don dam pa mi phyed pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'dren par byed pa de ni ma la ya ste /
translated: where the bodhicitta of the nature of great bliss, the indivisible relative and ultimate, is drawn up.🔽That is Malaya.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i yul ni ma la ya'i yul lo //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i yul ni ma la ya'i yul lo //
translated: The land that is such is the land of Malaya.

original: spyi bo de nyid du ste /
analyzed: spyi bo de nyid du ste /
translated: The crown is just that.

original: der 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises there.

original: rtsa'i dra ba'i rtsa bar 'dzin par byed pas na /
analyzed: rtsa'i dra ba'i rtsa bar 'dzin par byed pas na /
translated: Since it holds the root of the network of channels,

original: spyi gtsug ni dz'a la ndha ra'o //
analyzed: spyi gtsug ni dz'a la ndha ra'o //
translated: the crown of the head is Jalandhara.

original: rna ba g-yas pa'i lam nas gtum mos 'phur bar brjod de /
analyzed: rna ba g-yas pa'i lam nas gtum mos 'phur bar brjod de /
translated: It is said that Caṇḍālī flies out through the path of the right ear.

original: mkha' la rgyu zhing 'jug pas na 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: mkha' la rgyu zhing 'jug pas na 'gro ba'o //
translated: Since it moves and enters into space, it is “moving.

original: phyi rol du 'byung ba ni der ao di ya na ste rna ba g-yas pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'byung ba ni der ao di ya na ste rna ba g-yas pa'o //
translated: ” The external arising is Oḍiyāna, which is the right ear.

original: dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi pho nya mo 'di dag gis phyag rgya gsum po snyoms par zhugs pa las /
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi pho nya mo 'di dag gis phyag rgya gsum po snyoms par zhugs pa las /
translated: From the union of these female messengers of vowels and consonants with the three mudras,

original: las kyi rlung dbang phyug gi dbyug pas phye ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i bde ba myong bar rtogs par bya'o zhes pas aa rbud ste /
analyzed: las kyi rlung dbang phyug gi dbyug pas phye ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i bde ba myong bar rtogs par bya'o zhes pas aa rbud ste /
translated: the karmavāyu, which is Maheśvara’s club, is opened, and the experience of nonconceptual bliss is realized.

original: mgo bo'i rgyab po //
analyzed: mgo bo'i rgyab po //
translated: Thus, Aḍaḍa is the back of the head.

original: pri sho dha ra la sogs pa nyid las ha'i da'o //
analyzed: pri sho dha ra la sogs pa nyid las ha'i da'o //
translated: From the very same Priṣodadhi and so on, Ha is the right ear.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i tshul gyis bzhi po 'di @322b rnams ni gnas kyi ming can du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i tshul gyis bzhi po 'di @322b rnams ni gnas kyi ming can du shes par bya'o //
translated: These four should be understood as the names of the places, as previously explained.

original: de la brten pa'i rtsa bzhi po ni mkha' spyod ma ste /
analyzed: de la brten pa'i rtsa bzhi po ni mkha' spyod ma ste /
translated: The four channels based on that are Khagan,🔽and the four aspects of the phenomena of heat and so forth, which are the objects and objective sources of the ones to be called Chauri and so forth, are experienced in the great bliss.🔽Therefore, it is the stage of the utterly joyful one, which is the experience of special joy.🔽The navel is the nature of the stage of joy, which is the emanation wheel.🔽The throat is the nature of the stage of complete joy, which is the enjoyment wheel.

original: rab gtum ma la sogs par brjod par bya ba rnams kyi spyod yul dang yul te bzhi'i rang bzhin dro ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi po bde ba chen por myong bas na khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba myong ba'i🔽phyir rab tu dga' ba'i sa yang yin no //🔽go ste sa'i rang bzhin sprul pa'i 'khor lo sbyin par byed do zhes pas go d'a ni aa ba dh'um t'i'i ste /
analyzed: rab gtum ma la sogs par brjod par bya ba rnams kyi spyod yul dang yul te bzhi'i rang bzhin dro ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi po bde ba chen por myong bas na khyad par du 'phags pa'i dga' ba myong ba'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'i sa yang yin no // go ste sa'i rang bzhin sprul pa'i 'khor lo sbyin par byed do zhes pas go d'a ni aa ba dh'um t'i'i ste /
translated: The heart is the nature of the stage of the cloud of Dharma, which is the reality wheel.🔽The head is the nature of the stage of the vajra holder, which is the great bliss wheel.🔽The forehead is the nature of the stage of the universal light, which is the great seal wheel.🔽The crown of the head is the nature of the stage of the cloud of Dharma, which is the wheel of great enjoyment.🔽The soles of the feet are the nature of the stage of the vajra holder, which is the wheel of emanation.🔽The palms of the hands are the nature of the stage of the universal light, which is the wheel of great bliss.🔽The eyes are the nature of the stage of the cloud of Dharma, which is the wheel of great enjoyment.🔽The ears are the nature of the stage of the vajra holder, which is the emanation wheel.🔽The nose is the nature of the stage of the universal light, which is the great bliss wheel.🔽The tongue is the nature of the stage of the cloud of Dharma, which is the wheel of great enjoyment.

original: des 'dzin par byed cing khebs par byed do zhes pas go d'a ba r'i ni rna ba g-yon pa ste /🔽des de la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'dzin par byed cing khebs par byed do zhes pas go d'a ba r'i ni rna ba g-yon pa ste / des de la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is the nature of the stage of the vajra holder, which is the emanation wheel.🔽The mind is the nature of the stage of the universal light, which is the great bliss wheel.

original: dga' ba dang dga' ba ni dga' ba dang ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang dga' ba ni dga' ba dang ste /
translated: The speech is the nature of the stage of the cloud of Dharma, which is the wheel of great enjoyment.

original: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a'i rang bzhin smin ma dag go //
analyzed: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a'i rang bzhin smin ma dag go //
translated: The body is the nature of the stage of the vajra holder, which is the emanation wheel.

original: de dag gi dbus su dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: de dag gi dbus su dbang phyug ste /
translated: The mind is the nature of the stage of the universal light, which is the great bliss wheel.🔽The speech is the nature of the stage of the cloud of Dharma, which is the wheel of great enjoyment.🔽The body is the nature of the stage of the vajra holder, which is the emanation wheel.🔽The mind is the nature of the stage of the universal light, which is the great bliss

original: gang gi ye shes kyi me de'i dbus su'o zhes pa mdzod spu'i nang du'o //🔽ye shes kyi me de nyid lha mo ste /🔽lha mo de nyid kyi rdzong ni 'dir ko ta ste /🔽mig gnyis ni de w'i ko ta'o //
analyzed: gang gi ye shes kyi me de'i dbus su'o zhes pa mdzod spu'i nang du'o // ye shes kyi me de nyid lha mo ste / lha mo de nyid kyi rdzong ni 'dir ko ta ste / mig gnyis ni de w'i ko ta'o //
translated: In the middle of the fire of his wisdom, that is, in the middle of the fire of his gnosis.🔽That fire of gnosis is the goddess.🔽The fortress of that goddess is here called Kotā.🔽The two eyes are Devakotā.🔽

original: de dang de la brten pa ste /🔽der thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du dpung pa dag gi bar ni lag pa dag gi ste /🔽gang 'di rnams kyi rtsa ba gnyis po ste /🔽'di phrag pa gnyis po 'di nyid m'a la ba'o //🔽so sor skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i phreng ba 'jig cing gcod par byed pa'i phyir m'a la bar brjod par bya ste /🔽thim pa myong ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di rnams ni nye ba'i gnas te /🔽de la brten pa'i rtsa rnams dpa' bo'i blo can ma dang / mi 'u thung ma dang / langka'i dbang phyug ma dang / shing grib ma rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de dang de la brten pa ste /🔽der thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du dpung pa dag gi bar ni lag pa dag gi ste /🔽gang 'di rnams kyi rtsa ba gnyis po ste /🔽'di phrag pa gnyis po 'di nyid m'a la ba'o //🔽so sor skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i phreng ba 'jig cing gcod par byed pa'i phyir m'a la bar brjod par bya ste /🔽thim pa myong ba'i phyir ro //🔽'di rnams ni nye ba'i gnas te /🔽de la brten pa'i rtsa rnams dpa' bo'i blo can ma dang / mi 'u thung ma dang / langka'i dbang phyug ma dang / shing grib ma rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: In the middle of the fire of her wisdom, that is, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of the fire of the wisdom of the yoginī, in the middle of

original: mkha' spyod ma rnams kyi spyod yul dang yul du shes par bya'o zhes pa thugs kyi 'khor lo la'o //🔽mchan khung gnyis ni k'a ma r'u pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' spyod ma rnams kyi spyod yul dang yul du shes par bya'o zhes pa thugs kyi 'khor lo la'o // mchan khung gnyis ni k'a ma r'u pa ste /
translated: One should know that the two armpits are Kāmarūpa.

original: mngon par 'dod par bya zhing mthong ba gang gi yin pa de'i ni 'dod pa'i gzugs te mchan khung gnyis so //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod par bya zhing mthong ba gang gi yin pa de'i ni 'dod pa'i gzugs te mchan khung gnyis so //
translated: The two armpits are Kāmarūpa, since they are the form of desire of one who is to be seen and desired.

original: ao ni steng du 'gro bas len cing khas len par byed pa ni gtum mo'o zhes pas nu ma gnyis ni ao tre'o //
analyzed: ao ni steng du 'gro bas len cing khas len par byed pa ni gtum mo'o zhes pas nu ma gnyis ni ao tre'o //
translated: The two breasts are Oḍra, since they are the fierce one who takes and accepts through going above.

original: gnyis po 'di rnams ni sngar gsungs pa'i tshul gyi zhing ngo //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di rnams ni sngar gsungs pa'i tshul gyi zhing ngo //
translated: These two are the fields in the manner previously stated.

original: lte ba dang sna rtse gnyis po dag ni //
analyzed: lte ba dang sna rtse gnyis po dag ni //
translated: The two navel and tip of the nose are

original: tri sha ku ne dang / ka sha la ste /🔽'dir gang zhig sha ku ni ste bya lta @323a * //
analyzed: tri sha ku ne dang / ka sha la ste / 'dir gang zhig sha ku ni ste bya lta @323a * //
translated: Triśākuni and Kāśi.

original: bu'i khva gdong ma'i rnam pa lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rtsa gang yin pa de ni tri sha ku ne ste /
analyzed: bu'i khva gdong ma'i rnam pa lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rtsa gang yin pa de ni tri sha ku ne ste /
translated: Here, the two channels of body, speech, and mind that have the form of a bird’s beak and face are Triśākuni.

original: rdo rje'i mdud pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir lte ba'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i mdud pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir lte ba'i gnas su'o //
translated: Since they have the form of a vajra knot, they are at the navel.

original: de bzhin du sna'i rtse mo ni ko sha la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sna'i rtse mo ni ko sha la ste /
translated: Likewise, the tip of the nose is Kosala,

original: ngar snabs 'gro ba gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ngar snabs 'gro ba gang gi phyir /
translated: because it is the path of mucus.

original: de ni ko sa la'o //
analyzed: de ni ko sa la'o //
translated: That is Kosala.

original: 'di dag ni sngar gsungs pa'i tshul gyis nye ba'i zhing du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sngar gsungs pa'i tshul gyis nye ba'i zhing du shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as the neighboring fields in the manner previously explained.

original: kha dang mgrin pa ni ka lingga dang lam p'a ka dag go //
analyzed: kha dang mgrin pa ni ka lingga dang lam p'a ka dag go //
translated: The mouth and throat are Kaliṅga and Lampāka.

original: kam ni bde ba yin la /
analyzed: kam ni bde ba yin la /
translated: Ka means bliss,

original: li ni 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: li ni 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: and li means to go.

original: zhes pas ni ka lingga ste /
analyzed: zhes pas ni ka lingga ste /
translated: Thus, Kaliṅga,

original: bsnyen pa'i dus su de mthong ba las lha'i dga' ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyen pa'i dus su de mthong ba las lha'i dga' ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of worship, the bliss of the gods is generated by seeing it.

original: de bzhin du lce'u chung gi bzhi las bdud rtsi myang ba la cher sred pa'i lces der sbyor ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de bzhin du lce'u chung gi bzhi las bdud rtsi myang ba la cher sred pa'i lces der sbyor ba'i phyir na /
translated: Likewise, because the tongue, which is very desirous of tasting nectar from the four corners of the mouth, is joined there,

original: mgrin pa ni lam p'a ka ste /
analyzed: mgrin pa ni lam p'a ka ste /
translated: the throat is Lampāka.

original: de dag ni sngar gsungs pa'i rnam par bshad pa las 'dun pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sngar gsungs pa'i rnam par bshad pa las 'dun pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: These should be called the neighboring countries in the explanation previously stated.

original: snying ga dang chu so yang k'anytsi dang hi m'a la ya dag ste de ltar ni /
analyzed: snying ga dang chu so yang k'anytsi dang hi m'a la ya dag ste de ltar ni /
translated: The heart and the urinary tract are Kāñcī and Himālaya,

original: kam ni bde ba yin la ;
analyzed: kam ni bde ba yin la ;
translated: because ka means bliss,🔽and

original: aanytsa ti ni 'gro zhing rgyug par byed pa /
analyzed: aanytsa ti ni 'gro zhing rgyug par byed pa /
translated: Añcata means “to go” and “to run.”

original: chu shing gi me tog lta bur 'chad bzhin pa'i 'og gi kha las bdud rtsi thig le 'dzag pa /
analyzed: chu shing gi me tog lta bur 'chad bzhin pa'i 'og gi kha las bdud rtsi thig le 'dzag pa /
translated: It is like a plantain flower, dripping nectar drops from its lower mouth.

original: h'um gi rnam pa'i bdud dral ma'i rtsa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: h'um gi rnam pa'i bdud dral ma'i rtsa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with the nāḍī of Māmakī in the form of hūṃ.

original: byang chub kyi sems kha ba'i mdog can de'i gnas nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kha ba'i mdog can de'i gnas nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is the abode of the bodhicitta, which is the color of snow.

original: chu so ni hi m'a la yar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chu so ni hi m'a la yar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The spring is to be called the Himalayas.

original: de dag ni nye ba'i 'dun pa ste sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nye ba'i 'dun pa ste sngar bzhin no //
translated: These are the nearby mountains, as before.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: de la brten pa'i rtsa rnams ni sa srung ma dang / 'jigs byed chen mo dang / rlung shugs ma dang / chang 'thung ma dang / lha mo sngo bsangs dang / shin tu bzang mo dang / rta rna dang / mkha' 'gro gdong ma ste /
analyzed: de la brten pa'i rtsa rnams ni sa srung ma dang / 'jigs byed chen mo dang / rlung shugs ma dang / chang 'thung ma dang / lha mo sngo bsangs dang / shin tu bzang mo dang / rta rna dang / mkha' 'gro gdong ma ste /
translated: The nāḍīs that depend on them are Kṣāntivārāhi, Mahābhairavā, Vāyuvegā, Surābhakṣi, Śyāmādevī, Subhadrā, Hayakarṇī, and Ḍākinīmukha.

original: sa la spyod pa 'di rnams kyi gnas rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa la spyod pa 'di rnams kyi gnas rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: These are the abodes of the earth goddesses.

original: lus kyi dbus su gnas pa nyid kyi phyir sa spyod ma'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbus su gnas pa nyid kyi phyir sa spyod ma'o //
translated: They are called “earth-dwelling” because they are located in the middle of the body.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma 'di rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma 'di rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, the signs are of two kinds:

original: bud med kyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: the sign of a woman and🔽the sign of a man.

original: de kho na bzhin du bshad lam yang ste /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du bshad lam yang ste /
translated: The path of the explanation is just like that.

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du ste pre ta pu r'i dang / gri ha de ba t'ar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du ste pre ta pu r'i dang / gri ha de ba t'ar shes par bya'o //
translated: They are, respectively, Pretāpura and Grhadevatā.

original: de ltar ni pre ta ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni pre ta ni nam mkha'o //
translated: Pretā means “space.”

original: grong khyer lta bu'i nam mkha' lnga rnams ni grong khyer te /
analyzed: grong khyer lta bu'i nam mkha' lnga rnams ni grong khyer te /
translated: The five spaces that are like cities are a city.

original: de yi rgyal mtshan zung ni pre ta pu d'i'o //
analyzed: de yi rgyal mtshan zung ni pre ta pu d'i'o //
translated: The pair of banners of that city is Pretāpura.

original: bshang lam gyi sgo ni /
analyzed: bshang lam gyi sgo ni /
translated: The door of the anus is

original: gri ha de ba t'a ste khyim ni lus yin la /
analyzed: gri ha de ba t'a ste khyim ni lus yin la /
translated: Grhadevatā. The body is a house.

original: lha rnam @323b par snang mdzad yin pa ni khyim gyi lha ste /
analyzed: lha rnam @323b par snang mdzad yin pa ni khyim gyi lha ste /
translated: The god Vairocana is the house god.

original: de bshang ba'i khams kyi gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bshang ba'i khams kyi gnas nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the location of the feces element.

original: de rnams ni go rims bzhin du 'du ba'i mid can du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni go rims bzhin du 'du ba'i mid can du shes par bya ste /
translated: They should be known, respectively, as the “city of the union of the🔽elements.”

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su /
translated: At the time of union,

original: rgyal mtshan gnyis po'i thur ser gyi lam gnyis po sbyor ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gnyis po'i thur ser gyi lam gnyis po sbyor ba'i phyir ro /
translated: because the two paths of the two victory banners are joined.

original: de bzhin du brla gnyis po dang byin pa gnyis po yang soo r'ashta dang su warna dv'i par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brla gnyis po dang byin pa gnyis po yang soo r'ashta dang su warna dv'i par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the two thighs are Saurāṣṭra and Suvarṇadvīpa.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: Thus,

original: bde ba'i yul 'khor lta bu ni yul 'khor te /
analyzed: bde ba'i yul 'khor lta bu ni yul 'khor te /
translated: the two thighs are the country of happiness, because they are the country of the king of happiness.

original: brla gnyis po nyid phan tshun khyad par du 'phags pa'i dus dang / khyad par du 'phags pa mthong pa ni soo r'ashta'o //
analyzed: brla gnyis po nyid phan tshun khyad par du 'phags pa'i dus dang / khyad par du 'phags pa mthong pa ni soo r'ashta'o //
translated: The two thighs are Saurāṣṭra, because they are the country of the king of happiness, and they are seen to be superior to each other.

original: de bzhin du 'od shin tu dkar ba'i sems ni mdog bzang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od shin tu dkar ba'i sems ni mdog bzang ste /
translated: In the same way, the two feet are the country of Suvarṇadvīpa, because they are the country of the king of good complexion.

original: de'i gling lta bu yin pa'i phyir byin pa gnyis po ni gling ngo //
analyzed: de'i gling lta bu yin pa'i phyir byin pa gnyis po ni gling ngo //
translated: The two feet are Suvarṇadvīpa, because they are the country of the king of good complexion.

original: de rnams ni sngar bzhin du nye ba'i 'du bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni sngar bzhin du nye ba'i 'du bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these are the neighboring countries, as before.

original: de bzhin du rkang pa'i sor mo brgyad dang / rkang pa'i rgyab kyi gnas ni na ga ra dang sindhur shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa'i sor mo brgyad dang / rkang pa'i rgyab kyi gnas ni na ga ra dang sindhur shes par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the eight toes and the back of the foot are Nagara and Sindhu.

original: sor mo ni 'gro bar mi byed do zhes pa sa na gang yin la /
analyzed: sor mo ni 'gro bar mi byed do zhes pa sa na gang yin la /
translated: The fingers do not go, and so on.

original: de la mchog tu rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ra ste na ga ra'o //
analyzed: de la mchog tu rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ra ste na ga ra'o //
translated: The one who is so is called Nagara, because it is the supreme expansion.

original: rkang pa'i rgyab las mthe bod la byang chub kyi sems 'dzag par byed pa'i phyir rkang pa'i rgyab ni sindhu'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i rgyab las mthe bod la byang chub kyi sems 'dzag par byed pa'i phyir rkang pa'i rgyab ni sindhu'o //
translated: The back of the foot is Sindhu, because it causes the bodhicitta to drip from the toes.

original: gnyis po 'di ni sngar gsungs pa'i tshul gyis dur khrod do //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni sngar gsungs pa'i tshul gyis dur khrod do //
translated: These two are charnel grounds, in the manner previously stated.

original: rkang pa'i mthe bod dang pus mo ni //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthe bod dang pus mo ni //
translated: The toes and knees

original: ma ru dang ku lu t'ar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ma ru dang ku lu t'ar shes par bya ste /
translated: are known as Maru and Kuluta.

original: ma ni bde ba chen po yin la /
analyzed: ma ni bde ba chen po yin la /
translated: Ma is great bliss,

original: de sgrogs pa'i las ni ma ru'o //
analyzed: de sgrogs pa'i las ni ma ru'o //
translated: and the action of proclaiming that is Maru.

original: ku ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ku ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Ku is discursive thought,

original: de 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ku lu t'a'o //
analyzed: de 'joms par byed pa'i phyir ku lu t'a'o //
translated: and because it destroys that, it is Kuluta.

original: gnyis pa 'di ni go rims bzhin du snga ma ltar nye ba'i dur khrod du brjod par bya'o //🔽sa bcu 'di rnams gnas la sogs //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'di ni go rims bzhin du snga ma ltar nye ba'i dur khrod du brjod par bya'o // sa bcu 'di rnams gnas la sogs //
translated: These two are the nearby charnel grounds, in the order stated above.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: These ten stages are the abodes and so on.

original: gnas la sogs pa'i brdas brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa'i brdas brtan pa yin no //
translated: They are stabilized by the symbolic designations of the abodes and so on.

original: rang lus skyes zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rang lus skyes zhes pa ni /
translated: The body is born from oneself.

original: zla ba bcu'i rim pas skyes pa'i rang gi lus dang lhan cig tu skyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: zla ba bcu'i rim pas skyes pa'i rang gi lus dang lhan cig tu skyes pa rnams te /
translated: Those born together with one’s own body in the course of the ten months

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi rim pas thob par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi rim pas thob par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: are not to be attained in the course of the path of seeing.

original: de rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul gyis gnas kyi dbye bas 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul gyis gnas kyi dbye bas 'byed par byed do //
translated: Those are differentiated by the division of the places, in the manner of the explanation.

original: de nyid phyi rol gyi sgo rnams dang lhan cig tu nang gi dgu po las gcig bzung ste sa bcur brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyi rol gyi sgo rnams dang lhan cig tu nang gi dgu po las gcig bzung ste sa bcur brjod par bya'o //
translated: Together with the external doors, one of the nine internal ones should be taken and called the ten stages.

original: de rnams su'i sa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams su'i sa yin zhe na /
translated: Whose stages are they?

original: @324a * // sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: @324a * // sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po'i rang bzhin ye shes gcig pu'i bdag nyid can rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po'i rang bzhin ye shes gcig pu'i bdag nyid can rnams so //
translated: The Buddhas are the nature of the aggregates of form and so forth, which are the nature of the sole gnosis.

original: yang na / sangs rgyas rnams ni khams kyi rang bzhin gyis dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams sam /
analyzed: yang na / sangs rgyas rnams ni khams kyi rang bzhin gyis dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams sam /
translated: Or, the Buddhas are the twenty-four heroes by the nature of the elements,

original: mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyang sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: mi phyed ma la sogs pa'i rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyang sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: or the twenty-four channels such as Acalā are the Buddhas.

original: gcig lhag pa las dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sa bcu'am /
analyzed: gcig lhag pa las dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma 'di rnams ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sa bcu'am /
translated: The hero and yoginīs are more than one, and these are the ten stages of the connate, or the not-to-be-established stage.

original: brtags pa ma yin pa'i bsgrub par bya ba yang yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: brtags pa ma yin pa'i bsgrub par bya ba yang yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: This is the intention.

original: 'phags pa rnams kho na'i sa ma yin gyi so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo la //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kho na'i sa ma yin gyi so so'i skye bo rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / sku gsung thugs kyi 'khor lo la //
translated: In order to demonstrate that these are not only the stages of the āryas but also of ordinary beings,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sngar gsungs pa'i rim pa rnams kyis lus la gnas pa'i thugs la sogs pa'i 'khor lo gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i dbye bas phye ba rnams su /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sngar gsungs pa'i rim pa rnams kyis lus la gnas pa'i thugs la sogs pa'i 'khor lo gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i dbye bas phye ba rnams su /
translated: it is said:🔽In the maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind,🔽the twenty-four places are divided by the twenty-four junctures of the body.

original: rkang med dang / rkang gnyis dang / rkang bzhi dang / rkang mangs te lus can thams cad la yang rtsa'i rang bzhin gyi sa 'di rnams ni gnas bcu po ste /
analyzed: rkang med dang / rkang gnyis dang / rkang bzhi dang / rkang mangs te lus can thams cad la yang rtsa'i rang bzhin gyi sa 'di rnams ni gnas bcu po ste /
