translated: In the maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind, the twenty-four places are divided by the twenty-four junctures of the body.

original: de kho na nyid kyis sems can thams cad ni sa'i dbang phyug yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyis sems can thams cad ni sa'i dbang phyug yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las /
translated: the Great Secret Lamp, a commentary on the Spring Time of Truth Tantra,

original: rgyas par bstan pa lnga pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa lnga pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
translated: the Means of Achieving the Stage of Completion.

original: // / da ni rang gi lus la gnas pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo rnams kho na 'khor lo thams cad du gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin de'i gtso bo ni /
analyzed: // / da ni rang gi lus la gnas pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo rnams kho na 'khor lo thams cad du gnas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin de'i gtso bo ni /
translated: Now, in order to understand the nature of the dakinis who reside in all the chakras, which are located in one's own body,

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sngags kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sngags kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: the principal one is the naturally existing nature of mantra.

original: de rnams rtogs pa bya ba'i slad du /
analyzed: de rnams rtogs pa bya ba'i slad du /
translated: In order to understand them,

original: rgyas par bstan pa drug pa la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa drug pa la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to enter into the sixth chapter, which is the extensive explanation,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the root text says, Then, and so on.

original: gang yang rung zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang rung zhes pa ni /
translated: The any refers to

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ste /
translated: the body of the tathagatas, which is included in the realm of sentient beings.

original: snga ma bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las lha'i ngo bo nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las lha'i ngo bo nyid kyi'o //
translated: the nature of the deity.

original: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du ni /
analyzed: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du ni /
translated: In the proper place,

original: gnas la ma 'das par byas nas /
analyzed: gnas la ma 'das par byas nas /
translated: having not transgressed the place,

original: rtsa'i 'khor lo kho na rnal @324b 'byor ma'i tshogs su mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa'i 'khor lo kho na rnal @324b 'byor ma'i tshogs su mtshon par bya ste /
translated: the cakra of the channels alone is to be understood as the assembly of yoginis.

original: bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement is to be explained is the brief explanation.

original: snying gi dbus son zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: snying gi dbus son zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: The statement in the middle of the heart and so forth

original: der gtso bo sngags kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: der gtso bo sngags kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas par gsungs pa ste /
translated: teaches the location of the principal mantra nature there.

original: 'dir lus can thams cad kyi snying ga ni /
analyzed: 'dir lus can thams cad kyi snying ga ni /
translated: Here, the heart of all embodied beings

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ze'u 'bru dang ge sar dang bcas shing thun tshod brgyad rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i 'dab ma brgyad pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ze'u 'bru dang ge sar dang bcas shing thun tshod brgyad rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i 'dab ma brgyad pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: is the cakra of the channels with eight petals, which is located in the nature of the eight periods of the day and night, along with the stamens and pistils of the dharmacakra.

original: de'i dbus su ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su ste /
translated: In the middle of that,

original: til gyi mar me'i rang bzhin can chu shing gi me tog ltar 'og gi gdong ma sum skor ma zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'i dbus su /
analyzed: til gyi mar me'i rang bzhin can chu shing gi me tog ltar 'og gi gdong ma sum skor ma zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'i dbus su /
translated: In the middle of that, which is like a sesame oil lamp, a banana flower, and the lower face of a woman with three coils,

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs lhung ba'i snga dro'i ba mo'i zil pa lta bu'i thig le 'dzag bzhin pa yungs kar phra mo'i tshad tsam gyi h'um gi yi ge ni brjod par mi nus pa nyid kyis na gzhom du med pa ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs lhung ba'i snga dro'i ba mo'i zil pa lta bu'i thig le 'dzag bzhin pa yungs kar phra mo'i tshad tsam gyi h'um gi yi ge ni brjod par mi nus pa nyid kyis na gzhom du med pa ste /
translated: is an indestructible bindu, which is like the dew drops of the morning sun, dripping like a sesame seed, the syllable hūṃ, which is beyond expression.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi 'jigs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dpa' bo'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi 'jigs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dpa' bo'o //
translated: Since it is fearless of all conceptual things, it is a hero.

original: de nyid lus can thams cad kyi snying dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi dpyid lta bu yin pa'i phyir na dpyid de /
analyzed: de nyid lus can thams cad kyi snying dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi dpyid lta bu yin pa'i phyir na dpyid de /
translated: Since it is like a spring that delights the hearts of all embodied beings, it is a spring.

original: bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'o zhes shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dpal he ru ka'o zhes shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: It should be understood that the glorious Bhagavān Heruka is that.

original: zhal bzhi pa phyag bcu gnyis pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhal bzhi pa phyag bcu gnyis pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that he has four faces and twelve arms.

original: rta gdong gi me lta bu'i ye shes kyi me gang yin pa 'di ni bsrub par bya ba dang srub par byed pa yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid las kyi rlung gis steng du bskul ba las lte ba'i gnas nas 'bar ba steng gi lam du song
analyzed: rta gdong gi me lta bu'i ye shes kyi me gang yin pa 'di ni bsrub par bya ba dang srub par byed pa yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid las kyi rlung gis steng du bskul ba las lte ba'i gnas nas 'bar ba steng gi lam du song
translated: This fire of gnosis, like the face of a horse, is the fire that arises from the navel, having been ignited by the wind of karma, which has the characteristic of the correct union of the churned and the churner.

original: nas / de la snying gang gnas pa'i dpa' bo de'i bdud rtsi'i bkod ma'i rgyun ltung bas de nyid du zhu bas reg pa 'di nyid gnyis su med par sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: nas / de la snying gang gnas pa'i dpa' bo de'i bdud rtsi'i bkod ma'i rgyun ltung bas de nyid du zhu bas reg pa 'di nyid gnyis su med par sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa ste /
translated: Having gone up the upper path, the stream of the nectar array of that hero who resides in the heart falls there, and by melting into that, it is the union of the two, and therefore it is “equipoise.”

original: dpyid kyi thig le zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dpyid kyi thig le zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be called the “Spring Drop.”

original: de nyid 'di ni he ru ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di ni he ru ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That itself is called “heruka,” and so on.

original: h'um gi yi ge gang yin pa 'di ni sngar gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis brjod pa de nyid dpal he ru ka ste /
analyzed: h'um gi yi ge gang yin pa 'di ni sngar gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis brjod pa de nyid dpal he ru ka ste /
translated: That syllable hūṃ, which is described by the previously stated characteristics, is that very glorious heruka.

original: ye shes 'bar ba'i phyir na rdo rje phag mo ni thig ler brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'bar ba'i phyir na rdo rje phag mo ni thig ler brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since it is the blazing of gnosis, Vajravārāhī should be called the “drop.”

original: de nyid rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba ste /
translated: That very [wind] is the non-moving, along with the moving.

original: gnas pa dang 'gro ba'i bdag nyid kyi 'gro ba la sngar gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'gro ba'i bdag nyid kyi 'gro ba la sngar gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i gzugs te /
translated: The movement of the nature of abiding and going is the form of the yoginī previously mentioned,

original: kha dog dmar po blangs nas gnas pa'o //🔽de bzhin du bcom ldan @325a * //
analyzed: kha dog dmar po blangs nas gnas pa'o // de bzhin du bcom ldan @325a * //
translated: taking on the red color and abiding.

original: 'das ma de nyid lus la sogs pa'i dbye bas dbye bar 'gyur ba'i dman pa dang 'bring dang dam pa'i sgo gsum gyi dbye bas /
analyzed: 'das ma de nyid lus la sogs pa'i dbye bas dbye bar 'gyur ba'i dman pa dang 'bring dang dam pa'i sgo gsum gyi dbye bas /
translated: In the same way, that very Blessed Lady, by the division of body and so forth, is divided into inferior, middling, and excellent, by the division of the three doors.

original: 'gro ba dang song ba dang gnas pa rnams mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang song ba dang gnas pa rnams mdzad pa yin no //
translated: She performs the functions of going, gone, and abiding.

original: de kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: de kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: That is so,

original: lus can thams cad la yang rnam par gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lus can thams cad la yang rnam par gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: and she also abides in all embodied beings.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi ba rtsabs 'khor lo bzhi la khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi ba rtsabs 'khor lo bzhi la khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the pervasion of the four cakras of the body mandala,

original: lte bar zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽'dir ni ji ltar bde bar rol //
analyzed: lte bar zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / 'dir ni ji ltar bde bar rol //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, beginning with “at the navel,”

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa gsungs te /
translated: up to the conclusion, “enjoy here as you like.”

original: de la lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo la dpyid de nyid aa yig thung du'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de la lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo la dpyid de nyid aa yig thung du'i gzugs so //
translated: In the navel, the emanation wheel, is the spring, which is the form of the short vowel a.

original: snying ga chos kyi 'khor lo ni n'a da dang thig le dang ldan pa'i h'um yig gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: snying ga chos kyi 'khor lo ni n'a da dang thig le dang ldan pa'i h'um yig gi rnam pa'o //
translated: In the heart, the dharma wheel, is the form of the syllable hūṃ, endowed with the nada and bindu.

original: mgrin par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lor ni cha gsum pa shin tu ring po'i aom yig gi gzugs te /
analyzed: mgrin par longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lor ni cha gsum pa shin tu ring po'i aom yig gi gzugs te /
translated: In the throat, the enjoyment wheel, is the form of the long ā, which is divided into three parts.

original: rtsa khyog po nyid las de la lan gsum du bskor bas gtum mo'i 'jug pa dang 'byung ba'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: rtsa khyog po nyid las de la lan gsum du bskor bas gtum mo'i 'jug pa dang 'byung ba'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: From the crookedness of the nāḍīs, it is revolved three times, which is the entry and arising of caṇḍālī.

original: dpral bar bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor ni n'a da dang thig les brgyan pa gzhom du med cing 'gyur ba med pa ha'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: dpral bar bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor ni n'a da dang thig les brgyan pa gzhom du med cing 'gyur ba med pa ha'i yi ge'o //
translated: In the forehead, the great-bliss wheel, is the syllable ha, which is adorned with the nada and bindu, indestructible and unchanging.

original: de nyid lugs las ldog pa dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba rnams su dpal he ru ka sngags kyi sku'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de nyid lugs las ldog pa dpral ba dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga dang / lte ba rnams su dpal he ru ka sngags kyi sku'i gzugs so //
translated: That is the form of the mantra body of Śrī Heruka in the forehead, throat, heart, and navel, in the reverse order.

original: sa sogs 'byung bzhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i rten gsungs te /
analyzed: sa sogs 'byung bzhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i rten gsungs te /
translated: The support of that is stated in “the four elements, earth, and so on”:

original: de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: de'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni sa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo bzhi po rnams so //
translated: The Buddha-fields of that are the four wheels of the nature of earth, etc.

original: nyin dang mtshan mo dang gung dang / phyi dro dang mtshan phyed dang snga dro'i mtshan nyid kyis thun bzhi po 'khor lo bzhir 'bab pa can /
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo dang gung dang / phyi dro dang mtshan phyed dang snga dro'i mtshan nyid kyis thun bzhi po 'khor lo bzhir 'bab pa can /
translated: The four periods, characterized by day, night, midnight, and dusk, and the four periods of the four wheels,

original: brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi dbugs kyi grangs te /
analyzed: brgya phrag lnga bcu rtsa bzhi dbugs kyi grangs te /
translated: are the number of breaths, fifty-four hundred.

original: de nyid ni /
analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: That itself

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi zhal bzhi yin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi zhal bzhi yin no //
translated: is the four faces of the Blessed One endowed with wisdom.🔽The four moments that illustrate the delight in the various, etc., the four delights, etc., and the four applications of the swift, the vapor, the bound, and the various,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa la dga' ba nye bar mtshon ba'i skad cig bzhi dang / dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi dang / myur ba dang / rlangs pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / sna tshogs byed pa'i sbyor ba bzhi po rnams gang yin pa 'di rnams so sor bshad pa las /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa la dga' ba nye bar mtshon ba'i skad cig bzhi dang / dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi dang / myur ba dang / rlangs pa dang / rnam par bcings pa dang / sna tshogs byed pa'i sbyor ba bzhi po rnams gang yin pa 'di rnams so sor bshad pa las /
translated: are explained individually.

original: de nyid de'i phyag bcu gnyis po rnams dang de nyid steng du rab tu 'jug pa las ni spyan bcu gnyis dang / de @325b nyid dbus su rab tu 'jug pa las ni mtshon cha bcu gnyis po rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid de'i phyag bcu gnyis po rnams dang de nyid steng du rab tu 'jug pa las ni spyan bcu gnyis dang / de @325b nyid dbus su rab tu 'jug pa las ni mtshon cha bcu gnyis po rnams so //
translated: And from that very [nature] entering in the middle, the twelve weapons.

original: 'di nyid bya ba dang byed pa po dag gi ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid bya ba dang byed pa po dag gi ste /
translated: This very [nature] is the agent and the action.

original: sreg par byed pa dang 'phel par byed pa'i dngos pos ro mnyam pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: sreg par byed pa dang 'phel par byed pa'i dngos pos ro mnyam pa nyid kyis na /
translated: By the state of burning and expanding, there is sameness of taste.

original: dpal thig le rdo rje sems dpa' dpyid de'i gzugs so //
analyzed: dpal thig le rdo rje sems dpa' dpyid de'i gzugs so //
translated: The glorious bindu is Vajrasattva, the form of spring.

original: des ji ltar bde bar te /
analyzed: des ji ltar bde bar te /
translated: By that, in whatever way is pleasing,

original: dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid la brten nas rol zhing lus can thams cad kyi lus la dga' bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid la brten nas rol zhing lus can thams cad kyi lus la dga' bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: based on the nature of the four joys, he plays and delights the bodies of all embodied beings. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar dbus kyi gtso bo shes rab dang bcas pa'i zhal dang / phyag dang / sku mdog dang / dbyibs dang / mtshan ma ni nang gi gzugs su gsal bar byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbus kyi gtso bo shes rab dang bcas pa'i zhal dang / phyag dang / sku mdog dang / dbyibs dang / mtshan ma ni nang gi gzugs su gsal bar byas nas /
translated: Thus, having clarified the face, hands, color, shape, and attributes of the central principal deity together with wisdom,

original: 'dab ma bzhi po dag ni yang //
analyzed: 'dab ma bzhi po dag ni yang //
translated: the four petals are also

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from here,

original: rtsa lnga rnams ni rnam par gnas //
analyzed: rtsa lnga rnams ni rnam par gnas //
translated: the five channels are situated.

original: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung ni //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung ni //
translated: The text concludes with

original: ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi po dang mchod pa'i bum pa bzhi po yang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi po dang mchod pa'i bum pa bzhi po yang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the four dakinis of the wisdom wheel and the four offering vases.

original: de la chos kyi 'khor lo'i shar dang / byang dang / nub dang / lho ste phyogs kyi char gnas pa bzhi po ni 'dzin pa dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la chos kyi 'khor lo'i shar dang / byang dang / nub dang / lho ste phyogs kyi char gnas pa bzhi po ni 'dzin pa dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: There, the four situated in the east, north, west, and south of the dharma wheel are characterized by grasping, moistness, heat, and movement.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje dpal he ru ka'i gnas ye shes kyi 'khor lor gnas shing son pa de rnams nyid ni mkha' 'gro ma la sogs te /
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje dpal he ru ka'i gnas ye shes kyi 'khor lor gnas shing son pa de rnams nyid ni mkha' 'gro ma la sogs te /
translated: Those situated in the abode of the glorious mind-vajra heruka, the wisdom wheel, are dakini and so on.

original: mkha' 'gro ma dang / l'a ma dang / dum skyes ma dang / gzugs can mar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dang / l'a ma dang / dum skyes ma dang / gzugs can mar shes par bya'o //
translated: Dakini, la, la ma, and khandaroha should be understood.

original: de las nam mkha' la thim pa las mkha' 'gro ma dang / chu nam mkha' la rol pas na m'a la ste /
analyzed: de las nam mkha' la thim pa las mkha' 'gro ma dang / chu nam mkha' la rol pas na m'a la ste /
translated: From that, since space dissolves into space, there is dakini. Since water plays in space, there is la.

original: sdeb sbyor las yi ge bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: sdeb sbyor las yi ge bzlog pa'o //
translated: The syllables are reversed from the meter.

original: me nam mkha' dum bur byed cing 'gro bar byed do zhes pas dum bu ste /
analyzed: me nam mkha' dum bur byed cing 'gro bar byed do zhes pas dum bu ste /
translated: Fire makes space into pieces and goes, thus it is a piece.

original: de rnam par dag pa las /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa las /
translated: From the purification of that,

original: de nyid du gsal ba'i phyir khanda ro h'a'o //
analyzed: de nyid du gsal ba'i phyir khanda ro h'a'o //
translated: it is Khaṇḍarohā because of the clarity of that very thing.

original: des na gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhi mthun pa'i bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a collection of common bases.

original: rlung nam mkha'i gzugs su 'gro zhing rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: rlung nam mkha'i gzugs su 'gro zhing rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir ;
translated: Wind goes in the form of space and purifies,

original: gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ma'o //
translated: thus it is Rūpiṇī.

original: phyogs kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams bshad nas /
analyzed: phyogs kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the space-faring ḍākinīs,

original: phyogs bral du gnas pa'i bum pa rnams /
analyzed: phyogs bral du gnas pa'i bum pa rnams /
translated: the vases that abide in the directions

original: phyogs bral gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs bral gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: are explained by “the vases that abide in the directions,” and so on.

original: ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i snying ga de nyid du bdud rtsi lnga 'bab cing mtshams su @326a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i snying ga de nyid du bdud rtsi lnga 'bab cing mtshams su @326a * //
translated: The five amṛtas flow into the heart of the gnosis wheel, and the nāḍīs that abide in the cardinal directions

original: gnas pa'i rtsa gang yin pa de nyid ni bum pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rtsa gang yin pa de nyid ni bum pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: are the form of the vases.

original: de las byung ba'i bug pa thod pa'i phreng bar gnas pa de rnams su bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid kyi mchod pa bzhi po shes par bya'o zhes lus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdu ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i bug pa thod pa'i phreng bar gnas pa de rnams su bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid kyi mchod pa bzhi po shes par bya'o zhes lus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdu ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus, the summary is stated by “body,” etc.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi dbus su rtsa lnga ste /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i tshul gyis lus kyi dbus su rtsa lnga ste /
translated: Thus, in the center of the body, there are five channels,

original: sum skor ma ye shes kyi padma'i mchod pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi dang bcas pa rnams so zhes shes par bya'o /
analyzed: sum skor ma ye shes kyi padma'i mchod pa'i mkha' 'gro ma bzhi dang bcas pa rnams so zhes shes par bya'o /
translated: and one should know that the three channels are the four dakinis of the gnosis lotus offering.

original: n'a da'i gzugs su myong ba nyid kyi phyir phyi rol rnams dang rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: n'a da'i gzugs su myong ba nyid kyi phyir phyi rol rnams dang rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since they are experienced in the form of nāda, they are not external and permanent.

original: sku gsung thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: By “body, speech, and mind,” etc.,

original: 'khor lo gsum gyi rtsa rnams rnal 'byor mar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum gyi rtsa rnams rnal 'byor mar gsungs te /
translated: the channels of the three wheels are said to be yoginis.

original: thugs gsung sku zhes brjod par bya ba yin na yang /🔽lugs las bzlog pas klog pa ni //
analyzed: thugs gsung sku zhes brjod par bya ba yin na yang / lugs las bzlog pas klog pa ni //
translated: Although it should be said “mind, speech, and body,”🔽the reading is reversed.

original: skal ba med pha rnams la sba ba'i don to //
analyzed: skal ba med pha rnams la sba ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is to conceal from those who are unfortunate.

original: de'i phyir thugs la sogs pa'i 'khor lo dang / spyi po la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi gnas su /
analyzed: de'i phyir thugs la sogs pa'i 'khor lo dang / spyi po la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi gnas su /
translated: Therefore, in the places of the twenty-four wheels of mind and so forth, and the twenty-four places of the head and so forth,

original: rab gtum ma la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rtsa'i gzugs kho nas gnas dang gnas su ste /
analyzed: rab gtum ma la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rtsa'i gzugs kho nas gnas dang gnas su ste /
translated: the twenty-four goddesses such as Prachaṇḍā are located in the form of channels in the places and sub-places.

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas nas nye ba'i dur khrod kyi mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas nas nye ba'i dur khrod kyi mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The places and sub-places are from the near place up to the near charnel ground.

original: mthar thug pa rang bzhin gyis grub pa kho nas rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: mthar thug pa rang bzhin gyis grub pa kho nas rnam par gnas te /
translated: The ultimate is located by way of its own nature.🔽In the Root Tantra,

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud du yang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud du yang /
translated: it states:🔽The dakinis of the innate are

original: lhan cig skyes grub mkha' 'gro rnams //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes grub mkha' 'gro rnams //
translated: the twenty-four places.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽spyi bor yang dag byung ba yi //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // spyi bor yang dag byung ba yi //
translated: This is stated in the following:🔽The channels that arise in the head

original: rtsa rnams spyi bo skyes zhes dran //🔽zhes bya bas de nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsa rnams spyi bo skyes zhes dran // zhes bya bas de nyid gsungs te /
translated: are known as the head-born.

original: 'dir bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo las rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo las rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, thirty-two channels arise from the great-bliss wheel.

original: gang dang ldan pa lta bu byung ba de rnams las khu ba dang / khrag dang / gnyi ga 'dzin par byed pa /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pa lta bu byung ba de rnams las khu ba dang / khrag dang / gnyi ga 'dzin par byed pa /
translated: The ones that arise as if they possess those are semen, blood, and both semen and blood.

original: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa wa dh'u t'i rnams ni khams gsum po ma lus par skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa wa dh'u t'i rnams ni khams gsum po ma lus par skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūti generate the entire three realms.

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid can du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa'i rang bzhin lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid can du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they have the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas, and are the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: de la rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ming ni //
analyzed: de la rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ming ni //
translated: The names of the thirty-two nāḍīs are as follows.

original: dpal kye'i rdo rjer /🔽mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma //🔽mdzes ma g-yon ma lus thung ma //🔽rus sbal skyes ma sgom pa ma //
analyzed: dpal kye'i rdo rjer / mi phyed ma dang phra gzugs ma // mdzes ma g-yon ma lus thung ma // rus sbal skyes ma sgom pa ma //
translated: In the Śrī Hevajra Tantra it is said:🔽Acalā, Sukarā,🔽Sundarī, Vāma, Hrasvakāyikā,

original: dbang ma skyon ma bshang ba ma //
analyzed: dbang ma skyon ma bshang ba ma //
translated: Kūrmapṛṣṭhā, Bhāvanā,🔽Vaśī, Dūṣi, and Pūya,

original: ma dang mtshan mo gsal sbyin @326b drod //
analyzed: ma dang mtshan mo gsal sbyin @326b drod //
translated: Mātṛkā, Rātri, and Prabhāvatī,🔽Pibikā, Sarvagāminī, Rasā,🔽Nāḍikā, and Āśvāsinī,

original: brkyang ma kun 'dar ro ma dang // gzhol ma rangs pa'i gdong ma dang // spyi ma rgyu sbyin sbyor bral ma //
analyzed: brkyang ma kun 'dar ro ma dang // gzhol ma rangs pa'i gdong ma dang // spyi ma rgyu sbyin sbyor bral ma //
translated: Sāmā, and Dhenukā, and Viyogadā.

original: sdug ma grub ma me ma dang // de bzhin yid bzang sum skor ma //
analyzed: sdug ma grub ma me ma dang // de bzhin yid bzang sum skor ma //
translated: and likewise Good-minded, Triśaṅku,🔽Desirous, Householder, Fierce,

original: 'dod ma khyim ma gtum mo dang // bdud dral k'a tya'i bu mo dang // zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod ma khyim ma gtum mo dang // bdud dral k'a tya'i bu mo dang // zhes pa'o //
translated: and Māra-splitting, Kātyāyanī,

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams thun mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi dang bcas pa ni sum cu rtsa drug yin la //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di rnams thun mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi dang bcas pa ni sum cu rtsa drug yin la //
translated: These thirty-two together with the four channels of the junctures make thirty-six.

original: sum skor ma la sogs pa dang // aa wa dh'u t'i la sogs pa brgyad dor nas //
analyzed: sum skor ma la sogs pa dang // aa wa dh'u t'i la sogs pa brgyad dor nas //
translated: Excluding the eight beginning with Triśaṅku and the eight beginning with the avadhūti,

original: lhag ma mi phyed ma la sogs pa ni rab gtum ma la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhir shes par bya la /
analyzed: lhag ma mi phyed ma la sogs pa ni rab gtum ma la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhir shes par bya la /
translated: the remaining twenty-four beginning with Acalā are to be known as the twenty-four beginning with Pracaṇḍā.

original: 'di rnams kyi so dang sen mo la sogs pa'i khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi so dang sen mo la sogs pa'i khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni /
translated: The twenty-four elements of their teeth, nails, and so forth

original: thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams su shes par bya'o //
translated: are to be known as the twenty-four beginning with Kapālasambhava.

original: de la rtsa gnyis dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: de la rtsa gnyis dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni /
translated: The etymologies of the two channels and the names of the ḍākinīs are as follows.

original: dbye bar bya ba ma yin pa'i sen mo dang so rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba ma yin pa'i sen mo dang so rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they produce the nails and teeth that are not to be divided,

original: mi phyed ma ste spyi bo la'o //
analyzed: mi phyed ma ste spyi bo la'o //
translated: they are called Acalā, and they are located at the crown.

original: shin tu phra ba'i skra dang ba spu 'bab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i skra dang ba spu 'bab pa'i phyir /
translated: Since very fine hair and body hair fall out,

original: phra gzugs ma ste spyi gtsug tu'o //
analyzed: phra gzugs ma ste spyi gtsug tu'o //
translated: it is the subtle form, at the crown of the head.

original: pags pa'i dri ma phyi rol tu snang bzhin pas 'bab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pags pa'i dri ma phyi rol tu snang bzhin pas 'bab pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the dirt of the skin appears externally and falls out,

original: mdzes ma ste rna ba g-yas pa la'o //🔽g-yon nyid du gang ba'i sha 'bab pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mdzes ma ste rna ba g-yas pa la'o // g-yon nyid du gang ba'i sha 'bab pa'i phyir ram /
translated: it is the beautiful one, in the right ear.🔽Since flesh fills the left side,

original: g-yon gyi rnam pa'i snying stobs kyi khams 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: g-yon gyi rnam pa'i snying stobs kyi khams 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: or since the sattva element of the left side arises,

original: gnyi ga las g-yon pa ma ste rgyab tu'o //🔽chu rgyus 'bab pa las sam /
analyzed: gnyi ga las g-yon pa ma ste rgyab tu'o // chu rgyus 'bab pa las sam /
translated: it is the left one, on the back.🔽Since sinews fall out,

original: zos pa skyugs pa las te /
analyzed: zos pa skyugs pa las te /
translated: or since what is eaten is vomited out,

original: gnyi ga las thung du ma ni rna ba g-yon pa la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga las thung du ma ni rna ba g-yon pa la'o //
translated: it is the short one, in the left ear.

original: rus sbal gyi rgyab lta bur mi phyed pa'i rus pa'i phreng ba 'bab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rus sbal gyi rgyab lta bur mi phyed pa'i rus pa'i phreng ba 'bab pa'i phyir /
translated: Since a series of bones that cannot be separated like the back of a tortoise falls out,

original: rus sbal skyes ma ste smin ma'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: rus sbal skyes ma ste smin ma'i dbus su'o //
translated: it is the tortoise birth, in the middle of the eyebrows.

original: mchin pa 'byung bar byed cing 'dzag par byed do zhes pas /
analyzed: mchin pa 'byung bar byed cing 'dzag par byed do zhes pas /
translated: Since the liver is produced and drips,

original: sgom pa ma ste mig gnyis la'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ma ste mig gnyis la'o //
translated: it is the meditator, in the two eyes.

original: snying las bdud rtsi'i ro gtor bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying las bdud rtsi'i ro gtor bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it scatters the taste of nectar from the heart,

original: dbang ma ste dpung pa'i rtsa ba gnyis la'o //
analyzed: dbang ma ste dpung pa'i rtsa ba gnyis la'o //
translated: it is the powerful one, on the two roots of the arms.

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas su rtsa brgyad po 'di rnams ni mkha' spyod ma ste /
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas su rtsa brgyad po 'di rnams ni mkha' spyod ma ste /
translated: In the abode and the neighboring abode, these eight roots are the sky-farers,

original: thabs dang bcas pa thugs kyi 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa thugs kyi 'khor lo la'o //
translated: together with the method, on the mind wheel.

original: skyon byed cing rang gi yul gyi rnam par 'gyur bar byed do zhes pa skyon ma ste /
analyzed: skyon byed cing rang gi yul gyi rnam par 'gyur bar byed do zhes pa skyon ma ste /
translated: Since it causes faults and changes the form of its own object, it is the faulty one,

original: mig gi khams la gnod pa'i mchan khung dag la'o //
analyzed: mig gi khams la gnod pa'i mchan khung dag la'o //
translated: on the two armpits, which are the element of the eyes.

original: mchan khung mthong ba las yid rnam par 'gyur te /🔽'di ni bdag gi'o zhes zhe sdang @327a * //
analyzed: mchan khung mthong ba las yid rnam par 'gyur te / 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes zhe sdang @327a * //
translated: Since the mind changes from seeing the armpits,

original: 'byung ba'i phyir yang ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyir yang ste /
translated: it is also the one that gives rise to hatred, thinking, “This is mine.”

original: zhe sdang dang skyon zhes ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang skyon zhes ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Fault and hatred are synonyms.

original: mkhris bar brjod ba'i bshang ba 'bab bar byed do zhes pas bshang ba ma ste /
analyzed: mkhris bar brjod ba'i bshang ba 'bab bar byed do zhes pas bshang ba ma ste /
translated: Since it causes the flow of feces, which is called “bile,” it is the feces,

original: nu ma gnyis la'o //
analyzed: nu ma gnyis la'o //
translated: on the two breasts.

original: bshang ba'i khams bskul ba na steng du glo ba 'bab pa'i phyir la lta bu yin pas ma'am /
analyzed: bshang ba'i khams bskul ba na steng du glo ba 'bab pa'i phyir la lta bu yin pas ma'am /
translated: Since it is the mother, since it is the one that causes the flow of the feces element, it is the mother, since it flows upward to the lungs.

original: ma la brten nas mngon par 'dod pa skyed pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir yang ste lte ba la'o //
analyzed: ma la brten nas mngon par 'dod pa skyed pa'i phyir dang / 'gro ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir yang ste lte ba la'o //
translated: The belly is the navel, because it generates the desire for food, and because it generates the world.

original: rgyu ma'i phreng ba rnams su bde ba chen por nyal ba'i phyir ri khrod ma'o //🔽mtshan mo'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu ma'i phreng ba rnams su bde ba chen por nyal ba'i phyir ri khrod ma'o // mtshan mo'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: The forest is the intestines, because one sleeps in the great bliss of the garland of intestines.🔽The sign is the tip of the nose, because it generates the concepts of night.

original: mtshan ma ma ste sna rtse la'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma ste sna rtse la'o //
translated: The signless is the tip of the nose, because it generates the concepts of night.

original: gnye ma dang tshil bu'i tshogs kyis rgyu ma la yongs su bskor nas gnas so //
analyzed: gnye ma dang tshil bu'i tshogs kyis rgyu ma la yongs su bskor nas gnas so //
translated: The intestines are the intestines, because they are surrounded by the collection of feces and fat.

original: de 'bab par byed pa'i phyir dkar sbyin ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de 'bab par byed pa'i phyir dkar sbyin ma yin pa'am /
translated: The white giver is the throat, because it causes the flow of semen.

original: des bsil sbyin ma ste kha la'o //
analyzed: des bsil sbyin ma ste kha la'o //
translated: The cool giver is the mouth, because it is cool with saliva.

original: lto bar bkres pa'i me ste /🔽de 'bab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽drod ma ste mgrin pa la'o //🔽bshang ba 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: lto bar bkres pa'i me ste / de 'bab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir / drod ma ste mgrin pa la'o // bshang ba 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The belly is the stomach, because it is the fire of hunger.🔽The warmth is the throat, because it causes the flow of semen.

original: gzhol ma ste yi ge bzlog pa las pra la b'a'o //
analyzed: gzhol ma ste yi ge bzlog pa las pra la b'a'o //
translated: The downward is the anus, because it is the flow of feces.

original: rnam par snang mdzad 'bab ma snying ga la'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad 'bab ma snying ga la'o //
translated: The shining is the heart, because it is the flow of Vairocana.

original: mtshams mtha'i snod kyi nang du de 'bab pa nyid las rangs pa'i gdong ma ste /
analyzed: mtshams mtha'i snod kyi nang du de 'bab pa nyid las rangs pa'i gdong ma ste /
translated: In the vessel of the end of the passage, it falls, and from that, the face of Rati.

original: de'i reg pa las thabs dang shes rab dag gi dga' ba nyid kyi phyir chu so la'o //
analyzed: de'i reg pa las thabs dang shes rab dag gi dga' ba nyid kyi phyir chu so la'o //
translated: From the contact of that, there is the joy of means and wisdom, and so it is in the urethra.

original: gsung gi 'khor lo la /
analyzed: gsung gi 'khor lo la /
translated: In the wheel of enlightened speech,

original: zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang / 'dun pa dang nye ba'i 'dun pa 'di rnams su rtsa brgyad po ni sa spyod ma rnams so //
analyzed: zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dang / 'dun pa dang nye ba'i 'dun pa 'di rnams su rtsa brgyad po ni sa spyod ma rnams so //
translated: in the fields and the neighboring fields, in the regions and the neighboring regions, the eight channels are the earth goddesses.

original: khams mnyam pa nyid kyi bad kan 'bab pa'i phyir spyi ma ste gsang ba la'o //
analyzed: khams mnyam pa nyid kyi bad kan 'bab pa'i phyir spyi ma ste gsang ba la'o //
translated: In the state of equality of the elements, the phlegm falls, and so it is in the secret place.

original: phal cher sha za ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: phal cher sha za ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Or, because it is mostly flesh-eating,

original: mi sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: or because it generates the conception of non-union,

original: sbyor bral ma ste bshang lam la'o //
analyzed: sbyor bral ma ste bshang lam la'o //
translated: it is the channel of separation, in the anus.

original: khrag 'bab pa las dpyid kyi me tog rnams kyi dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir sdu gu ma ste brla dag la'o //
analyzed: khrag 'bab pa las dpyid kyi me tog rnams kyi dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir sdu gu ma ste brla dag la'o //
translated: From the falling of blood, the joy of the spring flowers is generated, and so it is in the thighs.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa na rdul skye ba ni thams cad la grub ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa na rdul skye ba ni thams cad la grub ste /
translated: The arising of the red vital essence in union is established for all.

original: de 'bab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir grub ma ste byin pa la'o //
analyzed: de 'bab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir grub ma ste byin pa la'o //
translated: Since it causes the flow of semen, it is the cause of the growth of the body, and since it is the principal cause of semen, it is the cause of semen.

original: grub pa'i mtshan ma skye ba'i rten yin pa'am /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtshan ma skye ba'i rten yin pa'am /
translated: Since it is the basis for the arising of the signs of accomplishment,🔽or since it is the principal cause of that, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it causes the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.

original: de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir na lus rgyas pa la tshil bu nyid rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de gtso bo yin pa'i phyir na lus rgyas pa la tshil bu nyid rgyu yin la /
translated: Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.

original: de 'bab pa'i phyir rgyu sbyin ma ste /🔽rkang pa'i sor mo rnams la'o //🔽gdong gi mchi ma ni mya ngan 'bar ba yin @327b pa'i phyir me ma ste rkang pa'i rgyab la'o //
analyzed: de 'bab pa'i phyir rgyu sbyin ma ste / rkang pa'i sor mo rnams la'o // gdong gi mchi ma ni mya ngan 'bar ba yin @327b pa'i phyir me ma ste rkang pa'i rgyab la'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.

original: lud pa dor bas rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir yid bzangs ma ste rkang pa'i mthe bo la'o //
analyzed: lud pa dor bas rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir yid bzangs ma ste rkang pa'i mthe bo la'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it is the cause of the flow of semen, it is the cause of semen.🔽Since it is the cause of the growth of the body, it is the cause of the growth of the body.🔽Since it is the cause of the flow of semen,

original: ji srid du ngar snabs kyi skyon byed pa'i phyir k'a tya ya na ste pus mo gnyis la'o zhes pa sku'i 'khor lo la 'du ba dang / nye ba'i 'du ba dang / dur khrod dang / nya ba'i dur khrod du brjod pa rnams su rtsa brgyad po rnams ni sa 'og na gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: ji srid du ngar snabs kyi skyon byed pa'i phyir k'a tya ya na ste pus mo gnyis la'o zhes pa sku'i 'khor lo la 'du ba dang / nye ba'i 'du ba dang / dur khrod dang / nya ba'i dur khrod du brjod pa rnams su rtsa brgyad po rnams ni sa 'og na gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The eight channels in the lower part of the body are the gathering places, the secondary gathering places, the charnel grounds, and the secondary charnel grounds of the body cakra.

original: ngag gi snga ma'i sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pas dam tshig gi 'khor lo'i rtsa'i nges pa'i tshig rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: ngag gi snga ma'i sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pas dam tshig gi 'khor lo'i rtsa'i nges pa'i tshig rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: The commitment cakra is extensively described by the words “mouth door” and so on.

original: ngag gi sgo las /🔽snga ma ni lus kyi sgo de rnams su'o //
analyzed: ngag gi sgo las / snga ma ni lus kyi sgo de rnams su'o //
translated: From the mouth door

original: mig la sogs pa'i rtsa brgyad po g-yas dang g-yon du yang ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rtsa brgyad po g-yas dang g-yon du yang ste /
translated: the eight channels of the eyes and so on are on the right and left.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / kha dang / gsang ba dag tu'o //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / kha dang / gsang ba dag tu'o //
translated: They are the eyes, ears, nose, mouth, and genitals.

original: de rnams kyi ming ni rab tu grags pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi ming ni rab tu grags pa kho na ste /
translated: Their names are well known.

original: yul nye bar mtshon pa'i dam tshig gi rjes su gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul nye bar mtshon pa'i dam tshig gi rjes su gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: They are called commitment cakras because they abide in the commitments that are the representations of the objects.

original: dam tshig gi 'khor lor gnas par shes par bya'o zhes pa ni rtsa'i des pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: dam tshig gi 'khor lor gnas par shes par bya'o zhes pa ni rtsa'i des pa'i tshig go //
translated: One should understand that they abide in the commitment wheel.

original: gnas kyi rim pa'i tshig ni sngar bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnas kyi rim pa'i tshig ni sngar bshad pa rnams so //
translated: The words of the stages of the places have been explained above.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig brjod par bya ste /
translated: The definitions of the dakinis should be stated.🔽Here, the dakinis of the right are born from the family of Varahi.

original: 'dir g-yas kho na'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni phag mo'i rigs las yang dag par byung ba yin no zhes lan mang du khong du chud par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir g-yas kho na'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni phag mo'i rigs las yang dag par byung ba yin no zhes lan mang du khong du chud par byas pa yin no //
translated: This should be understood many times.

original: de dang mi phyed pa'i gzugs nyid kyis de rnams kyi brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dang mi phyed pa'i gzugs nyid kyis de rnams kyi brjod par bya ste /
translated: By the form that is inseparable from that, they should be stated.

original: de la rab tu ma zhi ba dang gtum pa nyid gang gi yin pa de ni rab tu gtum ma'o //
analyzed: de la rab tu ma zhi ba dang gtum pa nyid gang gi yin pa de ni rab tu gtum ma'o //
translated: Among them, that which is fierce and violent is candika.

original: g-yon dang cig shos kyi rtsa dag bde pa chen po'i gnas su son pa ji srid par gtum zhing rno pa'i sreg par byed pa ni 'di'i yin no zhes pas gtum mig ma'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang cig shos kyi rtsa dag bde pa chen po'i gnas su son pa ji srid par gtum zhing rno pa'i sreg par byed pa ni 'di'i yin no zhes pas gtum mig ma'o //
translated: The left and right channels reach the place of great bliss. As long as they burn and are sharp, they burn. This is candikā.

original: gnyis po dag dbu mar rab tu gsal ba las me'i kha dog gi 'od dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir 'od ldan ma dang / gsang ba dang / snying ga dang / gdong gi sna rtse chen po rnams gang gi yin pa de ni sna chen ma ste /
analyzed: gnyis po dag dbu mar rab tu gsal ba las me'i kha dog gi 'od dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir 'od ldan ma dang / gsang ba dang / snying ga dang / gdong gi sna rtse chen po rnams gang gi yin pa de ni sna chen ma ste /
translated: Since the two are very clear in the middle, and since they possess the light of the color of fire, she is called “having light.”

original: gnas kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni don ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni don ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The dakinis of the places are just as they are explained.

original: dpa' bo skyed par byed pa nyid kyis yod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni dpa' bo'i blo can ma ste /🔽lte ba'i dbus nas dpa' bo ni //
analyzed: dpa' bo skyed par byed pa nyid kyis yod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni dpa' bo'i blo can ma ste / lte ba'i dbus nas dpa' bo ni //
translated: She is called “heroic minded” because she is the one who generates the heroes and exists as their creator.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnon po yang 'di yin la 'khor lo gsum sreg par byed @328a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // rnon po yang 'di yin la 'khor lo gsum sreg par byed @328a * //
translated: Because it is said, “The hero is in the middle of the navel.”

original: pa'i sgo yang 'di yin te /🔽slar yang de 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i sgo yang 'di yin te / slar yang de 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: She is called “sharp” because she is sharp, and she is the door that burns the three wheels.

original: mi'u thung ma'o //
analyzed: mi'u thung ma'o //
translated: Because she increases them again, she is called “dwarf.”

original: langka ni lus kyi grong ste /
analyzed: langka ni lus kyi grong ste /
translated: Laṅkā is the city of the body.

original: de'i dbang phyug ma'am rje mo ni langka'i dbang phyug ma'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug ma'am rje mo ni langka'i dbang phyug ma'o //
translated: The queen or mistress of that is the “Laṅkā queen.”

original: shing gi grib ma lta bur bsil ba 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shing gi grib ma lta bur bsil ba 'phel bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: She is called Vāyuvegā because she increases the cooling that is like the shade of a tree.

original: shing grib ma'o zhes pa nye ba'i gnas kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin te /🔽thugs kyi 'khor lo'i mkha' la spyod pa rnams so //🔽sa srung lta bu'i shugs 'bab pa ni sa srung ma'o //🔽sgron ma gnyis pa la 'dud pa gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shing grib ma'o zhes pa nye ba'i gnas kyi mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin te / thugs kyi 'khor lo'i mkha' la spyod pa rnams so // sa srung lta bu'i shugs 'bab pa ni sa srung ma'o // sgron ma gnyis pa la 'dud pa gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: She is called Vṛścika because she is the meaning of the ḍākinīs of the nearby places.

original: 'jigs byed chen mo'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen mo'o //
translated: She is called Mahābhairavā because she cuts off the bowing to the second lamp.

original: rlung lta bur steng dang 'og dang phyogs bcu rnams su yang mgyogs pa'i shugs gang gi yin pa de ni rlung shugs ma'o //
analyzed: rlung lta bur steng dang 'og dang phyogs bcu rnams su yang mgyogs pa'i shugs gang gi yin pa de ni rlung shugs ma'o //
translated: She is called Vāyuvegā because she is the one who has the speed above, below, and in the ten directions like the wind.

original: sgron ma gnyis par yang chang ni bdud rtsi ste 'thung bar byed do zhes pas chang 'thung ma ste /
analyzed: sgron ma gnyis par yang chang ni bdud rtsi ste 'thung bar byed do zhes pas chang 'thung ma ste /
translated: She is called Surābhakṣi because she drinks the beer, that is, the nectar, in the second lamp.

original: ye shes kyi sgron ma'o zhes pa zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgron ma'o zhes pa zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: She is called Jñānārciṣī because she is the meaning of the ḍākinīs of the fields and the nearby fields.

original: rab tu dga' ba ldang ba'i phyir sngo bsangs kyang 'di yin la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ldang ba'i phyir sngo bsangs kyang 'di yin la /
translated: She is also Syamavati, the blue-green goddess, because she arises from the intense joy.

original: 'khor lo thams cad du rol pa las lha mo yang yin pa ni lha mo sngo bsangs ma'o //🔽legs pa ni me long yin la /
analyzed: 'khor lo thams cad du rol pa las lha mo yang yin pa ni lha mo sngo bsangs ma'o // legs pa ni me long yin la /
translated: She is also the goddess Syama, the blue-green goddess, because she is a goddess who sports in all the wheels.

original: bzang ba ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: bzang ba ni dge ba ste /
translated: The good is the mirror, and the excellent is the virtuous;

original: de gang gi yin pa de ni shin tu bzang mo'o //
analyzed: de gang gi yin pa de ni shin tu bzang mo'o //
translated: she who has that is Su-bhaga, the very fortunate one.

original: rta lta bur rna ba g-yas nas 'byung bar byed pa ni rta rna ma'o //
analyzed: rta lta bur rna ba g-yas nas 'byung bar byed pa ni rta rna ma'o //
translated: She is also Hayakarna, the horse-eared one, because she causes the horse-like breath to emerge from the right nostril.

original: bya'i gdong gi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro bya gdong ma ste /
analyzed: bya'i gdong gi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir mkha' 'gro bya gdong ma ste /
translated: She is also the bird-faced dakini, because she has the face of a bird.

original: 'dun pa dang nye ba'i 'dun pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du'o zhes pa gsung gi 'khor lo las sa spyod ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang nye ba'i 'dun pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin du'o zhes pa gsung gi 'khor lo las sa spyod ma rnams so //
translated: The earth-dwelling dakinis are in the speech wheel, just like the dakinis of the desire and the proximate desire.

original: 'khor lo lta bur 'khor lo rnams su 'di'i shugs kyis 'gro zhing 'ong bas na 'khor lo'i shugs can ma'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo lta bur 'khor lo rnams su 'di'i shugs kyis 'gro zhing 'ong bas na 'khor lo'i shugs can ma'o //
translated: She is also Cakra-vega, the wheel-swift one, because she goes and comes in the wheels by the force of the wheel.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang spyan ma la sogs pa rnams dang por dum bur byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang spyan ma la sogs pa rnams dang por dum bur byed cing /
translated: The Tathagatas and Locana, etc., are first divided into parts.

original: slar yang 'jug par byed cing skyed par byed pa'i phyir dum skyes ma'o //
analyzed: slar yang 'jug par byed cing skyed par byed pa'i phyir dum skyes ma'o //
translated: Again, she is a “girl born in pieces” because she causes entry and generation.

original: myos par byed pa'i chang 'thung ba'i phyir chang 'thung ma'o //
analyzed: myos par byed pa'i chang 'thung ba'i phyir chang 'thung ma'o //
translated: She is a “drinker of beer” because she drinks intoxicating beer.

original: 'di'i go cha 'khor lo lta bu yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'di'i go cha 'khor lo lta bu yin pa de ni /
translated: Her armor is like a wheel, and so she is a “wheel-armed girl.”

original: 'khor lo'i go cha ma'o zhes pa 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin no //🔽shin tu dpa' ba'i aa yig las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i go cha ma'o zhes pa 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin no // shin tu dpa' ba'i aa yig las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the “wheel-armed girl” is just like the meaning of the “gathering” and “close-gathering” dakinis.

original: shin tu dpa' @328b mo'o //
analyzed: shin tu dpa' @328b mo'o //
translated: She is a “great hero” because she arises from the syllable a, which is a great hero.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag gi stobs chen mo gang gi yin pa de ni stobs chen mo'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag gi stobs chen mo gang gi yin pa de ni stobs chen mo'o //
translated: She is a “great strength” because she has the great strength of going and coming.

original: 'khor lo rnams su 'jug pa'i dang tshul gang yin pa de ni 'khor los sgyur ma'o //🔽ldang ba na brtson 'grus chen mo gang gi yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'khor lo rnams su 'jug pa'i dang tshul gang yin pa de ni 'khor los sgyur ma'o // ldang ba na brtson 'grus chen mo gang gi yin pa de ni /
translated: She is a “wheel-turner” because she is the way of entering the wheels.🔽She is a “great effort” because she is the one who makes great effort in rising.

original: brtson 'grus chen mo gang gi yin pa de ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen mo gang gi yin pa de ni /
translated: She is a “great strength” because she is the one who has great strength in rising.

original: brtson 'grus chen mo'o zhes pa dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi mkha' 'gro rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen mo'o zhes pa dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi mkha' 'gro rnams kyi don ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The one of great diligence is just as it is for the ḍākinīs of the charnel grounds and the nearby charnel grounds.

original: de ni sku'i 'khor lo'i sa 'og spyod pa rnams so //🔽mig la sogs pa'i dbang po bcu la sogs pas yul gyi bza' ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir /🔽dbang po'i rtsa brgyad po khva gdong ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni sku'i 'khor lo'i sa 'og spyod pa rnams so // mig la sogs pa'i dbang po bcu la sogs pas yul gyi bza' ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir / dbang po'i rtsa brgyad po khva gdong ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is the stage of the wheel of body, the conduct in the underworld.🔽The eight root faculties such as the eyes, etc., are Khaṇḍakapālin, etc., because they apprehend the food of the objects, etc.

original: dam tshig gi 'khor lo'i dpa' mo rnams kyi nges tshig go //
analyzed: dam tshig gi 'khor lo'i dpa' mo rnams kyi nges tshig go //
translated: The eight root faculties are Khaṇḍakapālin, etc., because they apprehend the food of the objects, etc.🔽The eight root faculties are Khaṇḍakapālin, etc., because they apprehend the food of the objects, etc.

original: da ni dpa' bo rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dpa' bo rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the etymology of the heroes will be explained.

original: dum bu ste mgo bo'i gnas su so dang sen mo'i gzugs kyi sa byang chub kyi sems len par byed cing skul bar byed pa'i phyir thod pa'i dum bu'o //
analyzed: dum bu ste mgo bo'i gnas su so dang sen mo'i gzugs kyi sa byang chub kyi sems len par byed cing skul bar byed pa'i phyir thod pa'i dum bu'o //
translated: Since the head place is a piece, and the form of the teeth and nails is taken up and aroused in the bodhicitta, it is Khaṇḍakapālin.

original: ma h'a kam ka ni spyi gtsug gi gnas su yong pa de nyid de /
analyzed: ma h'a kam ka ni spyi gtsug gi gnas su yong pa de nyid de /
translated: Mahākaṃkāla is the same in the place of the crown protuberance.

original: skra dang ba spu len par byed pa'i phyir keng rus chen po'o //
analyzed: skra dang ba spu len par byed pa'i phyir keng rus chen po'o //
translated: Since the hair and body hair are taken up, it is Mahākaṃkāla.

original: rna ba'i rtsa bar son nas pags pa'i dri ma skul par byed pa'i phyir keng rus so //
analyzed: rna ba'i rtsa bar son nas pags pa'i dri ma skul par byed pa'i phyir keng rus so //
translated: It is called “skeleton” because it reaches the root of the ear and stimulates the smell of the skin.

original: rgyab tu sha'i rang bzhin gyi mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa gang gi yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rgyab tu sha'i rang bzhin gyi mche ba rnam par gtsigs pa gang gi yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: It is called “fanged flesh” because it is the one that has fangs of flesh in the back.

original: gnas kyi dpa' bo'i nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gnas kyi dpa' bo'i nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the etymology of the heroes of the places.

original: chang rnams kyi ste chu rgyus rnams kyi dgra rna ba g-yon pa la 'jug par byed pa ni chang dgra'o //
analyzed: chang rnams kyi ste chu rgyus rnams kyi dgra rna ba g-yon pa la 'jug par byed pa ni chang dgra'o //
translated: It is called “enemy of the wines” because it enters the left ear, the enemy of the wines, the sinews.

original: smin ma'i dbus su gnas nas dpag tu med pa'i rus pa'i phreng ba rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid las byung ba ni 'od dpag med do //🔽rdo rje rin chen lta bu'i 'od mig gang gi yin pa de las mchin pa rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje 'od do //
analyzed: smin ma'i dbus su gnas nas dpag tu med pa'i rus pa'i phreng ba rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid las byung ba ni 'od dpag med do // rdo rje rin chen lta bu'i 'od mig gang gi yin pa de las mchin pa rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje 'od do //
translated: It is called “Amitābha” because it arises from the state of entering the infinite rosary of bones, located in the middle of the eyebrows.🔽It is called “Vajraprabha” because the liver enters from the one whose eyes have the light of a vajra gem.

original: gang gi lus rdo rje lta bur brtan pa'i dpung pa'i rtsa ba las snying rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje lus te /
analyzed: gang gi lus rdo rje lta bur brtan pa'i dpung pa'i rtsa ba las snying rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje lus te /
translated: It is called “Vajrakāya” because the heart enters from the root of the arm, which is firm like a vajra body.

original: nye ba'i gnas kyi dpa' bo'i tshig go //
analyzed: nye ba'i gnas kyi dpa' bo'i tshig go //
translated: These are the names of the heroes of the neighboring places.

original: mchan khung dag las mig gi myu gu skye ba'i phyir myu gu can no //
analyzed: mchan khung dag las mig gi myu gu skye ba'i phyir myu gu can no //
translated: Since the sprouts of the eyes are born from the armpits, he who has sprouts (aṅkura).

original: nu ma dag las rdo rje'i ral pa lta bu'i mkhris pa'i khams skyed par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje ral pa can no //
analyzed: nu ma dag las rdo rje'i ral pa lta bu'i mkhris pa'i khams skyed par byed pa'i phyir rdo rje ral pa can no //
translated: Since the bile element, which is like a vajra-mane, is generated from the breasts, he is the vajra-mane one (vajakeśa).

original: lte bar rdo rje chen po yang 'jig par byed pa glo ba rab tu 'jug pa las dpa' bo chen po'o //
analyzed: lte bar rdo rje chen po yang 'jig par byed pa glo ba rab tu 'jug pa las dpa' bo chen po'o //
translated: Since the great vajra also destroys at the navel, and since the lungs are well-entered, he is the great hero (mahāvīra).

original: sna rtse las rgyu ma'i sgo rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sna rtse las rgyu ma'i sgo rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since the anus is well-entered from the tip of the nose,

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad do zhes pa zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi dpa' bo'i nges @329a * //🔽pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad do zhes pa zhing dang nye ba'i zhing gi dpa' bo'i nges @329a * // pa'i tshig go //
translated: he is Vajra Humkara. These are the names of the heroes of the fields and neighboring fields.

original: bde ba 'phel bar byed pa mo //
analyzed: bde ba 'phel bar byed pa mo //
translated: She is the one who increases bliss (śivā).

original: gnye ma rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu bzang po'o //
analyzed: gnye ma rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir shin tu bzang po'o //
translated: Since the small intestine is well-entered, she is Suśubhrā (Very Pure).

original: mgrin pa las lto ba rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mgrin pa las lto ba rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the stomach is well-entered from the throat,

original: rdo rje bzang po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzang po'o //
translated: she is Vajrasuci (Vajra Pure).

original: yang na mgrin pa dang lto ba dag las thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba'i rdo rje theg pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba las kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang na mgrin pa dang lto ba dag las thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba'i rdo rje theg pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba las kyang ngo //
translated: Or else, he is Vajra-Bhairava because he turns the wheel of the Vajra Vehicle Dharma, which is virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end, from the throat and the belly.

original: skye bo sdar ma'i snying la skrag par byed pa bshang ba rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje 'jigs byed do //
analyzed: skye bo sdar ma'i snying la skrag par byed pa bshang ba rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje 'jigs byed do //
translated: He is Acala because he is the one who causes the feces to flow, terrifying the hearts of the timid.

original: chu so las mtshams kyi mtha'i mig gsum rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: chu so las mtshams kyi mtha'i mig gsum rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: He is Acalanatha because he is the one who causes the three eyes at the end of the boundary to flow from the urinary canal.

original: mig mi bzang ngo zhes pa 'dun pa dang / nye ba'i 'dun pa'i dpa' bo rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: mig mi bzang ngo zhes pa 'dun pa dang / nye ba'i 'dun pa'i dpa' bo rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: These are the etymologies of the heroes of the desire and the adjacent desires.

original: gsang ba las lus 'dzin par nus pa'i bad kan 'bab pa'i phyir stobs po che'o //
analyzed: gsang ba las lus 'dzin par nus pa'i bad kan 'bab pa'i phyir stobs po che'o //
translated: He is Mahabala because he is the one who is able to hold the body from the secret place, causing the phlegm to flow.

original: bshang lam las kha dog ser po'i rnag rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir rin chen rdo rje'o //
analyzed: bshang lam las kha dog ser po'i rnag rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir rin chen rdo rje'o //
translated: He is Ratnavajra because he is the one who causes the yellow pus to flow from the anus.

original: brla dag las stobs dang ldan pa'i khrag rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir rta mgrin no //
analyzed: brla dag las stobs dang ldan pa'i khrag rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir rta mgrin no //
translated: He is Hayagriva because he is the one who causes the powerful blood to flow from the thighs.

original: byin pa dag las ba spu'i bu ga'i nang khyab par byed pa'i rdul rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i snying po'o zhes pa 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba'i dpa' bo'i nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: byin pa dag las ba spu'i bu ga'i nang khyab par byed pa'i rdul rab tu 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir nam mkha'i snying po'o zhes pa 'du ba dang nye ba'i 'du ba'i dpa' bo'i nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: Since the particles that pervade the pores of the body emerge from the ankles, he is Akasagarbha.

original: rkang pa'i sor mo dag las mi phyed pa'i h'um gi yi ge'i gzugs kyi tshil bu rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir dpal he ru ka'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i sor mo dag las mi phyed pa'i h'um gi yi ge'i gzugs kyi tshil bu rab tu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir dpal he ru ka'o //
translated: Since the fat in the form of the syllable hum emerges from the toes, he is Sri Heruka.

original: rkang ba'i rgyab las padma gar gyi dbang phyug byang chub kyi sems mchi ma'i rang bzhin rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: rkang ba'i rgyab las padma gar gyi dbang phyug byang chub kyi sems mchi ma'i rang bzhin rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: Since the bodhicitta in the form of tears emerges from the heels, he is Padmanarteshvara.

original: mthe bo dag las kha dog dkar po'i lud pa rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: mthe bo dag las kha dog dkar po'i lud pa rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Since the white phlegm emerges from the big toes, he is Vairochana.

original: pus mo dag la zla ba dkar po'i ngar snabs rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje sems dpa'o zhes pa dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi dpa' bo'i des pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: pus mo dag la zla ba dkar po'i ngar snabs rab tu 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje sems dpa'o zhes pa dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi dpa' bo'i des pa'i tshig go //
translated: Since the white lunar nectar enters the knees, it is Vajrasattva.

original: g-yon dang g-yas su 'bab pa las rab tu 'jug bzhin pa 'di rnams kyi sngon du nges par byas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams dang / don ji lta ba bzhin gyi nye ba'i gnas na gnas pa rnams dang / rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi thim pa dang /
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas su 'bab pa las rab tu 'jug bzhin pa 'di rnams kyi sngon du nges par byas pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams dang / don ji lta ba bzhin gyi nye ba'i gnas na gnas pa rnams dang / rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi thim pa dang /
translated: These, who are engaged in flowing to the left and right, are the dakinis who are definitely placed in front, and those who dwell in the places according to their meaning, and the yoginis.

original: longs spyod dang / dbang byed pa las bdun cu rtsa gnyis su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / dbang byed pa las bdun cu rtsa gnyis su shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as seventy-two, from dissolution, enjoyment, and control.

original: don 'di ni /
analyzed: don 'di ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sku @329b gsung thug kyi 'khor lo la //
analyzed: sku @329b gsung thug kyi 'khor lo la //
translated: In the wheels of body, speech, and mind,

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhir yang dag brjod //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhir yang dag brjod //
translated: they are said to be twenty-four.

original: ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from here,

original: shes rab pha rol phyin 'di rnams //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin 'di rnams //
translated: these perfections of wisdom

original: lus la yang dag rnam par gnas //
analyzed: lus la yang dag rnam par gnas //
translated: are perfectly located in the body.

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis rtogs par byas pa yin no //🔽'di rnams kyi tshig gi don gyi nges par sbyor ba ni go sla'o zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis rtogs par byas pa yin no // 'di rnams kyi tshig gi don gyi nges par sbyor ba ni go sla'o zhes pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel pa gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las /
translated: This is understood from the text that concludes with “thus.”🔽The application of the meaning of the words is easy to understand.🔽This concludes the extensive explanation of the sixth chapter of the Jewel of the Oral Tradition, a commentary on the glorious secret, the Essence of the Great Seal,

original: rgyas par bstan pa drug pa'i rgyas par bshad ba'o /🔽// / rtsa'i rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan pa bdun pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa drug pa'i rgyas par bshad ba'o / // / rtsa'i rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor ma rnams byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rang bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan pa bdun pa gsungs te /
translated: the Spring Time of Youth, an explanatory tantra of the glorious Esoteric Community.🔽The seventh chapter

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The seventh chapter is spoken beginning with “Then, the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened one, having entered into the samādhi called ‘The Vajra of the Essence of the Tathāgatas,’🔽the Bhagavān emitted from his body the vajra body, speech, and mind of all Tathāgatas.”

original: dang por rig par bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang por rig par bya ba ni /
translated: The explanation of the seventh chapter🔽The explanation of the seventh chapter is begun in order to understand the yoginīs who are the nature of the channels as the factors of enlightenment.🔽Then, the Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened one, having entered into the samādhi called “The Vajra of the Essence of the Tathāgatas,” the Bhagavān emitted from his body the vajra body, speech, and mind of all Tathāgatas.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni mkha' 'gro ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gi snying ga la sogs pa dang / mgo bo la sogs pa'i lus kyi sgo 'di rnams su mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa rnams byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos ngo bo nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni mkha' 'gro ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gi snying ga la sogs pa dang / mgo bo la sogs pa'i lus kyi sgo 'di rnams su mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin gyi rtsa rnams byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos ngo bo nyid du yang 'gyur ro zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In the body, in the heart, etc., and in the head, etc., in these doors of the body, the nature of the dakinis is the channels, and they are the realities of the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva, the great being, who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: lam lngas bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la ji lta ba bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lam lngas bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la ji lta ba bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment included in the five paths, just as they are.

original: de la lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lam gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five paths?

original: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / sgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / sgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of accumulation, the path of preparation, the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, and the path of no more learning.

original: de la tshogs kyi lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path of equipment?

original: chos bcu gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: chos bcu gnyis rnams so //
translated: It is twelve factors.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: dran par nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: dran par nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: They are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, and the four legs of magical emanation.

original: de la sbyor ba'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path of preparation?

original: chos bcu rnams so //
analyzed: chos bcu rnams so //
translated: It is ten factors.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: dbang po lnga dang stobs lnga rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang stobs lnga rnams so //
translated: They are the five faculties and the five powers.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path of seeing?

original: chos bdun rnams so //
analyzed: chos bdun rnams so //
translated: It is seven factors.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnams so //
translated: They are the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: de la sgom pa'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sgom pa'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path of cultivation?

original: lam gyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: It is the branches of the path.

original: lam gyi yan lag gang zhe na /🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag @330a * //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gang zhe na / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag @330a * //
translated: What are the branches of the path?

original: brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: brgyad po rnams so //
translated: They are the eightfold noble path.

original: mi slob pa'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path of no learning?

original: lam shes pa'i mtha' las mtha'i skad cig go //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i mtha' las mtha'i skad cig go //
translated: It is the final moment of the end of the knowledge of the path.

original: ci skad du de rnams byang chub kyi phyogs yin /
analyzed: ci skad du de rnams byang chub kyi phyogs yin /
translated: How are they factors of enlightenment?

original: chos rnams kyang gang las yin /
analyzed: chos rnams kyang gang las yin /
translated: What are the dharmas?

original: byang chub kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is enlightenment?

original: smras pa / 'dis thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par bya'o zhes pas byang chub bo //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dis thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par bya'o zhes pas byang chub bo //
translated: It is said: “Enlightenment is that by which one realizes the nature of all things.”

original: ci de khyab pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci de khyab pa yin zhe na /
translated: Is it all-pervading?

original: smras pa khyab byed yin te phyogs gcig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa khyab byed yin te phyogs gcig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said: “It is all-pervading, not partial.”

original: de gang gi phyir gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan gyi byang chub ni nyan thos pa'i byang chub ste /🔽phyogs gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de gang gi phyir gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan gyi byang chub ni nyan thos pa'i byang chub ste / phyogs gcig pa'o //
translated: Because the enlightenment of the śrāvakas is the enlightenment of the selflessness of the person, it is partial.

original: chos rnams rdzas nyid kyis mngon par rtogs pa las /🔽de bzhin du rnam par grol bzhin pa nyan thos kyi byang chub tu nges par gyur pa de'i byang chub ni /
analyzed: chos rnams rdzas nyid kyis mngon par rtogs pa las / de bzhin du rnam par grol bzhin pa nyan thos kyi byang chub tu nges par gyur pa de'i byang chub ni /
translated: The enlightenment of the pratyekabuddhas is partial because it is the realization of the substantiality of only the dharmas.

original: rang gi don tsam gtso bor byed pas ni rnam par ma dag pa nyid kyi phyir nyi tshe ba'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi don tsam gtso bor byed pas ni rnam par ma dag pa nyid kyi phyir nyi tshe ba'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the enlightenment of the śrāvakas is said to be partial because it is the enlightenment of one who is liberated from only the obscurations of the afflictions, and because it is not pure due to its focus on only one’s own welfare.

original: bdag med pa gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid las ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid las ni byang chub ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the characteristic of the selflessness of both the person and the dharmas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni khyab par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir na nyi tshe ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni khyab par byed pa po nyid yin pa'i phyir na nyi tshe ba ma yin te /
