analyzed: phyi rol gyi rdul tshon la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is independent of external things such as colored powders.

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor la sgo bzhi yod pa ji lta ba bzhin du nang du yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad ba /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor la sgo bzhi yod pa ji lta ba bzhin du nang du yang yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad ba /
translated: In order to show that just as the external mandala has four doors, so too the internal one does, it is said:

original: de la lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhi rnams ni /
analyzed: de la lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sgo bzhi rnams ni /
translated: The four doors of the body mandala

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dag dang / khar brjod pa rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dag dang / khar brjod pa rnams so //
translated: are said to be the eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.

original: yang na ji skad gsungs pa'i zhes pa /
analyzed: yang na ji skad gsungs pa'i zhes pa /
translated: Or, as it is said,

original: sngar gsungs pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sgo gsum po rnams kyi cha shas las bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sgo gsum po rnams kyi cha shas las bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: the three doors mentioned above are divided into four parts.

original: g-yon dang g-yas kyi rtsa ni thugs kyi sgo ste dang po'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas kyi rtsa ni thugs kyi sgo ste dang po'o //
translated: The left and right channels are the door of the mind, the first.

original: bdag gi gdan la sogs pa bzhi ni gsung gi sgo ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi gdan la sogs pa bzhi ni gsung gi sgo ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: The four, the seat of the self, and so on, are the door of speech, the second.

original: dgu'i bdag nyid can sku'i sgo ni 'og dang steng gi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dgu'i bdag nyid can sku'i sgo ni 'og dang steng gi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The door of the body, which has nine aspects, is twofold, divided into lower and upper.

original: de ltar sgo bzhi la brten pa'i ka ba gnyis gnyis dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ka ba brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar sgo bzhi la brten pa'i ka ba gnyis gnyis dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ka ba brgyad do //
translated: Thus, because it has two pillars for each of the four doors, there are eight pillars.

original: nang gi mig la sogs pa'i rtsa'i ka ba rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi mig la sogs pa'i rtsa'i ka ba rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the pillars of the inner channels, such as the eye, etc.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa yin pa de bzhin du mnyam pa'i dngos pos lus kyi dkyil 'khor yang gru bzhir shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa yin pa de bzhin du mnyam pa'i dngos pos lus kyi dkyil 'khor yang gru bzhir shes bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the outer maṇḍala is square, so the body maṇḍala should be understood as square by the fact of its evenness.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: From evenness.

original: 'di ni lus 'di ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ni lus 'di ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: This is just like this body.

original: rkang ba'i 'og nas gtsug tor gyi mthar tshad dang ldan pa de bzhin du lag pa brkyang pa na yang tshad de kho na'o //
analyzed: rkang ba'i 'og nas gtsug tor gyi mthar tshad dang ldan pa de bzhin du lag pa brkyang pa na yang tshad de kho na'o //
translated: Just as it is measured from the soles of the feet to the top of the head, so it is when the arms are extended.

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ni thugs dang gsung dang sku'i bdag nyid can gyi 'khor lo gsum la nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste gzhan no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor ni thugs dang gsung dang sku'i bdag nyid can gyi 'khor lo gsum la nyi shu rtsa bzhi ste gzhan no //
translated: The outer maṇḍala has twenty-four spokes of the three wheels of mind, speech, and body, which are different.

original: de bzhin du nang du yang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i rtsa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa @336b spyi bo la sogs pa nas phyin pa'i mthar thug pa'i gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi 'khor lo gsum dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang du yang thugs dang gsung dang sku'i rtsa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa @336b spyi bo la sogs pa nas phyin pa'i mthar thug pa'i gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi 'khor lo gsum dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Likewise, internally, the three wheels are endowed with the nature of the twenty-four sacred seats, beginning with the head and ending with the feet, which are the supports of the channels of mind, speech, and body.

original: mgo bo'i ri bo'i ze'u 'brul //
analyzed: mgo bo'i ri bo'i ze'u 'brul //
translated: The corolla of the mountain of the head.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so forth is the brief explanation.

original: de yang rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi po'i steng du gnas pa'i ri rab kyi rtse mo la gnas pa'i sna tshogs padmar bshad cing khong du chud par bya bzhin bde kho na bzhin du nang du yang lus kyi dkyil 'khor la dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma
analyzed: de yang rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi po'i steng du gnas pa'i ri rab kyi rtse mo la gnas pa'i sna tshogs padmar bshad cing khong du chud par bya bzhin bde kho na bzhin du nang du yang lus kyi dkyil 'khor la dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma
translated: Moreover, just as the summit of Mount Meru, which is located above the four maṇḍalas of wind and so on, is explained and understood to be located in the center of the variegated lotus, likewise, internally, the sign of the maṇḍala is

original: ni / bla ma'i man ngag las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ni / bla ma'i man ngag las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: to be understood from the guru’s instruction on the maṇḍala of the body.🔽The wind that is located in the soles of the feet

original: rkang mthil du ni gnas pa'i rlung //🔽zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rkang mthil du ni gnas pa'i rlung // zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: is the wind that is located in the soles of the feet.

original: mi gsal gsal ba'i gzugs can gyis //
analyzed: mi gsal gsal ba'i gzugs can gyis //
translated: The form of the unclear clarity

original: zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma'i de kho na nyid rgyas par gsungs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pas dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan ma'i de kho na nyid rgyas par gsungs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The reality of the signs of the mandala is taught in detail up to the end of the verse.

original: rkang ba'i mthil du ste rkang ba'i 'og go //
analyzed: rkang ba'i mthil du ste rkang ba'i 'og go //
translated: On the soles of the feet, that is, on the bottoms of the feet.

original: de rlung gnas pa ste gzhu'i rnam pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa las brtsams pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid bee rambha'o //
analyzed: de rlung gnas pa ste gzhu'i rnam pa nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags pa las brtsams pa nyid kyi phyir de nyid bee rambha'o //
translated: That is the abode of the wind, which is superior by the form of a bow, because it is the beginning of the action. Therefore, it is the Vairam.

original: rang gi don la aan te bee kri ta lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi don la aan te bee kri ta lta bu'o //
translated: In one's own aim, it is like the Anekrita.

original: rkang pa'i gnas kyi bdag nyid can gyi bya ba ni be rambha zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'i gnas kyi bdag nyid can gyi bya ba ni be rambha zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The action of the nature of the abode of the feet should be called the Vairam.

original: 'dis ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi byed pa po'i dbyibs kyang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi byed pa po'i dbyibs kyang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches the shape of the agent of the wind mandala.

original: de'i steng du yang yin pa sum mdo'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de'i steng du yang yin pa sum mdo'i phyogs te /
translated: Above that, too, is the place of the triple junction,

original: rked pa'i cha'o //🔽der bud med dang skyes pa dag gi /
analyzed: rked pa'i cha'o // der bud med dang skyes pa dag gi /
translated: which is the waist.🔽There, from the liberation of the blood and jewel of women and men,

original: rakta dang nor bu grol ba nyid las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'bar ba rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: rakta dang nor bu grol ba nyid las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'bar ba rnam par gnas so //
translated: the nature of the triangular fire mandala blazes and abides.

original: de'i steng du sngags kyi phreng ba zlum po zhu zhing sbyor ba las chu'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i steng du sngags kyi phreng ba zlum po zhu zhing sbyor ba las chu'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: On top of that, the round mantra rosary melts and unites, from which arises the water maṇḍala.

original: lto ba'i phyogs su rang bzhin gyis gnas so //
analyzed: lto ba'i phyogs su rang bzhin gyis gnas so //
translated: It naturally abides in the area of the belly.

original: de'i steng du snying gar gru bzhi pa gser lta bu'i sa'i dkyil 'khor yod de /
analyzed: de'i steng du snying gar gru bzhi pa gser lta bu'i sa'i dkyil 'khor yod de /
translated: On top of that, at the heart, there is the square earth maṇḍala, which is like gold.

original: de'i steng gang yin pa mgrin pa'i cha ni /
analyzed: de'i steng gang yin pa mgrin pa'i cha ni /
translated: The area above that is the throat.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na sgal tshigs te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na sgal tshigs te /
translated: In another enumeration, it is the spine.

original: de nyid ni ri rab tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni ri rab tu shes par bya ste /
translated: That should be known as Mount Meru.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rtse mo brgyad dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rtse mo brgyad dang ldan zhing /
translated: It has eight peaks, such as the eyes, and so on.

original: de'i 'dab ma bzhi bo rin po che'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'dab ma bzhi bo rin po che'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its four petals are the nature of jewels.

original: ri rab gang yin pa 'di las mgo bo'i dbus der mi phyed ma la sdogs pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de nyid ni sna tshogs padmar te /
analyzed: ri rab gang yin pa 'di las mgo bo'i dbus der mi phyed ma la sdogs pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de nyid ni sna tshogs padmar te /
translated: From this Mount Meru, in the center of the head, the thirty-two nāḍīs that branch from the avadhūti are the variegated lotus,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan du shes par bya'o //
translated: which should be known as the seat of the Bhagavān.

original: de'i nang du a'a li dang k'a li dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi bdag nyid can byang chub kyi @337a * //
analyzed: de'i nang du a'a li dang k'a li dbyangs dang gsal byed kyi bdag nyid can byang chub kyi @337a * //
translated: Within that are the vowels and consonants, which are the nature of the vowels and consonants.🔽

original: sems sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi god bu klad pa nyid ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: sems sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi god bu klad pa nyid ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: In it, the thirty-two parts of the bodhicitta, which is the nature of the vowels and consonants, are the moon maṇḍala,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi khyad par gyi gdan no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi khyad par gyi gdan no //
translated: which is the special seat of the Bhagavān.

original: gdan rnams rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni bye brag gi rgyud kha cig tu ma gsungs par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gdan rnams rang bzhin gyis grub pa ni bye brag gi rgyud kha cig tu ma gsungs par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the natural formation of the seats is not mentioned in some of the specific tantras.

original: rnam par dag ba'i de kho na nyid ni thams cad kyi tshe smra bar bya ba ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag ba'i de kho na nyid ni thams cad kyi tshe smra bar bya ba ma yin pa'i de kho na nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The reality of complete purity is not to be spoken of at any time, because it is reality.

original: gang zag gi mos pa'i dbang las gang na rnams su rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gi mos pa'i dbang las gang na rnams su rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: It is distinguished in various places according to the inclinations of individuals.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor lo gsum du gnas pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams la kha cig tu zla ba'i gdan dang / kha cig tu nyi ma'i gdan no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor lo gsum du gnas pa'i dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor ma rnams la kha cig tu zla ba'i gdan dang / kha cig tu nyi ma'i gdan no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, it should be understood that the heroes and yoginīs abiding in the three wheels have a moon seat in some places and a sun seat in some places.

original: de yi dbus su zhes pa la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de yi dbus su zhes pa la sogs pa la //
translated: In its center, etc.

original: de yi ste klad pa'i dbus su gzhom du med cing 'gyur ba med pa ham gi yi ge ste /
analyzed: de yi ste klad pa'i dbus su gzhom du med cing 'gyur ba med pa ham gi yi ge ste /
translated: In its center, i.e., in the center of the brain, is the indestructible, unchanging syllable HAṂ.

original: zhu'i bdud rtsi rgyas pa las thig le'i tshor ba bsil ba ni thig le zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhu'i bdud rtsi rgyas pa las thig le'i tshor ba bsil ba ni thig le zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: From the expansion of the nectar of the moon, the sensation of the drop is cool, and it should be called the drop.

original: de ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i bdag nyid dngos po thams cad du 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir rdzogs shing rab tu gnas pa'i gnas rnams kyi de nyid sa bon gyi gzugs kyis gsal zhing /
analyzed: de ni brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i bdag nyid dngos po thams cad du 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir rdzogs shing rab tu gnas pa'i gnas rnams kyi de nyid sa bon gyi gzugs kyis gsal zhing /
translated: That is the reality of all things, moving and unmoving, because it is the transformation of everything. It is clear in the form of the seed of the perfect and stable abodes.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi gzugs kyis ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi gzugs kyis ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: It is not clear in the form of the ultimate mind of enlightenment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: kun gyi ste /
analyzed: kun gyi ste /
translated: it is all.

original: rkang med dang / rkang gnyis dang / rkang bzhi dang / rkad mangs dang / sgong skyes dang / mngal skyes dang / drod gsher skyes dang / rdzus skyes dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / dmyal ba dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang /
analyzed: rkang med dang / rkang gnyis dang / rkang bzhi dang / rkad mangs dang / sgong skyes dang / mngal skyes dang / drod gsher skyes dang / rdzus skyes dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / dmyal ba dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang /
translated: Those without legs, those with two legs, those with four legs, those with many legs, those born from eggs, those born from wombs, those born from heat and moisture, those born by transformation, animals, hungry ghosts, hell beings, gods, demigods,

original: mi rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi'o //
translated: and humans.

original: lus can rnams kyi lus ni /
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi lus ni /
translated: The bodies of embodied beings

original: dang po de kho na las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: dang po de kho na las skyes pa yin te /
translated: are first born from that very [element].

original: pha dang ma snyoms par zhugs ba'i dbang gis gzhan gyi tshon /
analyzed: pha dang ma snyoms par zhugs ba'i dbang gis gzhan gyi tshon /
translated: By the power of the father and mother coming together,

original: bdun rtsi kho na zhu bzhin pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun rtsi kho na zhu bzhin pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: the other seven elements are formed, just as they are.

original: de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das he ru ka'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das he ru ka'i rang bzhin te /
translated: That very [element] is the nature of the Blessed Heruka,

original: chos nyid yin pa nyid kyis chos rnams la khyab pa na /
analyzed: chos nyid yin pa nyid kyis chos rnams la khyab pa na /
translated: and because it pervades all phenomena by being reality itself,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba na yang de gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba na yang de gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it remains even when buddhas appear or do not appear.🔽All phenomena

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: are

original: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: gdod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid kyi phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa nyid kyis /
translated: Because they are not produced from the beginning, they are dependently arisen.

original: 'byung ba'i dngos po 'di rnams nyid kyis 'gog pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dngos po 'di rnams nyid kyis 'gog pa grub pa yin te /
translated: By these very things that arise, cessation is established.

original: 'dir ni 'ga' yang skye ba med //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'ga' yang skye ba med //
translated: Here, nothing at all is produced.

original: 'ga' yang 'chi ba yod min te //
analyzed: 'ga' yang 'chi ba yod min te //
translated: Nothing at all ceases.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin rnam pa ni //🔽'khor bar gnas par shes par bya //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin rnam pa ni // 'khor bar gnas par shes par bya //
translated: The nature of mind

original: @337b zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @337b zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is to be known as abiding in cyclic existence.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po nyid la dmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po nyid la dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: The conceptualization of arising and ceasing does not focus on things themselves.

original: snang ba la dmigs pa yang sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: snang ba la dmigs pa yang sgyu ma dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: And because it focuses on appearances, which are like illusions,

original: dngos po thams cad ni skyes par smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni skyes par smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: one should not say that all things arise.

original: ma skyes shing ma 'gag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma skyes shing ma 'gag par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are not produced and do not cease.

original: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa gsungs pa /
translated: The union of method and wisdom is taught.

original: de nyid kyis te bde ba chen po'i 'khor los rang gi lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyis te bde ba chen po'i 'khor los rang gi lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du'am /
translated: By that very thing, that is, by the wheel of great bliss, one should meditate on the maṇḍala of one’s body.

original: dkyil 'khor ba'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi me dga' bar byed pas na'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba'i rang bzhin gyi ye shes kyi me dga' bar byed pas na'o //
translated: It is “na” because it delights in the fire of the gnosis that is the nature of the maṇḍala.

original: n'a da ni sbrul pa'i 'khor lo'i ze'u 'brur gnas pa'i aa yig ste /
analyzed: n'a da ni sbrul pa'i 'khor lo'i ze'u 'brur gnas pa'i aa yig ste /
translated: The nada is the letter “a” that resides in the pistil of the emanation wheel.

original: 'byed par byed pa ni rang gi gnas las g-yo ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis song ste /
analyzed: 'byed par byed pa ni rang gi gnas las g-yo ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis song ste /
translated: “ It opens” because it moves from its own place by nature.

original: bdud rtsi'i chu 'thung ba la sred pa nyid kyi phyir 'khyog por byas nas rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i chu 'thung ba la sred pa nyid kyi phyir 'khyog por byas nas rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is “bent” because it is thirsty for the water of nectar, and the meaning is that it emerges from the root.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again it is said:

original: n'a da yi ge kun gyi ste //
analyzed: n'a da yi ge kun gyi ste //
translated: The nada is the nature of all letters.

original: byed pa gcig nyid thob pa na //
analyzed: byed pa gcig nyid thob pa na //
translated: When it attains a single function,

original: gang phyir ngag tshig rab dbye bas //
analyzed: gang phyir ngag tshig rab dbye bas //
translated: it is the division of speech and words.

original: lte ba'i phyogs su rnam par gnas //🔽rlung dang nye rlung 'khor lo yi //
analyzed: lte ba'i phyogs su rnam par gnas // rlung dang nye rlung 'khor lo yi //
translated: It resides in the region of the navel.🔽In dependence on the activities of exhalation and so on,

original: ldang sogs bya ba la brten nas //
analyzed: ldang sogs bya ba la brten nas //
translated: the vāyu and the upāyu,

original: rengs pa la sogs rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rengs pa la sogs rang bzhin gyis //
translated: the nature of the stiffening and so on

original: 'jug cing gzhan pa nyid la brten //
analyzed: 'jug cing gzhan pa nyid la brten //
translated: enters and depends on another.

original: dbu ma'i rang bzhin rnam pa bcu'i //
analyzed: dbu ma'i rang bzhin rnam pa bcu'i //
translated: The ten aspects of the nature of the central nāḍī

original: de nyid brten par brjod par bya //
analyzed: de nyid brten par brjod par bya //
translated: should be expressed as the support.

original: bsrub bya srub byed sbyor ba las //
analyzed: bsrub bya srub byed sbyor ba las //
translated: The union of the churned and the churner

original: de ni bde chen byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bde chen byed pa'o //
translated: is the maker of great bliss.

original: gyen du 'bar ba'i rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: gyen du 'bar ba'i rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: By the yoga of the upward blaze,

original: phung sogs dbang po sreg par byed //
analyzed: phung sogs dbang po sreg par byed //
translated: the aggregates and so on are burned.

original: bskal ba'i me gzugs nyid 'di ni //
analyzed: bskal ba'i me gzugs nyid 'di ni //
translated: This form of the fire of the eon

original: kun gyi sdud dang byed po yin //
analyzed: kun gyi sdud dang byed po yin //
translated: is the gatherer and maker of all.

original: zla ba thig le'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: zla ba thig le'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: By the nature of the moon and the bindu,

original: 'gro ba dga' bar byed pa po //
analyzed: 'gro ba dga' bar byed pa po //
translated: it is the maker of the delight of migrating beings.

original: bde chen 'khor lo chen por ni //
analyzed: bde chen 'khor lo chen por ni //
translated: In the great wheel of great bliss,

original: gzhom med yi ge'i gzugs 'chang ba //🔽kha ba'i 'od dang mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: gzhom med yi ge'i gzugs 'chang ba // kha ba'i 'od dang mtshungs pa yi //
translated: it holds the form of the indestructible syllable.

original: byang chub sems las byung ba'i 'od //
analyzed: byang chub sems las byung ba'i 'od //
translated: The light that arises from the bodhicitta🔽is similar to the light of snow.

original: spros te rin chen 'khor lo'i mthar //
analyzed: spros te rin chen 'khor lo'i mthar //
translated: Having emanated to the end of the precious wheel,

original: 'dzag par byed cing rnam par gnas //
analyzed: 'dzag par byed cing rnam par gnas //
translated: it drips and remains.🔽That is the life of all living beings.

original: de nyid srog chags rnams kyi srog / de nyid mchog gi yi ge ste //
analyzed: de nyid srog chags rnams kyi srog / de nyid mchog gi yi ge ste //
translated: That is the supreme syllable.

original: de nyid kun la khyab ste 'di //
analyzed: de nyid kun la khyab ste 'di //
translated: That pervades all this

original: lus kun la ni rnam par gnas //
analyzed: lus kun la ni rnam par gnas //
translated: and exists in all bodies.

original: 'dis ni n'a da 'phel byed de //
analyzed: 'dis ni n'a da 'phel byed de //
translated: This causes the nāḍīs to increase

original: dga' ba'i gnas kyi cha ru 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' ba'i gnas kyi cha ru 'gyur //
translated: and becomes the part of the abode of joy.

original: de nyid dpyid kyi thig le yi //
analyzed: de nyid dpyid kyi thig le yi //
translated: That is to be called the yoga

original: rnal 'byor du ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du ni brjod par bya //
translated: of the Spring Essence.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir de gnyis kyis gdan bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi @338a * //🔽dkyil 'khor ram /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir de gnyis kyis gdan bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyi @338a * // dkyil 'khor ram /
translated: Therefore, those two explain the mandala that has the nature of the Four Seats,

original: sbrul ba la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor tshogs par bshad par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: sbrul ba la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor tshogs par bshad par gyur pa yin te /
translated: or the assembly of the mandala of emanations, and so forth.

original: phyi rol du yang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo rang 'dra dang bcas pas dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo rang 'dra dang bcas pas dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: Even externally, the principal mandala, together with its likeness, will be a complete mandala,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'i tshig gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten gyi dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'i tshig gsungs te /
translated: That itself is the mandala, and so forth. This teaches the definition of the mandala of the support.

original: snying po ste rtsa dang khams dang dpyid dang thig le'i rang bzhin gyi mkha' 'gro ma dang dpa' bo dang dpal he ru ka dang rdo rje phag mo'i rang bzhin yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: snying po ste rtsa dang khams dang dpyid dang thig le'i rang bzhin gyi mkha' 'gro ma dang dpa' bo dang dpal he ru ka dang rdo rje phag mo'i rang bzhin yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because it perfectly holds the nature of the dakinis and heroes, the nature of the essence, the channel, the element, the spring, and the bindu, and the nature of Shri Heruka and Vajravarahi,

original: lus kho na dkyil 'khor du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kho na dkyil 'khor du brjod par bya'o //
translated: the body itself should be called the mandala.

original: manda ni nye ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: manda ni nye ba'i tshig ste /
translated: Manah is a derivative form.

original: len pa'i don las /
analyzed: len pa'i don las /
translated: From the meaning of “to take up,”

original: la ti lad'i rkyen byas pa las so //
analyzed: la ti lad'i rkyen byas pa las so //
translated: it is derived from the condition of “la” and “ti” and “da.”

original: rtsa chen sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pas nang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsa chen sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pas nang gi bdag nyid kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
translated: The thirty-seven major nāḍīs and so on explain the inner purity.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po gang yin pa 'di rnams ni rig pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po gang yin pa 'di rnams ni rig pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of awakening are endowed with pristine consciousness.

original: de rnam par dag pa las /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa las /
translated: From their purity,

original: sngar gsungs pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo kho na dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i rtsa'i 'khor lo kho na dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: the maṇḍala of the cakra of the nāḍīs that were previously explained is the maṇḍala.

original: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpa' bo'i rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpa' bo'i rnam par dag pa gsungs te /
translated: The purity of the hero is explained by the words “bodhicitta” and so on.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa bzhi po de nyid ni rin thang med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'dzag pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin nyi shu rtsa bzhi po de nyid ni rin thang med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The twenty-four natures of the dripping bodhicitta are “a jewel” because they are priceless.

original: rin po che ste lha mo'i 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rin po che ste lha mo'i 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The maṇḍala of the maṇḍala of the wheel of the goddesses is the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor de'i snying po 'dzin par byed pa ni dpa' po'i dkyil 'khor te dkyil 'khor rnams pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de'i snying po 'dzin par byed pa ni dpa' po'i dkyil 'khor te dkyil 'khor rnams pa gnyis so //
translated: The hero's mandala is the one that holds the essence of that mandala.

original: phyi rol du ni gru bzhi pa la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du ni gru bzhi pa la sogs pa yin la /
translated: Externally, it is square, etc.

original: nang du snying ga'i dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo gsum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang du snying ga'i dkyil 'khor ni 'khor lo gsum la sogs pa'o //
translated: Internally, it is the heart mandala, the three wheels, etc.

original: 'dir phyi rol du spyi bo la sogs pa ni dz'a landha ra la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du spyi bo la sogs pa ni dz'a landha ra la sogs pa yin la /
translated: Here, externally, the head, etc. are Jalandhara, etc.

original: nang du ni rtsa dang khams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nang du ni rtsa dang khams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Internally, they are the nature of the channels and elements.

original: dkyil 'khor 'di rnams kyang 'di nyid gcig pu'i ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di rnams kyang 'di nyid gcig pu'i ma yin gyi /
translated: These mandalas are not just of this one.

original: sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba lnga po 'di rnams kyang de'i dkyil 'khor du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba lnga po 'di rnams kyang de'i dkyil 'khor du shes par bya'o //
translated: The various five migrations should be known as its mandalas.

original: de gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni /
translated: That is stated:

original: sna tshogs khyab cing rnam par gnas //
analyzed: sna tshogs khyab cing rnam par gnas //
translated: Diverse, pervasive, and abiding.

original: zhes pa'o // yang na phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnams kyi ste mchod pa de rnams kyis nang gi dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yang na phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnams kyi ste mchod pa de rnams kyis nang gi dkyil 'khor mchod par bya'o //
translated: Or, with those offerings of form, sound, etc. in the external mandala, the internal mandala should be worshipped.

original: nang du bum pa ni ka p'a @338b la'i nang du bdud rtsi lnga rnams bde ba'i mchod pa'i slad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang du bum pa ni ka p'a @338b la'i nang du bdud rtsi lnga rnams bde ba'i mchod pa'i slad du rig par bya'o //
translated: Internally, the vase is to be known as the five nectars in the kapāla for the sake of the offering of bliss.

original: 'dir phyi rol du gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyis dbang po'i sgo rnams mchod par bya la /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyis dbang po'i sgo rnams mchod par bya la /
translated: Here, externally, the doors of the senses are to be worshipped with the five sense objects such as form and so forth.

original: nang du ni grub pa ste rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i rdzas nam mkha' lngar 'dzag pa'i rdzas rnams su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nang du ni grub pa ste rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i rdzas nam mkha' lngar 'dzag pa'i rdzas rnams su gnas pa'o //
translated: Internally, the five substances that drip into the five natural, inherently existing substances are established.

original: don de ni /
analyzed: don de ni /
translated: This meaning is stated by

original: phyi rol du ni gzugs sgra sogs //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni gzugs sgra sogs //
translated: “externally, form, sound, and so forth,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: and so forth.

original: phyi rol du sbom po dang phra mo ni dam tshig sbyin pa'i slad du slob ma rnams la ston par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol du sbom po dang phra mo ni dam tshig sbyin pa'i slad du slob ma rnams la ston par byed do //
translated: Externally, the coarse and subtle are taught to the disciples for the sake of giving the commitments.

original: 'dir ni sbom po dang phra mo'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'dzin pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni sbom po dang phra mo'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'dzin pas /
translated: Here, the vajra-holder of bodhicitta, differentiated by the divisions of coarse and subtle,

original: 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du sgrub par byed pas na /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad sangs rgyas nyid du sgrub par byed pas na /
translated: establishes all migrating beings in buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas nyid dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang dam tshig ste sbyin zhing shar ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis dkyil 'khor 'di kho na las go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang dam tshig ste sbyin zhing shar ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis dkyil 'khor 'di kho na las go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Buddhahood itself and the Bodhisattvahood itself are the commitments, which are given and obtained from this very mandala by the reason of the arising.

original: don 'di ni sbom po dang phra ba la brten nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di ni sbom po dang phra ba la brten nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This meaning is stated in terms of the gross and the subtle.

original: de la sbom po ni khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang / phra ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de la sbom po ni khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams dang / phra ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Therein, the gross is the twenty-four elements, and the subtle is the bodhicitta.

original: yang na sbom po ni sgro las byung ba'i dri ma'i rdzas rnams dang / phra mo ni byang chub kyi snying po zhu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sbom po ni sgro las byung ba'i dri ma'i rdzas rnams dang / phra mo ni byang chub kyi snying po zhu bar byed pa'o //
translated: Or, the gross is the substances of the stains arisen from the veins, and the subtle is that which melts into the essence of enlightenment.

original: yang gsung ba /
analyzed: yang gsung ba /
translated: Again, it is stated:

original: sbom dang phra ba'i rab dbye bas //
analyzed: sbom dang phra ba'i rab dbye bas //
translated: The gross and subtle are the divisions.

original: dngos por rtogs pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: dngos por rtogs pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The realizations of entities are twofold.

original: rags pa'i rdzas ni rnam dgu ste //
analyzed: rags pa'i rdzas ni rnam dgu ste //
translated: The gross substances are the nine.

original: phra mo'i tshil bu grub pa'i rdzas //
analyzed: phra mo'i tshil bu grub pa'i rdzas //
translated: The subtle is the substance of the established marrow.

original: gzhan pa zhu byed rdzas dbye bas //
analyzed: gzhan pa zhu byed rdzas dbye bas //
translated: The other is the division of the substances of the melting.

original: zhes so // phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bos sems can gyi don du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa sbrul bar byed la /
analyzed: zhes so // phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bos sems can gyi don du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa sbrul bar byed la /
translated: Thus, the principal deities of the external mandala emanate sentient beings, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas, Brahmā, and so on, for the sake of sentient beings.

original: nang du ni 'dzag par byed do zhes pas sgo dgu po rnams ni /
analyzed: nang du ni 'dzag par byed do zhes pas sgo dgu po rnams ni /
translated: Internally, they are drawn in.🔽The nine doors are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos dang mig la sogs pa'i sgo rnams ni rang sangs rgyas te /🔽'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang mig la sogs pa'i sgo rnams ni rang sangs rgyas te / 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.🔽The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa rnams ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin la /
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa rnams ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin la /
translated: The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyekabuddhas.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems rnams ni tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams so //🔽'di rnams thams cad dkyil 'khor de nyid las rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems rnams ni tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams so //🔽'di rnams thams cad dkyil 'khor de nyid las rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi nges pa'o //
translated: The doors of the eyes, and so on, are the śrāvakas, and the doors of the eyes, and so on, are the pratyek

original: nang gi khu ba la sogs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi sbyin sreg gsungs te /🔽'dir phyi @339a * //
analyzed: nang gi khu ba la sogs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi sbyin sreg gsungs te / 'dir phyi @339a * //
translated: The inner essence and so forth indicates the inner and outer nature of the fire sacrifice.🔽Here, just as the master of the sesame seed sacrifice satisfies the fire of wisdom from the mouth of the fire of commitment externally,

original: rol du til brdung ba'i slob dpon rnams kyi dam tshig gi me'i kha nas ye shes kyi me tshim par byed pa de kho na bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyis dang / so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan dag dang snyoms par 'jug pa las skyes pa'i khu ba la sogs pa rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang de'i sras kyi dkyil 'khor tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: rol du til brdung ba'i slob dpon rnams kyi dam tshig gi me'i kha nas ye shes kyi me tshim par byed pa de kho na bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyis dang / so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan dag dang snyoms par 'jug pa las skyes pa'i khu ba la sogs pa rnams kyis phung po la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang de'i sras kyi dkyil 'khor tshim par bya'o //
translated: in the same way, one should satisfy the mandala of the buddhas and their sons, the aggregates and so forth, with the objects such as form and so forth, and with the essence and so forth born from the isolations and the meditative stabilizations.

original: shes rab kyi me ni gtum mo ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi me ni gtum mo ste /
translated: The fire of wisdom is caṇḍālī,

original: 'bar zhing rno ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bar zhing rno ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it burns and is sharp.

original: bsreg cing 'bar ba'i phyir 'di ni sbyin sreg tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsreg cing 'bar ba'i phyir 'di ni sbyin sreg tu shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the fire sacrifice, because it burns and blazes.

original: skye mched drug dang khams rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skye mched drug dang khams rnams dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa gsungs te /
translated: The six sense bases and the elements and so forth indicate the offering.

original: 'dir sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis phung po la rnams ni mkha' 'gro lnga dang / skye mched drug ni 'khor los sgyur ba drug dang / khams rnams ni thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa bzhi rnams dang / rtsa sum cu rtsa drug rnams ni ye shes kyi lha mo dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'dir sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis phung po la rnams ni mkha' 'gro lnga dang / skye mched drug ni 'khor los sgyur ba drug dang / khams rnams ni thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa bzhi rnams dang / rtsa sum cu rtsa drug rnams ni ye shes kyi lha mo dang mkha' 'gro ma rnams so //
translated: Here, the aggregates, as previously explained, are the five dakinis, the six sense bases are the six chakravartins, the constituents are the four skull-garland goddesses, and the thirty-six channels are the wisdom goddesses and dakinis.

original: de ltar lha la sogs pa'i gzugs can 'di rnams kyi shes rab dang thabs gnyis po sbyor ba las mchod sbyin gang yin pa de ni mchod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha la sogs pa'i gzugs can 'di rnams kyi shes rab dang thabs gnyis po sbyor ba las mchod sbyin gang yin pa de ni mchod par shes par bya'o //
translated: The offering that is made from the union of the wisdom and means of these deities and so forth is to be understood as the offering.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: rang bzhin med pa'i gnas bsgom pas //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i gnas bsgom pas //
translated: By meditating on the abode of no inherent nature,

original: lha yi gzugs su bsgom de ni //
analyzed: lha yi gzugs su bsgom de ni //
translated: Meditating on the form of the deity,

original: mchod pa chen po'i mchod pa ste //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po'i mchod pa ste //
translated: This is the offering of the great offering,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi sgrub pa'i thabs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi sgrub pa'i thabs //
translated: The means of accomplishment of all buddhas.

original: zhes so // 'di nyid ni /
analyzed: zhes so // 'di nyid ni /
translated: This is also what is meant by:

original: de yis de rnams mchod pa'i phyir //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yis de rnams mchod pa'i phyir // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to make offerings to them.

original: spyi bo yin thod pa ni //
analyzed: spyi bo yin thod pa ni //
translated: The skull is the crown.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i sbyin sreg gi yan lag rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i sbyin sreg gi yan lag rnams gsungs te /
translated: Thus, he mentions the branches of the previously explained fire sacrifice.

original: spyi bo'i thod pa gang yin pa 'di rnams ni mgo bo'i thod pa ste /
analyzed: spyi bo'i thod pa gang yin pa 'di rnams ni mgo bo'i thod pa ste /
translated: The skull on the head is the skull of the head.

original: de nyid zla ba'i bsreg rdzas rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyi phyir bsreg rdzas kyi snod yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid zla ba'i bsreg rdzas rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa nyid kyi phyir bsreg rdzas kyi snod yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Since that is the basis of the moon's fire sacrifice substances, it is the vessel of the fire sacrifice substances, but not the others.

original: de bzhin du g-yon dang g-yas su son pa'i la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ra 'og tu rdzas zhu ba 'bab pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du dgang gzar dang blugs gzar du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yon dang g-yas su son pa'i la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ra 'og tu rdzas zhu ba 'bab pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du dgang gzar dang blugs gzar du shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, since the lalanā and rasanā located on the left and right flow downward, the fire sacrifice substances should be understood as the ladle and the spoon, respectively.

original: sprul ba'i 'khor lo ste ba'i dkyil 'khor ni me thab ste /
analyzed: sprul ba'i 'khor lo ste ba'i dkyil 'khor ni me thab ste /
translated: The navel cakra is the fire altar,

original: der me lhung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der me lhung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fire descends there.

original: bsrub bya dang srub byed yang dag par sbyor ba las /
analyzed: bsrub bya dang srub byed yang dag par sbyor ba las /
translated: From the correct union of the churned and the churner,

original: las kyi ched du gang du 'byung ba ni tshangs ba'i me ste //
analyzed: las kyi ched du gang du 'byung ba ni tshangs ba'i me ste //
translated: the fire that arises for the purpose of action is the fire of Brahmā.

original: de ni sum @339b mdo dang de las 'og tu gsang bar gru gsum du 'bar ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni sum @339b mdo dang de las 'og tu gsang bar gru gsum du 'bar ba yin no //
translated: That is the triangle of fire below the triple junction, blazing in the secret triangle.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word “naturally” is a verbal supplement.

original: phyi rol du yang tshangs pa'i me ni zhi ba can la bstod par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang tshangs pa'i me ni zhi ba can la bstod par byed do //
translated: And externally, the fire of Brahmā is praised as the pacifier.

original: de yang gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: And that is produced from the friction of the churning stick.

original: sbyin sreg brjod nas /
analyzed: sbyin sreg brjod nas /
translated: Having described the fire sacrifice,

original: n'a da sngags zhes brjod par bya //
analyzed: n'a da sngags zhes brjod par bya //
translated: the mantra should be called the nāda.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzlas pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzlas pa gsungs te /
translated: And so on. Recitation is taught.

original: gang 'di ni sngar gsungs pa'i lte ba'i gnas las 'thon pa'i phyir srog gi rlung ste /
analyzed: gang 'di ni sngar gsungs pa'i lte ba'i gnas las 'thon pa'i phyir srog gi rlung ste /
translated: This is the life-force wind, because it emerges from the navel cakra, which was previously described.

original: de nyid ni sngags thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir sngags zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni sngags thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir sngags zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: That should be called the mantra, because it is the cause of all mantras.

original: de nyid kyi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pha gang gi tshe 'khor mor yin pa de ni bzlas pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pha gang gi tshe 'khor mor yin pa de ni bzlas pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: When its movement and so on occur in a continuous cycle, that should be called recitation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gyis bzlas pa 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi thun mong bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gyis bzlas pa 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi thun mong bar gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, this natural recitation is said to be common to all worlds.

original: yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa //
translated: Again it is said:

original: gang yang khams gsum sems can rnams /
analyzed: gang yang khams gsum sems can rnams /
translated: Also, all sentient beings of the three realms,

original: srog dang rtsol ba la brten nas //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba la brten nas //
translated: depending on vitality and exertion,

original: gsang sngags rgyal po zlos bzhin du //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po zlos bzhin du //
translated: while reciting the king of secret mantras,

original: mi shes bsam gtan bsam bya spangs //
analyzed: mi shes bsam gtan bsam bya spangs //
translated: should abandon meditation on the unknowable.

original: zhes so // bzlas pa gsungs nas /🔽dkyil 'khor gnyis med rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: zhes so // bzlas pa gsungs nas / dkyil 'khor gnyis med rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: Having taught the recitation,🔽the meditation is taught by the passage beginning with

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgom pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgom pa gsungs te /
translated: “By the yoga of the nondual mandala,” and so on.

original: phyi rol du ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams la dmigs nas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi so sor snang ba ste nang du ni /
analyzed: phyi rol du ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams la dmigs nas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi so sor snang ba ste nang du ni /
translated: Externally, the appearances of the yogins and yoginīs individually, observing body, speech, and mind, and internally,

original: sprul pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhir phyag rgya'i tshogs la sogs pa so sor snang ba de nyid bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhir phyag rgya'i tshogs la sogs pa so sor snang ba de nyid bsgom pa ste /
translated: the meditation on the appearances of the assemblies of seals and so on in the four mandalas of emanation and so on,

original: rang bzhin na med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin na med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'am /
translated: is nonapprehended because of the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: gnyis su med pa'i dkyil 'khor de nyid ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i dkyil 'khor de nyid ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: That very maṇḍala of non-duality is meditation.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: dngos po med la bsgom pa'i dngos //
analyzed: dngos po med la bsgom pa'i dngos //
translated: The entity of meditation is in the absence of entity.

original: bsgom pa bsgom pa min pa nyid //
analyzed: bsgom pa bsgom pa min pa nyid //
translated: Meditation is not meditation.

original: de ltar dngos po dngos med pas //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po dngos med pas //
translated: Thus, due to the absence of entity,

original: bsgom pa dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: meditation is not observed.

original: zhes so // lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo 'di //
analyzed: zhes so // lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo 'di //
translated: This essence of co-emergence

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor sogs //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor sogs //
translated: is the maṇḍala, etc. of the victors.

original: zhes bya bas nye bar bsdu ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas nye bar bsdu ba gsungs te /
translated: This is the summary statement.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi ni sems can thams cad kyi ste 'di rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi ni sems can thams cad kyi ste 'di rnams kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ste /
translated: The maṇḍala, etc. of the victors is of all sentient beings.

original: dkyil 'khor dang / sbyin sreg dang / mchod sbyin dang / bzlas pa dang / bsgom pa zhes brjod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo de rang bzhin gyi gnas pa yin gyis bcos ma ni ma yin @340a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang / sbyin sreg dang / mchod sbyin dang / bzlas pa dang / bsgom pa zhes brjod pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo de rang bzhin gyi gnas pa yin gyis bcos ma ni ma yin @340a * //
translated: The maṇḍala, fire sacrifice, worship, mantra repetition, and meditation are said to be the essence of co-emergence, which is naturally present, not fabricated.

original: pa'o // bcos ma ni lhan cig skyes pa la bzhugs pa'i don kho na bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'o // bcos ma ni lhan cig skyes pa la bzhugs pa'i don kho na bstan pa yin te /
translated: The fabricated is taught to be the very meaning of abiding in co-emergence.

original: sems can thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni rdo rje 'chang nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: All sentient beings are Vajradhara.

original: dkyil 'khor 'di rnams phyi rol du slob dpon gyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin na nang du su zhig gis zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di rnams phyi rol du slob dpon gyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin na nang du su zhig gis zhes dogs pa la /
translated: If these maṇḍalas are consecrated by the master externally, who is it internally?

original: dkyil 'khor dbang po'i gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dbang po'i gzugs kyis ni //
translated: The maṇḍala is the form of the lord,

original: sems kyi rgyal po slob dpon no //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyal po slob dpon no //
translated: the mind king is the master.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the nature of self-awareness,

original: sems kyi rdo rje 'chang gang yin pa de ni sngar gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / mi phyed pa las khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rdo rje 'chang gang yin pa de ni sngar gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / mi phyed pa las khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: the mind vajra-holder is to be understood from the indivisible maṇḍala previously stated.

original: de nyid ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: de nyid ni slob dpon no //
translated: That is the master.

original: de ni yang dag par rig pa'i cha byad kyis rgyu ba'i phyir slob dpon zhes brjod par bya ste /🔽'di nyid / dkyil 'khor dbang po'i gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: de ni yang dag par rig pa'i cha byad kyis rgyu ba'i phyir slob dpon zhes brjod par bya ste / 'di nyid / dkyil 'khor dbang po'i gzugs kyis ni //
translated: That is to be called “master” because of moving in the guise of the perfect knowledge.

original: zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated by “the maṇḍala is the form of the lord.”

original: 'dir la sogs pa'i sgra phyis par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir la sogs pa'i sgra phyis par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here the word “etc.” is to be seen as elided.

original: shin tu bstan pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu bstan pa gsungs te /
translated: The very clear teaching is stated.

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa thams cad ni 'di nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa thams cad ni 'di nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: All of the mandalas, etc., as they are taught, should be understood in this very [Vajra] Tent.

original: gal te 'dir gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dir gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams ni /
translated: If the mandalas, etc., as they are taught here,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad rnams dang / thig dang / rdul tshon dang / sa yongs su gzung ba dang / spyan drangs pa dang / bzhugs su gsol ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba dang / dkyil 'khor sgrub pa dang / mngon par dbang bskur ba dang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad rnams dang / thig dang / rdul tshon dang / sa yongs su gzung ba dang / spyan drangs pa dang / bzhugs su gsol ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba dang / dkyil 'khor sgrub pa dang / mngon par dbang bskur ba dang /
translated: are the mandala articles, the chalk line, the colored powders, the appropriation of the ground, the invocation, the request to remain, the request to depart, the mandala practice, the actual consecration,

original: khrus dang / gtor ma la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: khrus dang / gtor ma la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: the bathing, the sacrificial cakes, etc.,

original: de rnams nyid ni lus kyi dkyil 'khor du khong du chud par bya zhing /
analyzed: de rnams nyid ni lus kyi dkyil 'khor du khong du chud par bya zhing /
translated: then those very [things] should be understood in the body mandala.

original: shes bar bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes bar bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they should be known.

original: de ltar ni dbus kyi rtsa ni thig dang / rdul tshon ni khu ba dang / gcin la sogs pa rnams dang / gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhis bsdus pa'i rtsa bcu'i sa de rnams su thim pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yongs su 'dzin pa ni sa yongs su gzungs ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar ni dbus kyi rtsa ni thig dang / rdul tshon ni khu ba dang / gcin la sogs pa rnams dang / gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhis bsdus pa'i rtsa bcu'i sa de rnams su thim pa la sogs pa'i rim pas yongs su 'dzin pa ni sa yongs su gzungs ba dang /
translated: In this way, the central channel is the bindu, the colored powders are the semen, the urine, and so on, and the ten nāḍīs that are included in the twenty-four sites dissolve into those sites and so on.

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas spyan drang ba la sogs pa rnams dang / ye shes kyi rim pa ni dkyil 'khor sgrub pa dang / rdo rje nor bu'i bum pa las padma'i gdan la gnas pa'i lha dang lha mo'i 'khor lo la rgyun lhung bas mngon par dbang bskur ba dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim pas spyan drang ba la sogs pa rnams dang / ye shes kyi rim pa ni dkyil 'khor sgrub pa dang / rdo rje nor bu'i bum pa las padma'i gdan la gnas pa'i lha dang lha mo'i 'khor lo la rgyun lhung bas mngon par dbang bskur ba dang /
translated: The stage of wisdom is the accomplishment of the maṇḍala, the actual empowerment conferred by the wheel of the assembly of deities and yoginīs abiding on the lotus seat in the vase of the vajra jewel through the continuous fall,

original: 'di sa ni 'dzags pa lces myang ba ni gtor ma'o @340b zhes rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi chog dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel ba gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las rgyas par bstan pa brgyad pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: 'di sa ni 'dzags pa lces myang ba ni gtor ma'o @340b zhes rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi chog dpyid kyi thig le'i rgya cher 'grel ba gsang ba chen po'i sgron ma las rgyas par bstan pa brgyad pa'i rgyas par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the eighth chapter from the great commentary called Illuminating Lamp on the Spring Tantra of the Completion Stage.

original: // / gang gong du sngags bzlas par gsungs pa'i sngags 'di ni ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: // / gang gong du sngags bzlas par gsungs pa'i sngags 'di ni ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the mantra that was mentioned above as being recited?

original: de lta bu khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand that,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan pa dgu ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan pa dgu ba gsungs te /
translated: the extensive explanation of the ninth chapter is stated by Then, and so on.

original: gang yang rung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang yang rung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Any means

original: gang zhig su yang rung ba'i sems can gyis rang bzhin gyis grub ba'i sngags ni btu ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig su yang rung ba'i sems can gyis rang bzhin gyis grub ba'i sngags ni btu ba ste /
translated: that any sentient being should understand that the mantra that is naturally accomplished is the extraction,

original: de las sngags thams cad rab tu skye'o zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de las sngags thams cad rab tu skye'o zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: and from that all mantras are produced.

original: de la phyi rol du dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa bris te /
analyzed: de la phyi rol du dkyil 'khor gru gsum pa bris te /
translated: In that regard, externally, a triangular maṇḍala is drawn.

original: de'i nang du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ri mo byas nas /
analyzed: de'i nang du padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ri mo byas nas /
translated: Having drawn a figure of an eight-petaled lotus,

original: de'i dbus kyi lte ba la aa yig go //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi lte ba la aa yig go //
translated: in the middle of that, in the center, is the letter A.🔽On the petals, by the division into eight eights, the vowels and consonants are arranged.

original: 'dab ma rnams la brgyad brgyad kyi dbye bas a'a li dang k'a li bkod pa'i bzhi pa dang / lnga ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lnga ba'i lnga ba la sogs pa'i spros pas rtsa ba'i sngags btu bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma rnams la brgyad brgyad kyi dbye bas a'a li dang k'a li bkod pa'i bzhi pa dang / lnga ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis lnga ba'i lnga ba la sogs pa'i spros pas rtsa ba'i sngags btu bar bya'o //
translated: The root mantra is to be extracted by the elaboration of the fifth of the fifth, and so on, in sequence, beginning with the fourth.

original: nang du ni gru gsum pa gang yin pa 'di rnams ni /
analyzed: nang du ni gru gsum pa gang yin pa 'di rnams ni /
translated: Inwardly, those which are triangular are🔽the eight channels in the middle of the root, together with the vowels and consonants. The letter A in the middle of those is the Bhagavān, abiding in the form of all letters, words, and speech, and of great speech.

original: rtsa ba'i dbus kyi rtsa ba brgyad po a'a li dang k'a li dang bcas pa'i dbus su gnas pa'i aa yig ni bcom ldan 'das yi ge dang tshig dang ngag ma lus pa dang ngag chen po'i gzugs kyis rnam par gnas pa de nyid las yi ge rnams
analyzed: rtsa ba'i dbus kyi rtsa ba brgyad po a'a li dang k'a li dang bcas pa'i dbus su gnas pa'i aa yig ni bcom ldan 'das yi ge dang tshig dang ngag ma lus pa dang ngag chen po'i gzugs kyis rnam par gnas pa de nyid las yi ge rnams
translated: From that very [A] the letters

original: gsal bar 'gyur te /🔽de rnams kyang tshig skyes bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gsal bar 'gyur te / de rnams kyang tshig skyes bar byed pa yin la /
translated: become manifest.🔽Those [letters] produce words.🔽Those [words] produce speech,

original: de rnams kyis kyang ngag dang / de rnams kyis kyang ngag chen po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang ngag dang / de rnams kyis kyang ngag chen po ste /
translated: and those [produce] great speech.

original: ji srid du 'jig rten pa'i dngos po'i dbye ba mtha' yas pa dang / chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'o zhes pas /
analyzed: ji srid du 'jig rten pa'i dngos po'i dbye ba mtha' yas pa dang / chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'o zhes pas /
translated: As long as there are the infinite divisions of worldly things and the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma,

original: 'di thams cad ni yi ge las rab tu skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni yi ge las rab tu skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: all of this is produced from the letters.

original: de yang lte ba dang gsang ba dag ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos por brjod pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de yang lte ba dang gsang ba dag ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos por brjod pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Moreover, the navel and the secret place are said to be the support and the supported.

original: sprul ba'i 'khor lo kho na sngags kyi rten yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sprul ba'i 'khor lo kho na sngags kyi rten yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the emanation wheel alone is the support of the mantra.

original: de ltar na aa yi ga ni ris med pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na aa yi ga ni ris med pa ste /
translated: Thus, the letter A is without parts.

original: aa yig las rab tu byung ba'i sngags rnams ni /
analyzed: aa yig las rab tu byung ba'i sngags rnams ni /
translated: The mantras that are produced from the letter A

original: mthun pa'i gzugs kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs byed cing rab tu 'jug pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gzugs kyis zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs byed cing rab tu 'jug pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: perform the group of actions such as pacifying with a concordant form and engage in that, but not in any other way.

original: yongs su shes pa'i de kho na nyid ni sngags so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i de kho na nyid ni sngags so //
translated: The reality of complete knowledge is the mantra.

original: yang gsungs pa /🔽mchog tu mi 'gyur gcig pu pa'i //🔽ngo bo @341a * //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / mchog tu mi 'gyur gcig pu pa'i // ngo bo @341a * //
translated: It is also said:🔽The mantra is the nature

original: nyid kyi sngags kyi ste //
analyzed: nyid kyi sngags kyi ste //
translated: of the one who is supremely unchanging.

original: de yongs shes pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de yongs shes pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: By merely knowing that,

original: sngags rnams 'dir ni las byed do //
analyzed: sngags rnams 'dir ni las byed do //
translated: the mantras will perform their functions here.

original: zhes pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,

original: de nyid phyir na sngags rnams ni //
analyzed: de nyid phyir na sngags rnams ni //
translated: For that very reason, the mantras

original: yi ge'i rang gzugs su mi 'dod //🔽gang phyir rtsa yang 'khyog por ni //
analyzed: yi ge'i rang gzugs su mi 'dod // gang phyir rtsa yang 'khyog por ni //
translated: are not asserted to be the forms of the syllables.🔽Because they are not able to do

original: byed pa tsam du mi nus so //
analyzed: byed pa tsam du mi nus so //
translated: anything more than just bend the channels.

original: zhes so // 'di ni /
analyzed: zhes so // 'di ni /
translated: This is stated by

original: sngags kyi gzugs kyis lus can gyi //
analyzed: sngags kyi gzugs kyis lus can gyi //
translated: The mantras, in the form of the body,

original: las kyi tshogs ni byed pa yin //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin no //🔽yi ge rnams ni lnga bcu nyid //
analyzed: las kyi tshogs ni byed pa yin // zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin no // yi ge rnams ni lnga bcu nyid //
translated: perform the function of the body’s karma.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement “The syllables are fifty” and so on teaches the second.🔽The ālikāli, which is the nature of method and wisdom, is twofold.

original: a'a li rnams thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis gnyis nyid kyi phyir dang / de la a'a li'i sde tshan dor bar byas pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: a'a li rnams thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyis gnyis nyid kyi phyir dang / de la a'a li'i sde tshan dor bar byas pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: Within that, the thirty-two syllables are the ālikāli set.

original: ra dang ksha dag 'og dang steng du 'god pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ra dang ksha dag 'og dang steng du 'god pa'i phyir na /
translated: The ra and kṣa are placed below and above,

original: k'a li sum cu rtsa gnyis kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: k'a li sum cu rtsa gnyis kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: so the kālikāli is only thirty-two.

original: drug cu rtsa bzhir yang dag par rtogs par bya la /
analyzed: drug cu rtsa bzhir yang dag par rtogs par bya la /
translated: One should realize them as sixty-four.

original: brten pa ni dngos sun yi ge lnga bcu rnams so //🔽gzhan gyi sde pa la grags /
analyzed: brten pa ni dngos sun yi ge lnga bcu rnams so // gzhan gyi sde pa la grags /
translated: The basis is the fifty vowels.🔽The fourteen branches of knowledge are the six vedas, such as the Rg Veda, which are known to the other schools,

original: pa'i rig byed la sogs pa rig pa'i gnas bcu bzhi dang / rang gi snge pa la grags pa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga la brten nas /
analyzed: pa'i rig byed la sogs pa rig pa'i gnas bcu bzhi dang / rang gi snge pa la grags pa'i rig pa'i gnas lnga la brten nas /
translated: and the five branches of knowledge known to our own schools.

original: aa yig ni yi ge de rnams nyid kyis 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: aa yig ni yi ge de rnams nyid kyis 'jug par byed do //
translated: The letter A is the entrance to those letters.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: dang po gcig ni dgu dbus na //
analyzed: dang po gcig ni dgu dbus na //
translated: The first one is nine in the middle,

original: bcu yis ma bcings gang yin pa //
analyzed: bcu yis ma bcings gang yin pa //
translated: not bound by the ten.

original: de ni bcings med shes bya gang //
analyzed: de ni bcings med shes bya gang //
translated: That is known as unbound.🔽That is known as the supreme stage.

original: de nyid mchog gi go 'phang rig / dbyangs gsal yi ge rnams kyang ni //
analyzed: de nyid mchog gi go 'phang rig / dbyangs gsal yi ge rnams kyang ni //
translated: The vowels and consonants

original: grangs bcu'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: grangs bcu'i rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: are included in the ten numbers.

original: phan tshun sbyor phyir aas bcings par //
analyzed: phan tshun sbyor phyir aas bcings par //
translated: Because they are mutually joined, they are bound by A.

original: gang gis shes te 'gro ba'i bla //
analyzed: gang gis shes te 'gro ba'i bla //
translated: Whoever knows that is the lord of the world.

original: zhes so // spyod pa'i rig byed yan lag bzhir //
analyzed: zhes so // spyod pa'i rig byed yan lag bzhir //
translated: The four branches of the Veda of action

original: de yi bkod pa rgyas par te //
analyzed: de yi bkod pa rgyas par te //
translated: are its extensive arrangement.

original: rnying pa'i chos kyi bstan bcos su //
analyzed: rnying pa'i chos kyi bstan bcos su //
translated: In the treatises of the ancient Dharma

original: rig pa bcu bzhi 'di rnams so //
analyzed: rig pa bcu bzhi 'di rnams so //
translated: These are the fourteen sciences.

original: sgra dang gtan tshigs rig pa dang // de bzhin kho nar nad dang ni //
analyzed: sgra dang gtan tshigs rig pa dang // de bzhin kho nar nad dang ni //
translated: The science of grammar, the science of logic, the science of the inner,

original: gso ba dang ni bzo rig gnyis //
analyzed: gso ba dang ni bzo rig gnyis //
translated: The science of medicine, and the science of the arts,

original: rig pa'i gnas ni lnga po'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas ni lnga po'o //
translated: These are the five major sciences.

original: 'di rnams thams cad ni aa yig las 'byin par byed do zhes pas yi ge thams cad kyi dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad ni aa yig las 'byin par byed do zhes pas yi ge thams cad kyi dbang phyug ste /
translated: All of these are produced from the letter A. Thus, it is the lord of all letters.

original: de dor nas de rnams 'don pa ni yod pa ma yin no //🔽'di ni / rig byed sogs su yang dag gnas //
analyzed: de dor nas de rnams 'don pa ni yod pa ma yin no // 'di ni / rig byed sogs su yang dag gnas //
translated: Without it, they cannot be produced.

original: zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated in the line:🔽It is the basis of the Vedas and so forth.🔽The activities of the letters are engaged in the following:

original: zhi ba dang drag po dang gnyis ka'i rang bzhin gyi sngags dang / phyir bzlog pa la sogs pa dang // srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / @341b phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dang / sngar bshad pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnams te /
analyzed: zhi ba dang drag po dang gnyis ka'i rang bzhin gyi sngags dang / phyir bzlog pa la sogs pa dang // srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / @341b phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dang / sngar bshad pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnams te /
translated: mantras of the peaceful, wrathful, and both natures, repelling and so forth, protection wheels, external treatises, and the previously explained sciences.

original: 'di rnams su yi ge'i byed pa rab tu 'jug gi / gzhan du na cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams su yi ge'i byed pa rab tu 'jug gi / gzhan du na cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the activities of the letters are engaged in these, but not in the slightest elsewhere.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sngags btu ba 'di ni thams cad du rnam pa mi rtog pa yin par rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la sogs pa rnams su khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags btu ba 'di ni thams cad du rnam pa mi rtog pa yin par rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud la sogs pa rnams su khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: this extraction of the mantra is to be understood in all the yoginī tantras and so forth as being nonconceptual.🔽That meaning is stated by

original: don de ni /
analyzed: don de ni /
translated: this:

original: gzhan du cung zad yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du cung zad yod ma yin // zhes bya bas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It does not exist elsewhere in the least.🔽What is this mantra?

original: sngags 'di ni ci zhig /'khor ni su /
analyzed: sngags 'di ni ci zhig /'khor ni su /
translated: What is the retinue?

original: gnas ni gang du yin /
analyzed: gnas ni gang du yin /
translated: What is the place?

original: grangs ni ji tsam zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: grangs ni ji tsam zhes dogs pa la /
translated: How many are there?🔽To address those qualms, the text says, “The middle one, the one that has arrived, and so on,”

original: aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha / dbus su son pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gsungs te /
analyzed: aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha / dbus su son pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: sde pa so so las yi ge dang po blangs pa ste /
analyzed: sde pa so so las yi ge dang po blangs pa ste /
translated: The first letter is taken from each group.

original: a'a li k'a li gang yin pa ni ngag ma lus pa'i rang bzhin te rgyu yin la /
analyzed: a'a li k'a li gang yin pa ni ngag ma lus pa'i rang bzhin te rgyu yin la /
translated: The ālikāli that is the nature of all speech is the cause.

original: sde tshan ni brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sde tshan ni brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The groups are eight.

original: de nyid ni yi ge lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni yi ge lnga bcu ste /
translated: That is the fifty letters.

original: a'a li k'a li rnams mnyam du byas pa las ni drug cu rtsa bzhir yang dag par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: a'a li k'a li rnams mnyam du byas pa las ni drug cu rtsa bzhir yang dag par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: When the ālikāli are made equal, they should be understood as sixty-four.

original: rtsa so so la yi ge re re bsams pa las sprul pa'i 'khor lo la rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i yi ge lnga bcu po 'di rnams nyid brgyad pa brgyad kyis dbye bas tha dad pa'i 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha drug cu rtsa bzhi'i rang🔽bzhin yin te /
analyzed: rtsa so so la yi ge re re bsams pa las sprul pa'i 'khor lo la rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i yi ge lnga bcu po 'di rnams nyid brgyad pa brgyad kyis dbye bas tha dad pa'i 'khor lo sdom pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha drug cu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: From the contemplation of each syllable in each nāḍī, these fifty naturally existing syllables in the emanation wheel are differentiated by the eight sets of eight, which are the nature of the sixty-four deities of the Cakrasaṃvara maṇḍala.

original: phyogs dang phyogs bral brgyad rnams su rnam par gnas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs bral brgyad rnams su rnam par gnas par shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood to exist in the eight directions and intermediate directions.

original: de rnams dbus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbus kyi gtso bo gsungs te /
analyzed: de rnams dbus kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbus kyi gtso bo gsungs te /
translated: The central one is stated with “those in the center,” and so on.

original: a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin can gyi rtsa de rnams kyi dbus su mchog gi dbang phyug ste mchog gi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor pa'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge de rnams kyi dbang phyug 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li'i rang bzhin can gyi rtsa de rnams kyi dbus su mchog gi dbang phyug ste mchog gi dpa' bo dang rnal 'byor pa'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge de rnams kyi dbang phyug 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: The supreme Īśvara, the supreme hero and yogin, is the lord of those syllables in the center of those nāḍīs, which have the nature of ālikāli.

original: de bzhin du ma ning gi sa bon bzhi po yongs su dor nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma ning gi sa bon bzhi po yongs su dor nas /
translated: Similarly, having abandoned the four neutral seeds,

original: aa yig la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu gnyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu gnyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The twelve letters beginning with a are the twelve arms of the Lord.

original: bsregs pa'i sa bon bzhi po ni /
analyzed: bsregs pa'i sa bon bzhi po ni /
translated: The four seed syllables of the burnt offerings are

original: mkha' 'gro ma dang / l'a ma dang / dum skyes ma dang / gzugs can ma rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dang / l'a ma dang / dum skyes ma dang / gzugs can ma rnams so //
translated: Dakini, Lāmā, Khaṇḍarohā, and Rūpiṇī.

original: ka yig la sogs pa ha yig gi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: ka yig la sogs pa ha yig gi mthar thug pa /
translated: The letters ka through ha

original: ma yig thig les mtshan pa ni 'khor lo gsum gyi dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams so //
analyzed: ma yig thig les mtshan pa ni 'khor lo gsum gyi dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams so //
translated: marked with the anusvāra are the heroes and heroines of the three wheels.

original: sa la sogs pa ha yig gi mthar thug pa rnams ni khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ha yig gi mthar thug pa rnams ni khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The letters sa through ha are the Kākāsyā and so forth.

original: ksha yig ni zad pa'i mkha' 'gro yin la /
analyzed: ksha yig ni zad pa'i mkha' 'gro yin la /
translated: The letter kṣa is the exhausted dakini.

original: @342a * // dbus su aa yig ni rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: @342a * // dbus su aa yig ni rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: The letter a in the center is Vajravārāhī.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni sde tshan brgyad po 'di rnams kyis bskor ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni sde tshan brgyad po 'di rnams kyis bskor ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, she is surrounded by these eight classes.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i aa yig kho na sngags thams cad kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i aa yig kho na sngags thams cad kyi rgyu ste /
translated: The supreme unchanging letter a is the cause of all mantras.

original: des na 'dis sngags 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis sngags 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, she is the one who utters the mantras.
